TEXT.English: 3D Modeling
TEXT.French: Modélisation 3D

TEXT.English: [TAB]In 3D computer graphics, 3D modeling is the process of developing a mathematical, wireframe representation of any three-dimensional object (either inanimate or living) via specialized software. The product is called a 3D model. It can be displayed as a two-dimensional image through a process called 3D rendering or used in a computer simulation of physical phenomena. The model can also be physically created using 3D Printing devices.
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]3D Modelling[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Design Studio[COLOR_REVERT].

[SPACE]"No one who has experienced the intense involvement of computer modeling would deny that the temptation exists to use any data input that will enable one to continue playing what is perhaps the ultimate game of solitaire." - James Lovelock
Absolutism

[TAB]Absolutism is a historiographical term used to describe a form of monarchical power that is unrestrained by any other institutions, such as churches, legislatures, or social elites. [PARAGRAPH:2]Absolutism is typically used in conjunction with some European monarchs during the transition from feudalism to capitalism, and monarchs described as "absolute" can especially be found in the 17th century through the 19th century. Absolutism is characterized by the end of feudal partitioning, consolidation of power with the monarch, rise of state power, unification of the state, and a decrease in the influence of nobility.
[SPACE]"All parties without exception, when they seek for power, are varieties of absolutism." - Pierre-Joseph Proudhon
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Absolutism[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taj Mahal[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Versailles[COLOR_REVERT] wonders.
Advanced Computers
TEXT.French: Ordinateurs avancés
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Komputery

TEXT.English: [TAB]Advanced Computers
[SPACE]"Supercomputers will achieve one human brain capacity by 2010, and personal computers will do so by about 2020." - Ray Kurzweil
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Les super-ordinateurs vont atteindre la capacité d'un cerveau humain d'ici à 2010, et les ordinateurs personnels le feront en 2020 environ." - Ray Kurzweil
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Superkomputer osiágnie jedná ludzká pojemnoäâ mózgu okoôo 2010 roku a komputery osobiste okoôo 2020 roku." - Ray Kurzweil

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Computers[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Assault Droid[COLOR_REVERT] units and build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Computer Center[COLOR_REVERT] National Wonder. This tech also enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fuzzy Logic[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]informatique avancée[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centre informatique[COLOR_REVERT] dans vos villes et permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]droïds d'assaut[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. permet la promotion '[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]logique troublante[COLOR_REVERT]'.

TEXT.English: Advanced Rocketry
TEXT.French: Propulsion avancée des fusées
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Rakiety

TEXT.English: [TAB]At the end of World War II, competing Russian, British, and US military and scientific crews raced to capture technology and trained personnel from the German rocket program. Russia and Britain had some success, but the United States benefited the most. The US captured a large number of German rocket scientists (many of whom were members of the Nazi Party, including von Braun) and brought them to the United States as part of Operation Overcast. In America, the same rockets that were designed to rain down on Britain were used instead by scientists as research vehicles for developing the new technology further. The V-2 evolved into the American Redstone rocket, used in the early space program. [PARAGRAPH:2]After the war, rockets were used to study high-altitude conditions, by radio telemetry of temperature and pressure of the atmosphere, detection of cosmic rays, and further research; notably for the Bell X-1 to break the sound barrier. This continued in the US under von Braun and the others, who were destined to become part of the US scientific complex. [PARAGRAPH:2]Independently, in the Soviet Union's space program research continued under the leadership of the chief designer Sergei Korolev. With the help of German technicians, the V-2 was duplicated and improved as the R-1, R-2 and R-5 missiles. German designs were abandoned in the late 1940s, and the foreign workers were sent home. A new series of engines built by Glushko and based on inventions of Aleksei Mihailovich Isaev formed the basis of the first ICBM, the R-7. The R-7 launched the first satellite- Sputnik 1, and later Yuri Gagarin-the first man into space, and the first lunar and planetary probes. This rocket is still in use today. These prestigious events attracted the attention of top politicians, along with additional funds for further research. [PARAGRAPH:2]Rockets became extremely important militarily as modern intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) when it was realized that nuclear weapons carried on a rocket vehicle were essentially not defensible against once launched, and ICBM/Launch vehicles such as the R-7, Atlas and Titan became the delivery platform of choice for these weapons.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Rakieta to pojazd latajácy lub pocisk, napêdzany silnikiem rakietowym. Obiekt ten uzyskuje siôê ciágu dziêki reakcji szybko wyrzucanych gazów spalinowych lub innych mediów (np. sprêëone gazy, przegrzana para) z dysz silnika rakietowego, zgodnie z trzeciá zasadá dynamiki Newtona. Czêsto pojêcie rakiety jest uëywane w znaczeniu silnika rakietowego lub pocisku rakietowego. Rakiety sôuëá miêdzy innymi do przenoszenia ôadunku, np. statku kosmicznego, gôowic bojowych, sztucznych satelitów w warunkach przestrzeni kosmicznej, gdzie nie ma ëadnej zewnêtrznej substancji, której pojazd mógôby uëyâ jako elementu napêdzajácego.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"All I desired was to be true to my way of life, to uphold the science of rocketry in my country and to retire with a clean conscience" - Abdul Kalam
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Tout ce que je désirais était de rester fidèle à ma façon de vivre, de faire connaître la science des fusées dans mon pays et de me retirer avec la conscience tranquille" - Abdul Kalam
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Wszystko, co pragnáôem miaôo zgodne z mojá drogá ëycia, przestrzec przed nauká o rakietach w moim kraju i odejäâ z czystym sumieniem" - Abdul Kalam

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Rocketry[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SAM Infantry[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Armor M60[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Attack Submarine[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tactical Nuke[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] units. It enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Antitank Defense[COLOR_REVERT] promotions.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fuséologie avancée[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bazookas[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre mécanisée[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]sous-marins d'attaque[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]sonar[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre sous-marine[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missiles tactiques[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fission[COLOR_REVERT]). Cela active la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]défense anti-char[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fuséologie avancée[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bazookas[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre mécanisée[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]sous-marins d'attaque[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]sonar[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre sous-marine[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missiles tactiques[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fission[COLOR_REVERT]). Cela active la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]défense anti-char[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Shielding
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Pole Siôowe

TEXT.English: [TAB]In recent years great strides have been made in improving arcology shielding. The newer shields are far stronger than the originals; unfortunately they are also extremely expensive. They have a significant environmental impact, as well: the shields emit an extremely annoying high-pitched whining sound. Studies have shown that prolonged exposure to this sound causes heightened anxiety in humans, and, if continued indefinitely, leads to increased hostility, anger, and eventually to insanity.[PARAGRAPH:2]Significant efforts are being made to remove or at least reduce this sound. In the meantime, most cities leave these shields turned off until the city is under imminent threat; when the shields are turned on the cities attempt to mask the whining sound by playing loud, incessant "muzak" through huge speakers atop every building in the dome.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Au cours des dernières années, les boucliers d'arcologie ont été très nettement améliorés. Ces nouveaux boucliers sont plus résistants, mais aussi beaucoup plus chers. Autre inconvénient : leur impact sur l'environnement. Les boucliers émettent en permanence des sifflements stridents. Des études ont démontré qu'une exposition prolongée à ces sifflements accroît le stress et peut conduire à un sentiment de colère, d'agressivité, pouvant mener à la folie. [PARAGRAPH:2]Des efforts ont été faits pour supprimer, ou du moins réduire, ces sifflements. Toutefois, la plupart des villes ont opté pour une solution plus radicale : les boucliers sont désactivés tant qu'aucune menace n'est détectée et lorsqu'ils sont remis en service, les villes tentent de masquer les sifflements en diffusant une musique de fond dans les haut-parleurs des dômes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In den letzten Jahren erzielte man große Fortschritte bei der Verbesserung von Arkologieschilden. Die neueren Modelle sind weitaus robuster als ihre Vorläufer, aber leider auch extrem teuer. Außerdem haben sie gravierende Auswirkungen auf die Umwelt, denn die Schilde sondern einen extrem hohen Heulton ab. Wissenschaftliche Untersuchungen haben gezeigt, dass Menschen, die diesem Ton längere Zeit ausgesetzt sind, unter stärkeren Angstzuständen leiden und, wenn er ununterbrochen zu hören ist, aggressiv, gewalttätig und schließlich sogar wahnsinnig werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um hier Abhilfe zu schaffen, wird gegenwärtig intensiv nach einer Methode geforscht, mit der diese Geräuschkulisse beseitigt oder zumindest gedämpft werden kann. Bis dahin lassen die meisten Städte ihre Schilde ausgeschaltet, sofern sie keiner konkreten, unmittelbaren Bedrohung ausgesetzt sind. Und wenn sie doch eingeschaltet werden müssen, versucht man, den Heulton durch unaufhörliches Abspielen sehr lauter Fahrstuhlmusik zu überdecken, die mittels riesiger Lautsprecher auf jedem Gebäude innerhalb der Kuppel ausgegeben wird.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Negli anni recenti sono stati fatti grossi passi avanti nel migliorare gli scudi dell'arcologia. I più recenti scudi sono molto più forti di quelli originali ma, sfortunatamente, sono anche estremamente costosi. Hanno anche un importante impatto ambientale: emettono un suono acuto e lamentoso estremamente irritante. Gli studi hanno dimostrato che una prolungata esposizione a questo suono causa negli umani un'elevata ansietà e, se continuato, porta a un'accresciuta ostilità, rabbia e infine alla pazzia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si stanno facendo grandi sforzi per eliminare o almeno ridurre questo suono. Nel frattempo, la maggior parte delle città ha disattivato gli scudi fino a quando non saranno in immediato pericolo. Quando vengono attivati gli scudi, le città cercano di mascherarne il suono riproducendo incessantemente musica di sottofondo ad alto volume, attraverso enormi altoparlanti posti in cima a ogni edificio nella cupol
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En los últimos años se han producido grandes avances en los escudos arcológicos. Los últimos son mucho más resistentes que los primeros, pero, desgraciadamente, también son muy caros. Además, tienen un impacto ambiental muy significativo: los escudos emiten un chirrido agudo de lo más insoportable. Los estudios demuestran que una exposición prolongada a este sonido aumenta la ansiedad en los humanos y, si es de forma indefinida, puede llevar a un aumento de la hostilidad, la ira y finalmente a la locura.[PARAGRAPH:2]Se están llevando a cabo importantes esfuerzos para eliminar o, al menos, reducir este sonido. Mientras tanto, la mayoría de las ciudades mantienen los escudos apagados hasta que la ciudad se encuentra en un peligro inminente. Cuando se encienden los escudos, las ciudades tratan de tapar el chirrido haciendo sonar el hilo musical al máximo volumen mediante los enormes altavoces que hay en lo alto de cada edificio de la bóved
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]W ostatnich latach poczyniono ogromne postêpy w poprawie ochrony arkologicznej. Nowe Pola Siôowe sá duëo silniejsze nië poprzednie, niestety sá jednak ekstremalnie kosztowne i majá znaczny wpôyw na ärodowisko - emitujá bardzo uciáëliwy déwiêk o wysokich czêstotliwoäciach. Przeprowadza siê obecnie kosztowne próby ograniczenia tego déwiêku. Dopóki nie zakoñczá siê one sukcesem, tarcze bêdá wôáczane jedynie wtedy, kiedy miasto znajdzie siê w niebezpieczeñstwie.

TEXT.English: "I very much dislike these new shields of yours - they block out the stars and give one a dangerous sense of invulnerability." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosopher
TEXT.French: "Je n'aime vraiment pas ces nouveaux boucliers : ils cachent les étoiles et donnent une dangereuse impression d'invulnérabilité." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-philosophe
TEXT.German: "Ich verabscheue diese neue Schildtechnologie - sie versperrt die Sicht auf die Sterne und vermittelt ein gefährliches Gefühl von Unverwundbarkeit." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosoph
TEXT.Italian: "Ho una grande avversione per questi vostri scudi: tagliano fuori le stelle e danno un pericoloso senso di invulnerabilità." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecno-filosofo
TEXT.Spanish: "Me disgustan mucho esos nuevos escudos vuestros: nos tapan las estrellas y nos dan un peligroso sentimiento de invulnerabilidad." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecnofilósofo
TEXT.Polish: "Smucá mnie te Wasze nowe tarcze. Odcinajá Was od gwiazd i dajá niebezpieczná iluzje Niezniszczalnoäci." - Kim Lau 0X2, Technofilozof

Civ4GameText.TEXT: TXT_KEY_TECH_ADVANCED_SHIELDING_STRATEGY [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Shielding[COLOR_REVERT] enables construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Advanced Shielding[COLOR_REVERT] for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologies[COLOR_REVERT]. It allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Shield[COLOR_REVERT] and allows to upgrade your units with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Electro-Magnetic Armor MK III[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Shielding III[COLOR_REVERT]. Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]bouclier avancé[COLOR_REVERT] active la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bouclier avancé[COLOR_REVERT] pour les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]arcologies[COLOR_REVERT]. Il permet la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bouclier national[COLOR_REVERT] et permet de recruter des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars dreadnought[COLOR_REVERT] et permet de procurer la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bouclier électro-magnétique MK III[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bouclier III[COLOR_REVERT]. =

TEXT.English: Advanced Warmachines
TEXT.French: Machines de guerre avancées
TEXT.Polish: Zaaw. Maszyny Wojenne

TEXT.English: [TAB]Advanced warmachines incorporate limited sentient AI, quantum computers and global awareness in addition to traditional All-Terrain-Vehicle and armoured design. This means they can operate in any environment at maximum efficiency, with minimal friendly fire. However, advanced warmachines do not always operate on the frontline. They can also conduct esipionage faster and safer than any human can, as they will not succumb to torture.

[SPACE]"War has changed. Its no longer about nations, ideologies, or ethnicity. Its an endless series of proxy battles fought by mercenaries and machines. War - and its consumption of life - has become a well-oiled machine. War has changed. ID-tagged soldiers carry ID-tagged weapons, use ID-tagged gear. Nanomachines inside their bodies enhance and regulate their abilities. Genetic control. Information control. Emotion control. Battlefield control. Everything is monitored and kept under control. War has changed. The age of deterrence has become the age of control... All in the name of averting catastrophe from weapons of mass destruction. And he who controls the battlefield... controls history. War has changed. When the battlefield is under total control... War becomes routine." - Solid Snake ("Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots")
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La guerre a changé. Ses propos ne sont plus les nations, les idéologies, ou l'origine ethnique. c'est une interminable série de batailles par procuration menée par des mercenaires et des machines. La Guerre - et sa consommation de vies - est devenue une machine bien huilée. La guerre a changé. soldats ID-taggés portent des armes ID-taggés, utilisent des engins ID-taggés. Les Nanomachines dans leur corps renforcent et régulent leurs capacités. Le contrôle génétique. Le contrôle de l'information. la maîtrise des émotions. Le contrôle du Champ de Bataille. Tout est surveillé et sous contrôle. La guerre a changé. L'âge de la dissuasion est devenue l'âge du contrôle ... Tout cela pour éviter les catastrophes liées aux d'armes de destruction massive. Et celui qui contrôle le champ de bataille ... contrôle l'histoire. La guerre a changé. Lorsque le champ de bataille est sous contrôle total ... Guerre devient une routine." - Solid Snake ("Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots")
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Nie moëna twierdziâ, ëe cywilizacja siê nie rozwija. Wszak w kaëdej nowej wojnie zabijajá ludzi w ulepszony sposób" - Will Rogers

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Warmachines[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Assault Mech[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Dreadnought Armor[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Battleship[COLOR_REVERT].
Aerodynamics
TEXT.French: Aérodynamique
TEXT.Polish: Aerodynamika

TEXT.English: [TAB]Around the time of World War II, great leaps were made in the field of aviation. The military demands of the war necessitated the development of aircraft designed for long-range bombing, and for the transportation of troops and equipment. Although advances in aviation were made all over the world during this time, the Germans were particularly adept in the development of advanced flight technologies; there was particularly strong advancement in the field of rocket propulsion as this was the one area where the Treaties of Versailles after World War I had not forbidden military growth. In 1944, they developed the V-2, the first truly guided missile, capable of delivering 2000 pounds of explosives to targets nearly 200 miles away. The Germans also developed the Me 262, the first jet fighter plane, which was first used in 1945. Although both the V-2 and the Me 262 came too late to affect the outcome of World War II, both of these advances paved the way for the advanced flight technologies of today, as the technology was avidly retrieved by the victorious powers after the war, regardless of any immoral acts that the individuals concerned might have committed.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Aerodynamika jest to dziaô fizyki, mechaniki pôynów, zajmujácy siê badaniem zjawisk zwiázanych z ruchem gazów, a takëe ruchu ciaô staôych w oärodku gazowym i siô dziaôajácych na te ciaôa. Ze wzglêdu na metody badawcze wyróënia siê aerodynamikê teoretyczná i doäwiadczalná. W aerodynamice doäwiadczalnej stosuje siê czêsto tak zwany tunel aerodynamiczny, czyli komorê umoëliwiajácá symulacjê rzeczywistych zjawisk zachodzácych podczas ruchu obiektów w oärodku gazowym.Z uwagi na prêdkoäci przepôywów rozróënia siê aerodynamikê maôych prêdkoäci oraz aerodynamikê duëych prêdkoäci. Dziaô aerodynamiki zajmujácy siê ruchem ciaô w rozrzedzonych gazach, np. w górnych warstwach atmosfery, to aerodynamika molekularna.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"According to classical aerodynamics, it is impossible for a bumblebee to fly" - Doctor Who
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Selon l'aérodynamique classique, il est impossible pour un bourdon de voler" - Doctor Who
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Latam, bo to uwalnia mój umysô z tyranii nieistotnych rzeczy." - Antoine de Saint-Exupery

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aerodynamics[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Range I[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Extra Fuel Tank[COLOR_REVERT] promotions for Air units. It allows cities to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombers[COLOR_REVERT] and upgrade [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airfields[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airports[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Cette tech. active les promotions [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]portée I[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]carburant suppl.[COLOR_REVERT] pour les unités aériennes. Permet aux villes de recruter un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]parachustiste[COLOR_REVERT], un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bombardier[COLOR_REVERT] et une [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bombe-A[COLOR_REVERT] et d'améliorer l' [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aéroport[COLOR_REVERT] en [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aéroport commercial[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Agricultural Engineering
TEXT.French: Science agronomique
TEXT.Polish: Agrotechnika

TEXT.English: [TAB]Agricultural engineers design agricultural machinery, equipment, and agricultural structures. Agricultural Engineers may perform tasks as planning, supervising and managing the building of dairy effluent schemes, irrigation, drainage, flood and water control systems, perform environmental impact assessments and interpret research results and implement relevant practices. -- Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Agrotechnika jest technologiá stosowaná przy uprawie roli i roälin w celu uzyskania obfitych plonów wysokiej jakoäci. Do zabiegów agrotechnicznych naleëá: uprawa roli, nawoëenie, siew i sadzenie, nawadnianie, pielêgnowanie, ochrona roälin, zbiór i przechowywanie ziemiopôodów. Udoskonalenie i wôaäciwe stosowanie agrotechniki umoëliwia uzyskiwanie coraz wyëszych plonów roälin uprawnych, i to zarówno pod wzglêdem iloäciowym, jak i jakoäciowym, przy równoczesnym staôym podnoszeniu ëyznoäci gleby. Wysokoäâ uzyskiwanych plonów stanowi wypadkowá oddziaôywania zespoôu czynników siedliskowych na pewne procesy fizjologiczne zachodzáce w roälinach. Przy zôych warunkach siedliskowych i niskim poziomie agrotechniki, czyli w ekstensywnej gospodarce rolnej, kaëdy zabieg agrotechniczny poprawiajácy chociaëby w niewielkim stopniu warunki bytowania roälin pozwala na zwiêkszenie plonów o kilkanaäcie lub nawet kilkadziesiát procent. Natomiast w gospodarce intensywnej dalsze podnoszenie wysokoäci plonów jest coraz trudniejsze do osiágniêcia. Przy wszystkich zabiegach agrotechnicznych niezwykle waëná rolê odgrywa terminowe ich wykonywanie, które uzaleënione jest w znacznym stopniu od warunków pogodowych. Agrotechnika powinna byâ dostosowana równieë do warunków glebowych i wymagañ roälin.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Second to agriculture, humbug is the biggest industry of our age." - Alfred Nobel
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Juste après l'agriculture, la fumisterie est la plus grande industrie de notre époque." - Alfred Nobel
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Po drugie agrokultura, oszustwo jest najwiêkszym przemysôem naszych czasów." - Alfred Nobel

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agricultural Engineering[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Modern Granary[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cereal Mills[COLOR_REVERT]. It also improves the output of your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farm[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orchard[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantation[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Winery[COLOR_REVERT] improvements.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]ingénierie agronome[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]silos à grain[COLOR_REVERT] et améliore le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fermes[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]plantations[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]exploitations viticoles[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]vergers[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]oliveraies[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Agricultural Tools
TEXT.French: Outils pour l'agriculture
TEXT.Polish: Narzêdzia Rolnicze

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the basic mouldboard plough the depth of the cut is adjusted by lifting against the runner in the furrow, which limited the weight of the plough to what the ploughman could easily lift. This limited the construction to a small amount of wood (although metal edges were possible). These ploughs were fairly fragile, and were unsuitable for breaking up the heavier soils of northern Europe. The introduction of wheels to replace the runner allowed the weight of the plough to increase, and in turn allowed the use of a much larger mouldboard faced in metal. These heavy ploughs led to greater food production and eventually a significant population increase around 600 a.d. Heavy Iron ploughs were invented in Han Dynasty China around 100 BC. Despite a number of innovations, the Romans never achieved the heavy wheeled mouldboard plough. The first indisputable appearance after the Roman period is from 643, in a northern Italian document[2]. Old words in connected with the heavy plough and its use appear in Slavic, suggesting possible early use in this region. The general adoption of the mouldboard plough in Europe appears to have accompanied the adoption of the three-field system in the later eighth and early ninth centuries, leading to an improvement of the agricultural productivity per unit of land in northern Europe.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Narzêdzia rolnicze specjalne urzádzenia techniczne (narzêdzie) uëywane w rolnictwie w celu udoskonalenia produkcji. Elementy robocze, w zaleënoäci od rodzaju narzêdzi, mogá obracaâ siê wokóô osi, dziêki oporowi jakie stwarza podôoëe w trakcie ich pracy, lub teë pozostawaâ nieruchome.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Agriculture represents the single most profound ecological change in the entire 3.5 billion-year history of life." -Niles Eldredge "The Sixth Extinction"
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"L'Agriculture représente le seul profond changement écologique de tous les 3.5 milliards d'années de l'Histoire de la Vie." -Niles Eldredge "The Sixth Extinction"
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]""Rolnictwo reprezentuje najgôêbszá ekologiczná przemianê w caôej 3.5 miliardowej historii ëycia." -Nil Eldredge "The Sixth Extinction"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agricultural Tools[COLOR_REVERT] improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Watermills[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]outils pour l'agriculture[COLOR_REVERT] améliorent la production des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à vent[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Alchemy
TEXT.French: Alchimie
TEXT.Polish: Alchemia

TEXT.English: "Many have said of Alchemy, that it is for the making of gold and silver. For me such is not the aim, but to consider only what virtue and power may lie in medicines." - Paracelsus
TEXT.French: Beaucoup disent que l'alchimie est faite pour créer de l'or et de l'argent. Pour moi tel n'est pas le but, mais de considérer uniquement la vertue et la puissance qui réside dans la médecine - Paracelse

TEXT.English: Alchemy was a mix of philosophy and proto-science in the medieval era and Renaissance up to the scientific revolution. The goals of alchemy included creating the philosopher's stone, which could transmute metals into gold or silver; the elixir of life, which could grant immortality; and the universal solvent, which could dissolve anything. Alchemists used philosophy, magic, and experimental processes in these attempts. Alchemy would eventually lay the foundations for modern chemistry.
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alchemy[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Alchemist's Lab[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Greek Fire[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]alchimie[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]laboratoire d'alchimie[COLOR_REVERT] et la merveille du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]feu grégeois[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Algebra
TEXT.French: Algèbre

TEXT.English: [TAB]Algebra is a major branch of mathematics concerning the study of the rules of operations (i.e. addition and multiplication) on sets of numbers that are often represented by symbols, called variables. Algebra can be divided into several major classifications, including elementary algebra, linear algebra, modern algebra, and algebraic geometry. Elementary algebra is the most fundamental and common form of algebra and can be taught to students who have little knowledge of mathematics beyond basic arithmetic. The more advanced forms of algebra can be used to solve enormously complex and varied equations involving algebraic concepts such as polynomials, matrices, vector space, and rings. Algebra is essential to the theory of mathematical analysis and differential equations. Its applications extend beyond the physical sciences into, for example, biology and economics.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Algebra to jeden z najstarszych dziaôów matematyki powstaôy juë w staroëytnoäci. Zajmuje siê on strukturami algebraicznymi i relacjami. Algebra elementarna zajmuje siê takimi dziaôaniami jak dodawanie i mnoëenie; wprowadza pojêcie zmiennej i wielomianu razem z jego faktoryzacjá i znajdowaniem ich pierwiastków, jednakëe algebra jest dziaôem bardziej ogólnym (patrz podziaô algebry).

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"It's strange how few of the world's great problems are solved by people who remember their algebra." – Herbert Prochnow
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"C'est étrange la façon dont quelques-uns des grands problèmes du monde sont résolus par des gens qui se souviennent de leur algèbre." – Herbert Prochnow

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Algebra[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Great Mosque of Djenné[COLOR_REVERT] and found cities on Peak tiles.
TEXT.French: >L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]algèbre[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]grande mosquée de Djénné[COLOR_REVERT] et de fonder des villes sur les sommets.

TEXT.English: Amphibious Warfare
TEXT.Polish: Desant Morski

TEXT.English: [TAB]A combined land and sea attack, usually associated with the capture of a beachhead or coastal area, is known as amphibious warfare. First attempted by the ancient Persians during the Battle of Marathon in 490 BC, successful coordination of amphibious assaults are considered to be among the most complex military operations. When ship-mounted guns were developed, naval vessels would open fire on ground forces and gun emplacements while merchant ships were used to land troops and supplies. The first modern amphibious assault took place at Gallipoli during World War I. Poorly planned and executed, this assault failed, but served as an example of the need for perfect coordination of forces in this type of attack. As battlefield communications improved, and the range of ship-mounted weapons increased, amphibious warfare became increasingly successful, and played a vital role in World War II. Today, amphibious operations are augmented by fast, armored landing vehicles; hovercraft that are capable of moving troops to and across the beach; and airborne assistance from planes and helicopters.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Desant morski to operacja wojsk ládowych lub piechoty morskiej przetransportowanych drogá morská w celu zajêcia odcinka wybrzeëa bronionego przez przeciwnika. Morskie dziaôania desantowe sá operacjami wojskowymi prowadzonymi z morza przez siôy marynarki wojennej i siôy desantowe zaokrêtowane na okrêtach lub innych statkach. Ich zasadniczym celem jest desant na zajmowany i broniony przez przeciwnika brzeg morski i wykonanie powierzonego zadania. Dziaôania desantowe z morza sá prowadzone poôáczonym wysiôkiem wiêkszoäci klas okrêtów, czasem statków, lotnictwa i siô desantowych przeciwko siôom przeciwnika na wybrzeëu. Dziaôania te sá najbardziej zôoëonymi spoäród operacji poôáczonych. Siôy desantowe zapewniajá mobilnoäâ strategiczná i manewrowoäâ operacyjná, jak równieë elastycznoäâ polityczná i militarná. Pomimo, ëe ich dziaôania mogá byâ ograniczane ze wzglêdów geograficznych lub hydrologicznych, siôy desantowe przygotowane na morzu stanowiá powaëny problem dla przeciwnika, który zmuszony jest rozproszyâ swoje siôy, aby broniâ wszystkich dogodnych do ládowania odcinków wybrzeëa, bádé teë utrzymywaâ wiêksze odwody. Otrzymujác przetworzone, aktualne dane z rozpoznania, siôy desantowe wykorzystujá element zaskoczenia i sôabe punkty przeciwnika poprzez wykorzystanie odpowiedniego typu oraz iloäci siô we wôaäciwym czasie i miejscu. Dlatego teë, siôy zaokrêtowane stanowiá zasadniczy element siô desantowych. Ich uëycie pozwala, w zaleënoäci od szczegóôowych celów, osiágaâ efekty w skali taktycznej, operacyjnej lub strategicznej.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Semper Fi". - Marine Corps Motto
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Semper Fi". - Devise du Corps des Marines
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Zawsze wierni". - Motto Korpusu Piechoty Morskiej USA

TEXT.English: Cities can train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marine[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Landing Ship Tank[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Les villes peuvent recruter des unités de type [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]marine[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars amphibies[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Anatomy
TEXT.French: Anatomie
TEXT.Polish: Anatomia

TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of anatomy as a science extends from the earliest examinations of sacrificial victims to the sophisticated analyses of the body performed by modern scientists. It has been characterized, over time, by a continually developing understanding of the functions of organs and structures in the body. The field of Human Anatomy has a prestigious history, and is considered to be the most prominent of the biological sciences of the 19th and early 20th centuries. Methods have also improved dramatically, advancing from examination of animals through dissection of cadavers to technologically complex techniques developed in the 20th century.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anatomy teaching is one of the cornerstones of a doctor’s medical education. Despite being a persistent portion of teaching from at least the renaissance, the format and the amount of information being taught has evolved and changed along with the demands of the profession. What is being taught today may differ in content significantly from the past but the methods used to teach this have not really changed that much. For example all the famous public dissections of the middle ages and early renaissance were in fact prosections. Prosection is the direction in which many current medical schools are heading in order to aid the teaching of anatomy and some argue that dissection is better. However looking at results of post graduate exams, medical schools (specifically Birmingham) that use prosection as opposed to dissection do very well in these examinations. This would suggest that prosection can fit very well into the structure of modern medical training.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Anatomia jest to dziaô biologii, nauka zajmujáca siê badaniem makroskopowej budowy i ksztaôtu ciaôa ëywych organizmów. Termin pochodzi od greckiego sôowa anatemein - rozcinaâ, rozczôonkowywaâ - gdyë na tym wôaänie polegaôa najstarsza metoda badania.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue." -Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La fonction du muscle est de tirer et non de pousser, sauf dans le cas des organes génitaux et de la langue." -Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]Anatomia jest przeznaczeniem kobiet." - Sigmund Freud

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Anatomy[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctor's Office[COLOR_REVERT]. It also enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Medic II[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.Polish: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]anatomie[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]cabinet de médecin[COLOR_REVERT] et active la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]médecin II[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ancient Medicine
TEXT.French: Médecine primitive
TEXT.Polish: Staroëytna Medycyna

TEXT.English: "In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men." - Cicero
TEXT.French: En rien l'homme ne s'approche plus près des dieux qu'en lui donnant la santé des hommes - Cicéron

TEXT.English: Before the application of the scientific method to medicine, many different practices of medicine appeared in different civilizations. Theories ranged from religious explanations to Western humoral medicine to Chinese theories of yin and yang. Techniques developed included herbalism, diagnosis, acupuncture and surgery. Some of these techniques worked, but others proved to be ineffective.
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ancient Medicine[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Apothecary[COLOR_REVERT] building and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippocratic Oath[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]médecine primitive[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]apothicaire[COLOR_REVERT] et la merveille du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]serment d'Hippocrate[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Androids
TEXT.French: Androïdes
TEXT.Polish: Android

TEXT.English: [TAB]An android is a robot designed to resemble a human, usually both in appearance and behavior.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Android - robot przypominajácy wygládem czôowieka. Androidy sá mniej inteligentne nië ich ludzcy odpowiednicy (ludzki umysô pozostaje duëo bardziej wyrafinowany nië jakikolwiek stworzony przez czôowieka artefakt tego samego ciêëaru i wagi), ale z drugiej strony Androidy sá caôkowicie pozbawione strachu i wykonujá rozkazy bez ëadnych pytañ. Wiêkszoäâ ludzkich generaôów uwaëa, ëe sá one super.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The greatest task before civilization at present is to make machines what they ought to be, the slaves, instead of the masters of men." - Havelock Ellis
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La plus grande tâche qui attend la civilisation à l'heure actuelle est de fabriquer des machines qui soient ce qu'elles doivent être, des esclaves, et non des maîtres des hommes." - Havelock Ellis
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"To nie jest moja dziaôka, ale mam pomysô na waszá reklamê. Widaâ stolarza, jak robi piêkne krzesôo. A potem wchodzi jeden z waszych robotów i robi lepsze krzesôo dwa razy szybciej. I wtedy pojawia siê wielki napis: "USR – Z nami moëesz dokopaâ sôabszemu". I ekran siê äciemnia." - wypowiedé z filmu "Ja, robot"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Androids[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Android[COLOR_REVERT] worker units and to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Android Factory[COLOR_REVERT]. This tech improves [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Quarry[COLOR_REVERT] output and enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Post-Scarcity[COLOR_REVERT] civic. The first civilization to discover this civic receives a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La tech. [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]androïde[COLOR_REVERT] permettent d'entraîner des ouvriers [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]androïdes[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabrique d'androïdes[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. améliore le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]carrières[COLOR_REVERT] et active la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]après-pénurie[COLOR_REVERT]. La première civilisation à découvrir cette doctrine reçoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]artiste illustre[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Anti-Aging Medicine
TEXT.French: Médicine anti-âge
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna Antystarzeniowa

TEXT.English: [TAB]Anti-aging addresses how to prevent, slow, or reverse the effects of aging and help people live longer, healthier, happier lives. It includes scientific research and applications in genetic engineering, tissue engineering, and other medical advances, e.g., finding treatments and cures for Alzheimer’s disease. It includes anti-aging psychology, e.g., coping skills for resiliently handling change, stress, and aging. Life extension is the part of anti-aging focused on living as long as possible.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]AntiAging obejmuje badania naukowe w medycynie, w inëynierii genetycznej i tkankowej, poszukujác metod leczenia chorób spoôecznych (np. raka, Alzheimera), równieë w psychologii, np. szukajác umiejêtnoäci radzenia sobie ze stresem, bezradnoäciá i starzeniem. AntiAging to olbrzymi rynek zdrowego odëywiania, âwiczeñ fizycznych i psychicznych, pielêgnacji skóry, terapii hormonalnej, naturalnej suplementacji, jak równieë najbardziej rygorystyczna naukowa czêäâ Anti-Aging, koncentrujáca siê na spowolnieniu, leczeniu lub odwrócenia podstawowych procesów biologicznych w celu zapewnienia poprawy zdrowia i jakoäci ëycia.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Et à la fin, ce n'est pas les années de votre vie qui comptent. C'est ce que vous en avez fait." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Czôowiek to jednak dziwne stworzenie. Moëe siê postarzeâ w jednej chwili. To niesamowite. Dawniej myälaôem, ëe ludzie starzejá siê stopniowo, rok po roku (...). Ale tak nie jest. Starzejá siê w jednej chwili." - Haruki Murakami

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Anti-Aging Medicine[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Longevity[COLOR_REVERT] project.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]médecine anti-âge[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire la merveille de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]longévité[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Applied Economics
TEXT.French: Économie appliquée
TEXT.Polish: Ekonomia Stosowana

TEXT.English: [TAB]After the wars of the early twentieth century, John Maynard Keynes led a reaction against what has been described as governmental abstention from economic affairs, advocating interventionist fiscal policy to stimulate economic demand and growth. With a world divided between the capitalist first world, the communist second world, and the poor of the third world, the post-war consensus broke down. Others like Milton Friedman and Friedrich von Hayek warned of The Road to Serfdom and socialism, focusing their theories on what could be achieved through better monetary policy and deregulation. As Keynesian policies seemed to falter in the 1970s there emerged the so called New Classical school, with prominent theorists such as Robert Lucas and Edward Prescott. Governmental economic policies from the 1980s were challenged, and development economists like Amartya Sen and information economists like Joseph Stiglitz introduced new ideas to economic thought in the twenty first century.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Na poczátku Keynes studiowaô matematykê i historiê, ukoñczyô takëe jeden semestr ekonomii na Cambridge. Studia ekonomiczne odbyô pod kierunkiem ekonomistów liberalnych Artura Cecila Pigou i Alfreda Marshalla w latach 1905–1908. Jego poglády na ekonomiê wywarôy decydujácy wpôyw na rozwój myäli ekonomicznej w latach 30. – 60. XX wieku.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Government's view of the economy could be summed up in a few short phrases: If it moves, tax it. If it keeps moving, regulate it. And if it stops moving, subsidise it" - Ronald Reagan
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"le Vision du gouvernement concernant l'économie pourrait se résumer en quelques phrases courtes: Si elle bouge, taxe la. Si elle continue de se déplacer, il faut la réglementer. Et si elle arrête de bouger, il faut la subventionner" - Ronald Reagan
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Wraz z wynalezieniem koôa i pieniêdzy ludzie zaczêli krêciâ interesy." - Anonim

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Applied Economics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to adopt the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Regulated[COLOR_REVERT] civic and build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Expressway[COLOR_REVERT] civic building. The first civilization to discover this tech receives a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Merchant[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]économie appliquée[COLOR_REVERT] permet d'adopter la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]système régulé[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire le bâtiment doctrinal de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]autoroute[COLOR_REVERT]. La première civilisation à découvrir cette tech. reçoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]marchand illustre[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Aquaculture
TEXT.Polish: Akwakultura

TEXT.English: [TAB]Aquaculture is the practice of cultivating the produce of water for consumption. Humans have been harvesting the bounty of the seas for all of history; however, as human population has grown exponentially, by the late twentieth century, much greater emphasis has been placed on so-called "sustainable" aquaculture. Indeed the Treaty of Iceland, signed in 2033, mandated that, "No fish or mammal may be harvested from the ocean unless an equal or greater number of the same species are released into the wild at the same time." Unfortunately, with the collapse of the One World Government this treaty lost much of its efficacy, and the world's once-boundless supply of food is again under grave and imminent peril. [PARAGRAPH:2]Facing this dwindling supply of animal protein, aquaculture has focused upon the cultivation of oceanic vegetation like kelp and seaweed. Although plentiful, the resulting food has met with mixed reviews: while certain island and coastal cultures claim that these foods are delicacies, the rest of humanity appears to be in general agreement that they taste "like salty rubber, but not as good."
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'aquaculture est le terme générique qui sert à désigner toutes les activités de production animales ou végétales en milieu aquatique. Tout au long de leur histoire, les humains ont exploité les richesses de la mer. Mais avec la croissance exponentielle de la population humaine, la fin du vingtième siècle a vu apparaître les besoins d'une aquaculture viable. Ainsi, le Traité d'Islande, ratifié en 2033, stipulait : "Aucun poisson ou mammifère ne peut être extrait des mers ou des océans, à moins qu'une quantité équivalente de la même espèce ne soit rendue à la vie sauvage dans le même temps." Malheureusement, depuis la chute du Gouvernement Mondial, le traité est tombé en désuétude et la faune marine est à nouveau menacée d'extinction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour faire face à la pénurie de protéines animales, l'aquaculture s'est concentrée sur l'exploitation de cultures végétales océaniques comme le varech et les algues. Bien que très abondante, cette nourriture rencontre un succès mitigé : certaines populations côtières se réjouissent de cette révolution alimentaire mais le reste de l'humanité semble s'accorder à penser que "ça a un goût de caoutchouc salé, en moins bon".
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Aquakultur beschreibt eine Methode zur Kultivierung von Meeresfrüchten und Fisch als Nahrungsmittel. Zwar wurden die Früchte des Meeres von jeher von den Menschen geerntet, als die Weltbevölkerung im späten 20. Jahrhundert jedoch sprunghaft anstieg, war man gezwungen, sich auch der so genannten "erneuerbaren" Aquakultur zuzuwenden. Im Wesentlichen wurde im Rahmen des Abkommens von Island aus dem Jahr 2033 beschlossen, dass "kein Fisch oder Säugetier dem Meer entnommen werden darf, wenn nicht gleichzeitig dieselbe oder eine höhere Anzahl derselben Spezies in die Wildnis entlassen wird". Unglücklicherweise wurde dieses Abkommen nach dem Zerfall der Weltregierung weitgehend von den Nationen ignoriert, so dass die einst grenzenlosen Nahrungsvorräte der Erde mittlerweile abermals extrem und unmittelbar gefährdet sind. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angesichts des schwindenden Nachschubs an tierischen Proteinen konzentriert sich die Aquakultur nun auf die Kultivierung ozeanischer Vegetation wie Seetang und Algen. Dadurch ist die Nahrungsversorgung zwar wieder gesichert, diese Art Lebensmittel an sich wird jedoch durchaus unterschiedlich bewertet: Während bestimmte Insel- und Küstenkulturen die so gewonnene Nahrung als Delikatesse betrachten, scheint der Rest der Menschheit allgemein darin übereinzustimmen, dass sie "wie salziges Gummi, nur noch schlechter" schmeckt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'acquicoltura è la pratica di coltivare i prodotti acquatici per consumarli. Per tutta la loro storia gli uomini hanno raccolto i frutti dei mari ma, con la crescita esponenziale della popolazione, nel tardo ventesimo secolo è stata posta grande enfasi sulla cosiddetta acquicoltura "sostenibile". Il trattato d'Islanda, firmato nel 2033, afferma che "Non è permesso pescare pesci o mammiferi a meno che non ne venga rilasciato allo stesso tempo un numero pari o superiore." Sfortunatamente con il crollo del governo mondiale il trattato ha perso gran parte della propria efficacia e la riserva una volta infinita di cibo è ancora una volta in imminente e grave pericolo. [PARAGRAPH:2]Di fronte alla sempre più scarsa disponibilità di proteine animali, l'acquicoltura si è concentrata sulla coltivazione di vegetazione oceanica, come le alghe. Anche se abbondante, il cibo che ne deriva ha provocato reazioni diverse: mentre certe culture isolane e costiere affermano che si tratta di prelibatezze, il resto dell'umanità appare essere d'accordo sul fatto che "sa di gomma salata, ma non è così buono."
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La acuicultura es la práctica de cultivar los frutos del agua para su consumo. Los humanos han estado cosechando el botín del mar durante toda su historia. Sin embargo, a medida que la población humana fue creciendo exponencialmente, se fue poniendo desde finales del s. XX mucho énfasis en la llamada acuicultura "sostenible". Además, el tratado de Islandia, firmado en 2033, ordenó que: "No se podrán cazar peces ni mamíferos del océano si no se libera la misma o mayor cantidad de especímenes al mismo tiempo". Por desgracia, con la caída del Gobierno Único Mundial, dicho tratado perdió gran parte de su eficacia y el infinito suministro de alimentos mundial vuelve a estar en un peligro grave e inminente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Para paliar la falta de proteínas animales, la acuicultura se ha centrado en el cultivo de vegetales marinos como laminarias y algas marinas. Aunque abundante, el alimento resultante ha recibido opiniones encontradas: mientras ciertas culturas isleñas y costeras afirman que dichos alimentos son exquisiteces, el resto de la humanidad parece estar de acuerdo en que "saben como goma salada, o incluso peor"
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Akwakultura to praktyka uprawy roälin wodnych. Koncentruje siê ona na hodowli i uprawie wodorostów i brunatnic. Chociaë niektórzy uwaëajá ten pokarm za przepyszny, wiêksza czêäâ ludzkoäci jest zdania, ië wodorosty te smakujá jak sôona guma albo i gorzej.

TEXT.English: "Kelp - it's what's for breakfast!" - Advertisement for 'Kelp Krunchies' cereal
TEXT.French: "Le Varech, le meilleur des petits déjeuners !" - Publicité pour une marque de céréales au varech
TEXT.German: "Seetang - alles, was ein gutes Frühstück braucht!" - Werbung für 'Seetang-Kracher'-Frühstücksflocken
TEXT.Italian: "Kelp - ecco cosa c'è a colazione!" - Pubblicità dei cereali Kelp Krunchies
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Algas, lo que hay que desayunar!" - Anuncio de los cereales "Alga Krunchies"
TEXT.Polish: "Chrupki "Nemo"! - dobry pomysô na äniadanie!" - reklama chrupek glonowych "Nemo".

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aquaculture[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fish Farms[COLOR_REVERT], increases the food and commerce production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing Boats[COLOR_REVERT] by +1 each and allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submerged Town Platform[COLOR_REVERT] units which are used to construct [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Submerged Town[COLOR_REVERT] improvements.

TEXT.English: Architecture
TEXT.French: Architecture
TEXT.Polish: Architektura

TEXT.English: [TAB]As structures became more and more complex, it was no longer possible merely to attempt to start construction without some overall plan, as else the structure was liable to collapse, either during construction or due to storms and other natural phenomenon. Architecture enabled the geometry of structures to be analyzed, and where the stresses and strains on materials would lie - having walls that were supporting the greatest amount of weight would need to be made thicker for example is something that is useful before structures have been constructed above it. Architecture was not [discovered] by one single civilization - evidence is present around the world, notably in the Mayan constructions as well as those built by the Babylonians, Greeks, Romans, Chinese and Japanese, as well as many others. Without a sound grasp of architectural techniques, such structures as the Coliseum and the Colossus of Rhodes would not have been possible.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Architektura - dziedzina dziaôalnoäci twórczej czôowieka, zajmujáca siê organizowaniem przestrzeni i czêsto blisko zwiázana z nurtami w sztuce, a niekiedy i filozofii. Architektura obejmuje wiele dziedzin techniki, budownictwo, urbanistykê, ruralistykê, ogrodnictwo (architektura zieleni, architektura krajobrazu), wnêtrzarstwo (projektowanie wnêtrz), akustykê, meblarstwo, jak teë scenografiê. Siostrzaná nauká zajmujácá siê realizacjá wizji oraz koncepcji architektonicznych jest Inëynieria ládowa. Obiekt, dzieôo architektury, powinien odpowiadaâ zamierzonej funkcji, celowoäci technicznej, wymaganiom ekonomicznym i estetycznym, a przede wszystkim, dáëeniom i oczekiwaniom uëytkowników jego przestrzeni. Realizacja obiektów architektonicznych wymaga korzystania z osiágniêâ innych dyscyplin, m.in. sztuki, filozofii, inëynierii, techniki, budownictwa, statyki, socjologii, psychologii, urbanistyki, nauk ekonomicznych. W ciágu wieków zmieniaôy siê zarówno zakres obowiázków i koniecznej wiedzy architekta, jak i samo pojmowanie architektury.

TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Architektura polega na zachowaniu trzech zasad: trwaôoäci, uëytecznoäci i piêkna." - Witruwiusz

TEXT.English: Aristocracy
TEXT.French: Aristocratie
TEXT.Polish: Arystokracja

TEXT.English: [TAB]Aristocracy is a form of government, in which a select few such as the most wise, strong or contributing citizens rule, often starting as a system of co-option where a council of prominent citizens add leading soldiers, merchants, land owners, priests, or lawyers to their number. Aristocracy deforms when it becomes hereditary elite. Aristocracies have most often been deformed to hereditary plutocratic systems. They sometimes include a monarch who although a member of the aristocracy, rules over it as well as over the rest of society.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term "aristocracy" is derived from the Greek language aristokratia, meaning 'the rule of the best'. The term "aristocracy" was first given in Athens to young citizens (the men of the ruling class) who led armies from the front line. Because military bravery was highly regarded as a virtue in ancient Greece, it was assumed that the armies were being led by "the best". From the ancient Greeks, the term passed on to the European Middle Ages for a similar hereditary class of military leaders often referred to as the "nobility". As in ancient Greece, this was a slave-holding class of privileged men whose military role allowed them to present themselves as the most "noble", or "best".
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Arystokracja jest to najwyësza warstwa spoôeczna wyksztaôciôa siê w staroëytnej Grecji, podczas najazdu Dorów w 1200 r. p.n.e. Arystokracja, w szerszym tego sôowa znaczeniu , jest wynikiem procesu róënicowania siê spoôeczeñstwa i dlatego pojawia siê w takiej czy innej postaci we wszystkich ustrojach spoôecznych. Arystokracja wystêpowaôa u Inków i Majów, arystokracjê rodowá wytworzyôo wiele pierwotnych spoôecznoäci. Róëny byô czynnik wyodrêbniajácy osoby uprzywilejowane od reszty. Czynnikiem tym moëe byâ piastowanie wyëszych urzêdów; prowadzi to do powstawania tzw. arystokracji urzêdniczej, dáëácej do przekazywania urzêdów z ojca na syna. Waënym czynnikiem róënicujácym spoôeczeñstwa jest majátek, o czym wspomniano wczeäniej. Dobrym przykôadem na nowoczesne uëycie sôowa "arystokracja" jest wyraëenie arystokracja robotnicza, ukute przez Engelsa na okreälenie warstwy wysoko wykwalifikowanych robotników. Zupeônie wspóôczesnym nawiázaniem do wyodrêbniania siê warstw wyëszych w spoôeczeñstwach jest termin "czerwona arystokracja" na okreälenie bardzo dobrze sytuowanych i piastujácych wysokie urzêdy osób o komunistycznym ëyciorysie politycznym. Czêsto stosuje siê nawet tytulaturê rodem z zachodnich herbarzy, jak "baron SLD".

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Democracy means government by the uneducated, while aristocracy means government by the badly educated." -G. K. Chesterton
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La démocratie signifie le gouvernement par les personnes sans instruction, tandis que l'aristocratie, c'est le gouvernement par les plus mals éduqués." -G. K. Chesterton
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Arystokrata to demokrata z wypeônionymi kieszeniami." - Josh Billings

TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]aristocratie[COLOR_REVERT] avec les doctrines [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]noble[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bourgeois[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Armoured Cavalry
TEXT.French: Cavalerie blindée
TEXT.Polish: Opancerzona Kawaleria

TEXT.English: [TAB]During the Ancient period and the Middle Ages in Europe armoured cavalry referred to any horse-mounted troops that used chain mail or plate armour for protection, and often added this to their mount's furniture also. Between the late 17th and mid-19th centuries armoured cavalry referred to those cavalry regiments that retained the cuirass, and were commonly known as cuirassiers. At a later date they we sometimes called heavy cavalry which referred to their large horses and not the weight of the cuirass.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]W póéniejszym okresie Äredniowiecza, w Europie Zachodniej oraz Ärodkowej trzonem siô zbrojnych staôo siê pospolite ruszenie rycerzy. Rycerze walczyli na ogóô jako ciêëka kawaleria, byli formowani w jednostki organizacyjne, zwane kopiami ôáczonymi w chorágwie. Uzbrojeni byli w kopie, miecze, topory i tarcze. W Europie Wschodniej oraz na stepach azjatyckich wiêkszá rolê odgrywaôa jazda lekka. Wchodziôa ona w skôad miêdzy innymi armii litewskiej. Takëe koczownicy stepowi Pieczyngowie, Poôowcy, a póéniej Tatarzy uëywali niemal wyôácznie lekkiej konnicy w swoich najazdach i podbojach. Lekká jazdê posiadali takëe Arabowie z Bliskiego Wschodu. Ci ostatni, czêsto uëywali wielbôádów jako wierzchowców. Rozwój broni palnej oraz odrodzenie piechoty spowodowaôo pod koniec äredniowiecza powolny upadek jazdy rycerskiej.

TEXT.English: Armoured Vehicles
TEXT.French: Blindage des véhicules
TEXT.Polish: Opancerzone Pojazdy

TEXT.English: [TAB]An armoured vehicle is a military vehicle, protected by armour and armed with weapons. Most armored vehicles are equipped for driving in rugged terrain. Armoured fighting vehicles are classified according to their intended role on the battlefield and characteristics. This classification is not absolute; at different times different countries will classify the same vehicle in different roles. For example, armoured personnel carriers were generally replaced by infantry fighting vehicles in a very similar role, but the latter has some capabilities lacking in the former. [PARAGRAPH:2]The tank is an all terrain, armoured fighting vehicle, designed primarily to engage enemy forces by the use of direct fire in the frontal assault role. Though several configurations have been tried, particularly in the early experimental days of tank development, a standard, mature design configuration has since emerged to a generally accepted pattern. This features a main artillery gun, mounted in a fully rotating turret atop a tracked automotive hull, with various additional machine guns throughout. [PARAGRAPH:2]Armoured personnel carriers (APCs) are light armoured fighting vehicles for the transport of infantry. They usually have only a machine gun although variants carry recoilless rifles, anti-tank guided missiles (ATGMs), or mortars. They are not really designed to take part in a direct-fire battle, but to carry the troops to the battlefield safe from shrapnel and ambush. They may have wheels, tracks, or both as in the half-track. Examples include the American M113 (tracked), the British FV 432 (tracked), the Dutch/German Boxer MRAV (wheeled), the French VAB (wheeled), the Soviet BTR (wheeled), and the American M3 (half-tracked). [PARAGRAPH:2]Infantry Mobility Vehicle (IMV) is a modern term for a wheeled armoured personnel carrier (APC) which serves as a military patrol, reconnaissance or security vehicle. The distinction between it and an armoured car being the ability to carry a unit of infantry. Modern examples include the Bushmaster IMV, Stryker Infantry Carrier Vehicle (ICV) and vehicles being fielded as part of the MRAP program. [PARAGRAPH:2]An infantry fighting vehicle (IFV) is an armoured personnel carrier which allows the infantry to fight from inside, and can provide significant fire support. The first IFV was the Soviet BMP-1, which surprised the western intelligence analysts when it appeared in a military parade in 1967. [PARAGRAPH:2]Self-propelled artillery are artillery pieces which have been given their own integral transport by mounting them on tracked or wheeled chassis. They are usually armoured as well. The mobility provided allows artillery to keep up with the pace of armoured warfare, and gives them nominal protection from counter-battery or small arms fire. Like towed artillery, a battery of self-propelled guns must still set up in a relatively safe area to perform fire missions, but is able to relocate more quickly. [PARAGRAPH:2]Self-propelled anti-tank guns, or tank destroyers, are used primarily to provide antitank support for infantry or tank units, in defensive or withdrawal operations. They may mount a high-velocity anti-tank gun or sometimes an antitank guided missile launcher, or ATGM. Tank destroyers cannot fulfill the many roles of tanks; they are much less flexible, and usually lacking in anti-infantry capability, but they are much less expensive to manufacture, maintain, and resupply than tanks.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Pojazd opancerzony sôuëy do transportu piechoty i sprzêtu na polu walki, a w ograniczonym zakresie do jej wsparcia ogniowego. Jest sôabiej uzbrojony i opancerzony od bojowego wozu piechoty, o podobnym przeznaczeniu, lecz sôuëácego ponadto do wsparcia ogniowego piechoty w walce. Transportery opancerzone budowane sá zarówno jako terenowe pojazdy koôowe oraz jako gásienicowe; w okresie II wojny äwiatowej budowano transportery póôgásienicowe. Liczne konstrukcje tego typu sá pojazdami amfibijnymi, mogácymi pôywaâ w wodzie. Wczesne transportery opancerzone byôy czêsto odkryte od góry, od lat 60. budowane sá jedynie konstrukcje zakryte, z reguôy wyposaëone takëe w systemy ochrony wnêtrza przed broniá masowego raëenia (urzádzenia filtrowentylacyjne). Opancerzenie transporterów opancerzonych chroni zwykle przed pociskami broni strzeleckiej i odôamkami pocisków artyleryjskich. Transportery opancerzone zabierajá zwykle oprócz zaôogi (kierowca i dowódca) od 8 do kilkunastu ëoônierzy desantu. Najpowszechniejszym sposobem zaôadunku i wyôadunku desantu sá drzwi z tyôu kadôuba oraz wôazy w dachu, rzadziej stosowane sá drzwi lub wôazy boczne. Transportery opancerzone uzbrojone sá zwykle w karabiny maszynowe, na stanowiskach otwartych lub chronionych tarczá pancerná albo w obrotowych wieëyczkach. Stosowany jest kaliber od 7,62 mm do 14,5 mm, najczêäciej 12,7 mm. Czêsto posiadajá otwory w äcianach bocznych umoëliwiajáce prowadzenie desantowi ognia karabinkami desantu z wnêtrza pojazdu. Transportery opancerzone uzbrojone w dziaôka szybkostrzelne kalibru od 20 mm klasyfikowane sá wedôug traktatów miêdzynarodowych jako bojowe wozy piechoty.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Who drives armoured cars? People who expect gun-fire. Usually people with some fire-power of their own." - Michael Westen ("Burn Notice")
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Qui conduit les véhicules blindés? Les gens qui s'attendent à être tirés dessus. Habituellement, des gens qui ont eux-même des armes à feu." - Michael Westen ("Burn Notice")
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Jeëeli jakiä môody czôowiek poôoëy siê przed moim samochodem, aby go zatrzymaâ, bêdzie to jego ostatni samochód." - George Wallace

TEXT.English: Armour Crafting
TEXT.French: Fabrication d'armures
TEXT.Polish: Pôatnerstwo

TEXT.English: [TAB]The technology to produce plate steel had been in place for many centuries: coats of plates, or brigandine, had been used for at least fifty years prior to the fourteenth century. These consisted of plates that were riveted to a cloth surface. In this image, several examples can be seen, but they are not immediately obvious: from the outside, they look like thick padded cloth or leather with rows of studs embedded in them ("Studded leather" as an armor is an ahistorical term that comes from not correctly recognizing brigandine). Brigandine protects from cuts, and is much better at shirking off impacts than is mail. However, brigandine does not quite give its wearer the freedom of movement that mail does, and it's not practical for armoring the limbs: often a brigandine "shirt" must be worn with either mail or with plates for the arms or legs.[PARAGRAPH:2]With the advent of larger forces of footmen armed with pole weapons, however, such protection was not always adequate. In addition, archery remained a problem with the widespread use of the crossbow among the Italian city-states. Since the links inevitably had holes, the heads of crossbow quarrels, and even the arrowheads of particularly powerful bows (such as the English longbow and the stronger composite bows such as used by some Hungarian troops and especially those used by Ottoman archers) could penetrate directly through a fighter's armor. Padding helped, but generally not enough. Therefore, during the course of the fourteenth century, plate steel was added to those places most likely to be hit by missile fire, and gradually complete suits of plate armor were created. This suit of transitional mail is an excellent example: the breastplate and backplate provide protection from missile fire, with the next areas armored being the forearms, which are very vulnerable on the battlefield. These suits had an additional advantage: while mail and brigandine provide excellent protection at a relatively slight cost to mobility, the wearer of a suit of full plate armor is essentially immune to cutting attacks from single-handed swords. Crossbow power and plate armor hardness each steadily increased, as armorers provided better protection, and crossbow makers increased the power of their weapons so that they would still be effective.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Zbroja – czêäâ pasywnego uzbrojenia ochronnego wojowników, stosowana od staroëytnoäci do ok. XVII wieku. W Polsce przetrwaôy aë do wieku XVIII jako zbroje husarskie i kolczugi pancernych.Elementy zbroi pojawiaôy siê póéniej, jednak byôy to odosobnione przypadki. Na XVIII oraz XIX-wiecznych polach bitew walczyli ciêëkozbrojni jeédécy, kirasjerzy, na wyposaëeniu których byôy kirysy oraz skórzane bádé ëelazne heômy – tzw. kaski. Podczas I wojny äwiatowej uprzywilejowani oficerowie zaopatrzeni byli w tzw. pancerze okopowe, które miaôy za zadanie osôaniaâ dowódców przed m.in. pociskami szrapnelowymi. Pod koniec XX wieku wrócono do idei wykorzystywania pancerzy w uzbrojeniu ëoônierzy w postaci pôyt ceramicznych lub tytanowych uzupeôniajácych kamizelki kuloodporne.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]During the Middle Ages, probably one of the biggest mistakes was not putting on your armour because you were "just going down to the corner." - Jack Handy
TEXT.French: [SPACE]Au Moyen Age, probablement l'une des plus grandes erreurs était de ne pas mettre son armure parce qu'on allait 'juste de descendre dans le coin'." - Jack Handy
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Niechaj zbroja ustápi przed togá." - Cyceron

TEXT.English: Artificial Evolution
TEXT.French: Evolution artificielle
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczna Ewolucja

TEXT.English: [TAB]In artificial intelligence, an evolutionary algorithm (EA) is a subset of evolutionary computation, a generic population-based metaheuristic optimization algorithm. An EA uses some mechanisms inspired by biological evolution: reproduction, mutation, recombination, and selection. Candidate solutions to the optimization problem play the role of individuals in a population, and the fitness function determines the environment within which the solutions "live". Evolution of the population then takes place after the repeated application of the above operators. Artificial evolution (AE) describes a process involving individual evolutionary algorithms; EAs are individual components that participate in an AE. [PARAGRAPH:2]Apart from their use as mathematical optimizers, evolutionary computation and algorithms have also been used as an experimental framework within which to validate theories about biological evolution and natural selection, particularly through work in the field of artificial life. Techniques from evolutionary algorithms applied to the modelling of biological evolution are generally limited to explorations of microevolutionary processes, however some computer simulations, such as Tierra and Avida, attempt to model macroevolutionary dynamics.[PARAGRAPH:2]Usually, an initial population of randomly generated candidate solutions comprise the first generation. The fitness function is applied to the candidate solutions and any subsequent offspring. Two main classes of fitness functions exist: one where the fitness function does not change, as in optimizing a fixed function or testing with a fixed set of test cases; and one where the fitness function is mutable, as in using niche differentiation or co-evolving the set of test cases.[PARAGRAPH:2]In selection, parents for the next generation are chosen with a bias towards higher fitness. The parents reproduce by copying with recombination and/or mutation. Recombination acts on the two selected parents (candidates) and results in one or two children (new candidates). Mutation acts on one candidate and results in a new candidate. These operators create the offspring (a set of new candidates). These new candidates compete with old candidates for their place in the next generation (survival of the fittest).[PARAGRAPH:2]This process can be repeated until a candidate with sufficient quality (a solution) is found or a previously defined computational limit is reached.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Ewolucja (ôac. evilutio – rozwiniêcie) – ciágôy proces, polegajácy na stopniowych zmianach cech gatunkowych kolejnych pokoleñ wskutek eliminacji przez dobór naturalny lub sztuczny czêäci osobników (genotypów) z bieëácej populacji.Wraz z nowymi mutacjami wpôywa to w sposób ciágôy na bieëácá pulê genowá populacji a przez to, w kaëdym momencie ksztaôtuje przeciêtny jej fenotyp. Zaleënie od siôy doboru oraz szybkoäci wymiany pokoleñ, po krótszym lub dôuëszym czasie, w stosunku do stanu populacji wyjäciowej powstajá tak duëe róënice, ëe moëna mówiâ o odrêbnych gatunkach. Ewolucja wyjaänia mechanizmy powstawania nowych gatunków i przyczyny róënorodnoäci form biologicznych, a zarazem ich jednoäâ objawiajácá siê chociaëby w powszechnoäci wystêpowania kwasów nukleinowych.Przebieg i mechanizm procesu ewolucji opisywany jest przez teoriê ewolucji, udokumentowaná dowodami wywodzácymi siê z paleontologii, biochemii, biologii molekularnej, genetyki, anatomii porównawczej, embriologii i biogeografii.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"If we are going to teach creation science as an alternative to evolution, then we should also teach the stork theory as an alternative to biological reproduction." - Judith Hayes
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Si nous allons enseigner la science de la création comme une alternative à l'évolution, alors il faudra aussi enseigner la théorie des cigognes comme une alternative à la reproduction biologique." - Judith Hayes
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Darwin byô idealistá i marzycielem [...]. Jaka tam ewolucja. Zanim trafiê na jednego myälácego, muszê stoczyâ bitwê z dziewiêcioma orangutanami." - Carlos Ruiz Zafón

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artificial Evolution[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Incubation Center[COLOR_REVERT] and increases the food production of several improvement types.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]évolution artificielle[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centre d'incubation[COLOR_REVERT] et cette tech. augmente la production de nourriture de plusieurs aménagements.

TEXT.English: Artificial Intelligence
TEXT.French: Intelligence artificielle
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczna Inteligencja

TEXT.English: [TAB]Artificial intelligence (or AI) is "the study and design of intelligent agents" where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions which maximizes its chances of success.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Sztuczna inteligencja (ang. Artificial Intelligence – AI) – Nauka obejmujáca zagadnienia logiki rozmytej, obliczeñ ewolucyjnych, sieci neuronowych, sztucznego ëycia i robotyki. Sztuczna inteligencja to dziaô informatyki, którego przedmiotem jest badanie reguô rzádzácych inteligentnymi zachowaniami czôowieka, tworzenie modeli formalnych tych zachowañ i – w rezultacie – programów komputerowych symulujácych te zachowania.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God." - Alan Perlis
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Une année passée à l'intelligence artificielle est assez pour faire croire en Dieu." - Alan Perlis
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Mój umysô odchodzi. Czujê to." - HAL 9000 z filmu "2001: Odyseja Kosmiczna"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artificial Intelligence[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SS Cockpit[COLOR_REVERT] spaceship part and enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat AI 1.0[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]intelligence artificielle[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire la partie '[COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]cockpit SS[COLOR_REVERT] du vaisseau spatial et active la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat IA 1.0[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Artificial Life
TEXT.French: Vie artificielle
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Ëycie

TEXT.English: [TAB]Artificial life (commonly Alife or alife) is a field of study and an associated art form which examine systems related to life, its processes, and its evolution through simulations using computer models, robotics, and biochemistry. There are three main kinds of alife , named for their approaches: soft, from software; hard, from hardware; and wet, from biochemistry. Artificial life imitates traditional biology by trying to recreate biological phenomena. The term "artificial life" is often used to specifically refer to soft alife.[PARAGRAPH:2]Artificial life studies the logic of living systems in artificial environments. The goal is to study the phenomena of living systems in order to come to an understanding of the complex information processing that defines such systems. Also sometimes included in the umbrella term Artificial Life are agent based systems which are used to study the emergent properties of societies of agents.[PARAGRAPH:2]The modeling philosophy of alife strongly differs from traditional modeling, by studying not only "life-as-we-know-it", but also "life-as-it-might-be". In the first approach, a traditional model of a biological system will focus on capturing its most important parameters. In contrast, an alife modeling approach will generally seek to decipher the most simple and general principles underlying life and implement them in a simulation. The simulation then offers the possibility to analyse new, different life-like systems. At present, the commonly accepted definition of life does not consider any current alife simulations or softwares to be alive, and they do not constitute part of the evolutionary process of any ecosystem. However, different opinions about artificial life's potential have arisen:[PARAGRAPH:2]The strong alife (cf. Strong AI) position states that "life is a process which can be abstracted away from any particular medium" (John von Neumann). Notably, Tom Ray declared that his program Tierra is not simulating life in a computer but synthesizing it.[PARAGRAPH:2]The weak alife position denies the possibility of generating a "living process" outside of a chemical solution. Its researchers try instead to simulate life processes to understand the underlying mechanics of biological phenomena.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Sztuczne Ëycie (AL z ang. Artificial Life) jest interdyscyplinarnym kierunkiem badañ, zorientowanym na zrozumienie i wykorzystanie istoty ëycia.Obejmuje miêdzy innymi:* tworzenie róënorodnych modeli ëycia oraz prowadzenie symulacji w ärodowisku programowym, sprzêtowym i biochemicznym,* symulacje ewolucji biologicznej oraz innych procesów biologicznych za pomocá technik informatycznych,* badania i symulacje ukôadów niebiologicznych, zachowujácych siê podobnie jak ukôady biologiczne (np. automatów komórkowych),* algorytmy ewolucyjne i ewolucjê programów komputerowych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image." - Stephen Hawking
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Je pense que les virus informatiques devrait être considéré comme vivants. Je pense que cela nous apprend quelque chose sur la nature humaine, le fait que la seule forme de vie que nous ayons créé jusqu'à présent est purement destructive. Nous avons créé la vie à notre image." - Stephen Hawking
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Jedyne czego ëaôujê w ëyciu, to tego, ëe nie jestem kimä innym." - Woody Allen

The first civilization to discover this technology receives a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Athletics
TEXT.French: Athlétisme
TEXT.Polish: Atletyka

TEXT.English: [TAB]Athletics was the original event at the first Olympics in 776 BC where the only event held was the stadium-length foot race or "stade".[PARAGRAPH:2]The Roman Games – Arising from Etruscan rather than purely Greek roots, the Roman Games deemphasized footraces and throwing. Instead, the Greek sports of chariot racing and wrestling, as well as the Etruscan sport of gladiatorial combat, took center stage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other peoples enjoyed athletic contests, such as the Celts, Teutons and Goths who succeeded the Romans. However, these were often related to combat training. In the Middle Ages the sons of noblemen would be trained in running, leaping and wrestling, in addition to riding, jousting and arms-training. Contests between rivals and friends may have been common on both official and unofficial grounds. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Atletyka to dziedzina sportu, w której wykorzystywana jest siôa fizyczna czôowieka. Naleëá do niej takie dyscypliny, jak: podnoszenie ciêëarów, kulturystyka, trójbój siôowy czy strongman.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"If you want to run, run a mile. If you want to experience a different life, run a marathon." - Emil Zatopek
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Si tu veux courir, cours un kilomètre. Si tu veux découvrir une vie différente, cours un marathon." - Emile Zatopek
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Chcesz pobiegaâ, przebiegnij milê, chcesz doäwiadczyâ nowego ëycia przebiegnij marton." - Emil Zatopek
