The first civilization to discover this technology founds [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hellenism[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]athlétisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabriques d'arc[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]arènes[COLOR_REVERT], la merveille nationale de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]statue du Champion[COLOR_REVERT], le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]cirque Maxime[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]jeux olympiques[COLOR_REVERT] (merveilles mondiales). La première civilisation à découvrir cette technologie fonde l'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hellenisme[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Automated Traffic
TEXT.French: Traffic automatisé
TEXT.Polish: Zautomatyzowany Ruch Uliczny

TEXT.English: [TAB]Automated Traffic is a combination of high bandwidth telecommunication and computer networks. Every vehicle is controlled by computer which takes passengers or goods to destination by shortest possible route and with highest possible speed. People may take manual control and computer driver will stay in standby mode though in any case of danger computer takes over and prevents accidents from happening.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Automatyczny ruch to poôáczenie wysokiej przepustowoäci telekomunikacyjnej i sieci komputerowych. Kaëdy pojazd jest sterowany przez komputer, który zabiera pasaëerów lub towary do miejsca przeznaczenia najkrótszá drogá, z najwyëszá moëliwá prêdkoäciá. Czôowiek ma moëliwoäâ rêcznego sterowania ale komputer pozostaje w trybie gotowoäci i w przypadku niebezpieczeñstwa przejmuje i zapobiega wypadkom.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"When Solomon said that there was a time and a place for everything he had not encountered the problem of parking an automobile." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Lorsque Salomon a dit qu'il y avait un temps et un lieu pour tout, il n'avait pas été confronté au problème de stationnement d'une automobile." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Kiedy Salomon powiedziaô, ëe byô czasem i miejscem dla wszystkiego, pewnie nie spotkaô problemu z parkowaniem samochodu." - Bob Edwards

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Automated Traffic[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Personal Rapid Train[COLOR_REVERT] and train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hovercars[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]trafic automatisé[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]train rapide personnel[COLOR_REVERT] et de fabriquer des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aérovoitures[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Automatic Weapons
TEXT.Polish: Broñ Automtyczna

TEXT.English: [TAB]Early guns required reloading after every bullet that was fired. Although the method that was employed to reload the gun was improved over the years, such as bolt action rifles, each round still required manual insertion into the chamber, requiring over a second to reload. Compared to modern automatic weapons that can fire in some cases several thousand bullets a minute, this is very slow. One of the first automatic weapons that was used was the Gatling gun, which was first used in the American Civil War. This early automatic weapon relied on the forceful recoil of each bullet to prime the next, and so on. This enabled the rate of fire to increase, but the gun itself was very unwieldy and not exceptionally accurate.By World War I, the concept had been vastly improved in the shape of the Vicker’s machinegun, which was able to fire hundreds of bullets a minute. Similar versions were used by all the combatants of the war, and these machine guns enabled stalemate that was seen in the war, as well as the levels of casualties that were seen. These early guns also required water cooling of the barrel to prevent overheating. All these guns required the mechanical action to reload the next bullet in the chamber, which while a practical solution was not ideal. A better, if more sophisticated method was found and that utilized some of the gasses that were produced to load the chamber. This method required far less force to function, and hence allowed an increase in the level of accuracy. Although the accuracy and rounds per minute that modern automatic weapons can fire have altered throughout the years, the basic technology is the same.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Broñ automatyczna to rodzaj broni palnej w której kolejne fazy cyklu pracy broni (poza wprowadzeniem pierwszego naboju do komory nabojowej i uruchomienia mechanizmu spustowego) sá wykonywane bez uëycia energii strzelajácego. Broñ automatyczná dzieli siê ze wzglêdu na rodzaj energii wykorzystanej do uëycia automatyki broni na gazodynamiczná, napêdowá i mieszaná, a ze wzglêdu na rodzaj ognia na samoczynná, samopowtarzalná i samoczynno-samopowtarzalná.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Whoever said the pen is mightier than the sword obviously never encountered automatic weapons." - Douglas MacArthur
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Celui qui a dit que la plume est plus puissante que l'épée n'a évidemment jamais rencontré d'armes automatiques." - Douglas MacArthur
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Ktokolwiek powiedziaô, ëe pióro jest potêëniejsze nië miecz oczywiäcie nigdy nie spotkaô siê z broniá automatyczná." - Douglas MacArthur

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Automatic Weapons[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] and several other Industrial Era ground units.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]armes automatiques[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de recruter de l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]infanterie[COLOR_REVERT] et quelques autres unités terrestres de l'ère industrielle.

TEXT.English: Automobile
TEXT.French: Automobile
TEXT.Polish: Pojazdy Zmechanizowane

TEXT.English: [TAB]English inventor Sir Samuel Morland allegedly used gunpowder to drive water pumps in the 17th century. For more conventional, reciprocating internal combustion engines. the fundamental theory for two-stroke engines was established by Sadi Carnot, France, 1824, whilst the American Samuel Morey received a patent on April 1, 1826. Sir Dugald Clark (1854 – 1932) designed the first two-stroke engine in 1878 and patented it in England in 1881. Automotive production has used a range of energy-conversion systems. These include electric, steam, solar, turbine, rotary, and piston-type internal combustion engines. The petrol internal combustion engine, operating on a four-stroke Otto cycle, has been the most successful for automobiles, while diesel engines are used for trucks and buses. Karl Benz was one of the leaders in the development of new engines. In 1878 he began to work on new designs. He concentrated his efforts on creating a reliable gas two-stroke engine that was more powerful, based on Nikolaus Otto's design of the four-stroke engine. Karl Benz showed his real genius, however, through his successive inventions registered while designing what would become the production standard for his two-stroke engine. Benz was granted a patent for it in 1879. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1896, Karl Benz was granted a patent for his design of the first engine with horizontally-opposed pistons. Many BMW motorcycles use this engine type. His design created an engine in which the corresponding pistons move in horizontal cylinders and reach top dead center simultaneously, thus automatically balancing each other with respect to their individual momentums. Engines of this design are often referred to as flat engines because of their shape and lower profile. They must have an even number of cylinders and six, four or two cylinder flat engines have all been common. The most well-known engine of this type is probably the Volkswagen beetle engine. Engines of this type continue to be a common design principle for high performance aero engines (for propellor driven aircraft) and, engines used by automobile producers such as Porsche and Subaru.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Transport samochodowy (zwany teë drogowym) - jedna z gaôêzi transportu, w której ôadunki i pasaëerowie przemieszczajá siê po drogach ládowych przy pomocy koôowych ärodków transportu (np. pojazdów samochodowych). Usôugi transportowe odbywajáce siê z wykorzystaniem tej gaôêzi transportu äwiadczone sá przez przewoéników drogowych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]All of the biggest technological inventions created by man - the airplane, the automobile, the computer - says little about his intelligence, but speaks volumes about his laziness. - Mark Kennedy
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Czêsto ludzie za kierownicami samochodów wygládajá tak, jakby siedzieli za karabinami maszynowymi." - Mieczysôaw M. Szargan

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Automobile[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Motorcycle[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Freight[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transport[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]automobile[COLOR_REVERT] permet de recruter des unités de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fret[COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]transport[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Aviation
TEXT.French: Aviation
TEXT.Polish: Awiacje Lotnicze

TEXT.English: [TAB]World War I (1914-1918) stimulated the growth in aviation. The increasing development of the petrol engine led to increased power and speeds rose to 200mph/320kph. Streamlining of the body and reshaping of wings and other exposed parts led to reduced drag. [PARAGRAPH:2]The internally-braced monoplane eventually replaced the original biplane and is the design most often seen today.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]I Wojna Äwiatowa (1914-1918) stymulowaôa wzrost awiacji. Wzrastajácy rozwój silnika benzynowego prowadziô do wzrostu mocy i szybkoäci do 200mph / 320kmh. Usprawnione szkielety i odksztaôcone skrzydôa i inne wystawione czêäci prowadziôy do zmniejszania ciágu. [PARAGRAPH:2]Wewnátrz spinany jednopôatowiec w koñcu zastápiô oryginalny dwupôat i jest projektowany do dziä.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Aviation is proof that given, the will, we have the capacity to achieve the impossible." - Edward Vernon Rickenbacker
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"L'aviation est la preuve qu'avec la volonté, nous avons la capacité de réaliser l'impossible." - Edward Vernon Rickenbacker

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aviation[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fighters[COLOR_REVERT] and other early air units. Cities can build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Airbases[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]aviation[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] et d'autres unités aériennes précurseures. Les villes peuvent construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bases aériennes militaires[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Battlefield Medicine
TEXT.French: Médecine militaire
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna Polowa

TEXT.English: [TAB]Battlefield medicine, also called field surgery and more recently combat casualty care, is the treatment of wounded soldiers in or near an area of combat. Civilian medicine has been greatly advanced by procedures that were first developed to treat the wounds inflicted during combat. With the advent of advanced procedures and medical technology, even polytrauma can be survivable in modern wars. Battlefield medicine is a category of military medicine.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Medycyna polowa, równieë nazwyaná chirurgiá polowá i bardziej ostatnio opieka nad rannymi, jest leczeniem rannych ëoônierzy blisko pola bitwy. Z nadejäciem nowoczesnych procedur i technologii medycznej, nawet z polytrauma moëna przeëyâ w nowoczesnej wojnie. Medycyna polowa jest kategoriá medycyny wojskowej.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"It is the most sickening sight of the war, this tide of wounded flowing back." - Dr. William T. G. Morton
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"C'est le spectacle le plus écoeurant de la guerre, cette marée de blessés qui en reviennent." - Dr. William T. G. Morton
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Jeden doäwiadczony lekarz wart jest stu wojowników." - Homer

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Battlefield Medicine[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pharmacy[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]médecine de champ de bataille[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]pharmacie[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Barter
TEXT.Spanish: El Truque

TEXT.English: [TAB][BOLD]Barter[\BOLD] is a type of trade in which goods or services are directly exchanged for other goods and/or services, without the use of money. It can be bilateral or multilateral, and usually exists parallel to monetary systems in most developed countries, though to a very limited extent. Barter usually replaces money as the method of exchange in times of monetary crisis, when the currency is unstable and devalued by hyperinflation.
"Almost all of our relationships begin and most of them continue as forms of mutual exploitation, a mental or physical barter, to be terminated when one or both parties run out of goods." - H. Auden
TEXT.French: "La quasi-totalité de nos relations commencent par de l'exploitation mutuelle, et la plupart de ces relations continuent ainsi : un troc mental ou physique, qui se termine lorsque l'un ou les deux parties sont à court de marchandises." - H. Auden
TEXT.Polish: "Barter jest najstarsza forma wymiany handlowej." - Ewa Kosinska

TEXT.English: Enables Barter civic and improved income.
TEXT.French: Permet d'accéder aux doctrines du "troc"
TEXT.Italian: Permette la forma di governo Baratto, oltre a migliorare l'entrata economica
TEXT.Polish: Odsôania na mapie Zôoto, Srebro i Klejnoty. Zwiêksza przychód handlu z usprawnieñ terenu. Udostêpnia doktrynê Wymiana.

TEXT.English: Biological Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre biologique
TEXT.Polish: Broñ Biologiczna

TEXT.English: [TAB]Humans have used biological warfare against each other for untold centuries. The earliest efforts were crude - throwing diseased corpses into cities under siege, giving the blankets of plague victims to unsuspecting natives, and so forth - but effective. Biological warfare was outlawed on Earth in the twentieth century, but that didn't stop a lot of countries and terrorist organizations from continuing to research and refine such weapons - "just in case." [PARAGRAPH:2]The biggest drawbacks to such weaponry remains the difficulty of delivering a large enough dose to be immediately effective, as well as figuring out a way to ensure that the disease doesn't turn around and wipe your side out as well as your enemy. While the first difficulty has been somewhat addressed with the creation of super viruses capable of surviving being dispersed from a missile warhead to cover a large area, the latter remains somewhat problematic: the new viruses are designed to be short-lived and to burn themselves out after a few days or weeks, but like all other viruses they are capable of mutation - perhaps into something far more persistent and easily spreadable - so the risks remain extremely high. Only the most foolish nation would use such a weapon except in the direst of needs.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les humains utilisent des armes biologiques depuis des siècles. Les premiers cas remontent au Moyen Age, lorsque les assaillants jetaient des cadavres en décomposition dans les villes assiégées pour y répandre des épidémies. La guerre biologique fut interdite sur Terre au vingtième siècle, mais cela n'empêcha pas un grand nombre de pays ou d'organisations terroristes de continuer à développer des armes biologiques "au cas où". [PARAGRAPH:2]Les deux plus grands inconvénients d'un tel arsenal sont, d'une part, la difficulté de répandre une dose assez importante pour être efficace et, d'autre part, le risque d'en subir soi-même les effets. Le premier problème a pu être contourné par la création de super virus embarqués à bord de missiles et dispersés au-dessus de larges territoires, mais le second reste insoluble. En effet, les nouveaux virus sont conçus pour ne vivre que quelques jours ou quelques semaines mais ils sont, comme tous les virus, sujets à des mutations qui peuvent les rendre plus résistants ou plus contagieux. Toute nation qui entreprendrait d'utiliser une telle arme prendrait le risque de provoquer la fin de l'humanité.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Schon seit unzähligen Jahrhunderten haben sich die Menschen die biologische Kriegsführung zunutze gemacht, um sich gegenseitig zu bekämpfen. Die ersten Angriffe dieser Art waren höchst barbarisch - so wurden beispielsweise verseuchte Leichen in belagerte Städte geworfen, Decken von Pestopfern an arglose Einheimische verteilt und so weiter - aber dennoch effizient. Im 20. Jahrhundert war die biologische Kriegsführung schließlich weltweit geächtet, trotzdem ließen sich viele Länder und terroristische Vereinigungen nicht davon abhalten, weiterhin entsprechende Waffen zu erforschen und zu entwickeln - "nur für den Fall". [PARAGRAPH:2]Die größte Schwierigkeit beim Einsatz dieser Art von Waffen ist, eine hinreichend große Dosis freizusetzen, damit der biologische Kampfstoff sofort wirkt, gleichzeitig aber auch sicherzustellen, dass er sich nur gegen den Feind, nicht aber gegen die eigenen Reihen richtet. Das erste Problem wurde zum Teil durch die Entwicklung von Superviren gelöst, die mittels eines Sprengkopfes freigesetzt werden und dann ein großes Areal befallen, die zweite Problematik bleibt aber nach wie vor bestehen: Die neuen Viren besitzen lediglich eine begrenzte Lebensdauer und verlieren nach ein paar Tagen oder Wochen ihre Wirkung, aber wie alle anderen Viren sind auch sie in der Lage zu mutieren - möglicherweise sogar eine deutlich höhere Widerstands- oder Ausbreitungsfähigkeit zu entwickeln - so dass das Risiko auch für die Reihen des Angreifers extrem hoch bleibt. Nur eine völlig irrsinnige Nation würde eine derartige Waffe in einem anderen als dem schlimmsten Fall einsetzen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli umani hanno usato la guerra biologica per innumerevoli secoli. I primi tentativi erano rozzi ma efficaci, come lanciare cadaveri di morti per malattia nelle città sotto assedio, dare le coperte di vittime di un'epidemia a nativi ignari, e così via. La guerra biologica fu bandita sulla Terra nel ventesimo secolo, ma ciò non impedì a molte nazioni e organizzazioni terroristiche di continuare la ricerca e affinare tali armi... "giusto in caso servissero." [PARAGRAPH:2]Lo svantaggio maggiore di tali armi è la difficoltà di usare una dose abbastanza grande da essere immediatamente efficace, così come di trovare un modo per assicurarsi che la malattia non si "rivolti contro" ed elimini completamente le tue truppe, oltre a quelle del nemico. Mentre il primo problema è stato in qualche modo risolto con la creazione di super-virus in grado di sopravvivere alla diffusione tramite missile, per coprire un'area molto grande, il secondo rimane scottante: i nuovi virus sono progettati per avere una vita molto breve e morire dopo pochi giorni o settimane, ma come tutti i virus sono in grado di mutare, magari in qualcosa di più persistente e di facile diffusione, quindi i rischi rimangono molto alti. Solo una nazione molto stupida userebbe una tale arma, se non nel bisogno più disperat
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los humanos han usado la guerra biológica unos contra otros durante innumerables siglos. Los primeros esfuerzos fueron muy rudimentarios pero efectivos: lanzamiento de cadáveres enfermos en ciudades asediadas, entrega de mantas de víctimas de la peste a los incautos nativos, etcétera. La guerra biológica estuvo prohibida en la Tierra durante el s. XX, cosa que no impidió que numerosos países y organizaciones terroristas siguieran investigando y perfeccionando este tipo de armas "por si acaso". [PARAGRAPH:2]El mayor inconveniente de dicho armamento reside en la dificultad de lanzar un ataque lo bastante grande para que sea inmediatamente efectivo, así como en encontrar la manera de asegurarse de que la enfermedad no cambie de dirección y elimine tanto a los enemigos como a los del propio bando. Mientras que la primera dificultad se ha subsanado en parte con la creación de supervirus capaces de sobrevivir tras ser dispersados con una cabeza de misil para cubrir una gran extensión, la segunda parece algo más problemática: los nuevos virus están diseñados para tener una corta vida y autodestruirse tras pocos días o semanas, pero, como todo virus, tienen la capacidad de mutar, tal vez en algo mucho más persistente y fácil de propagar, por lo que los riesgos son extremadamente altos. Solo la nación más imprudente usaría un arma como ésta, excepto en el caso de necesidad más desesperad
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Broñ biologiczna- rodzaj broni masowego raëenia, w której ôadunkiem bojowym sá patogenne mikroorganizmy (np. laseczki wáglika) lub wirusy (np. wirus ospy prawdziwej). Zwyczajowo zalicza siê takëe do broni biologicznej broñ opartá o toksyny pochodzenia biologicznego (np. botulina, rycyna). Broñ biologiczna moëe znaleéâ zastosowanie podczas ataku na pojedyncze osoby, oddziaôy wojska, a takëe ludnoäâ cywilná. Celem ataku biologicznego mogá byâ takëe jednorodne monokultury roälinne lub hodowle zwierzát gospodarskich (terroryzm socjoekonomiczny).

TEXT.English: "Mark my words: once they start using this stuff we might as well just hand the world over to the cockroaches and be done with it." - Olaf Klum331, 'Idiot World'
TEXT.French: "Que ce soit bien clair : dès qu'ils commenceront à utiliser ces trucs, nous serons une espèce en voie de disparition." - Olaf Klum331, "Monde idiot"
TEXT.German: "Denkt an meine Worte: Wenn sie erst anfangen, das Zeug einzusetzen, können wir die Welt auch gleich den Kakerlaken überlassen und die Sache vergessen." - Olaf Klum331, 'Idiot World'
TEXT.Italian: "Ricordate le mie parole: quando inizieranno a usare questa roba tanto varrà consegnare il mondo direttamente agli scarafaggi e farla finita." - Olaf Klum331, "Mondo idiota"
TEXT.Spanish: "Tomad nota: cuando empiecen a usar esta porquería deberemos entregar el mundo a estas cucarachas y hacernos los tontos." - Olaf Klum331, "Mundo Lerdo"
TEXT.Polish: "Zapamiêtaj moje sôowa: gdy tylko spróbujá tego uëyc, moëemy równie dobrze machnáâ na to rêká i oddaâ äwiat karaluchom." - Olaf Klum331, "Idiot World"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biological Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Biological Warfare Lab[COLOR_REVERT] that is required to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Biological Warfare Missiles[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guided Weapons[COLOR_REVERT]) and construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Secret Army Base[COLOR_REVERT] that is required to train the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SR-71 Blackbird[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre biologique[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]laboratoire de guerre biologique[COLOR_REVERT], nécessaire pour construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missiles de guerre biologique[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]missiles guidés[COLOR_REVERT]) et construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]base militaire secrète[COLOR_REVERT], nécessaire pour construire le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SR-71 Blackbird[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Biomaterials
TEXT.French: Bio-matériaux
TEXT.Polish: Biomateriaôy

TEXT.English: [TAB]Biofuel is defined as solid, liquid or gaseous fuel obtained from relatively recently lifeless or living biological material and is different from fossil fuels, which are derived from long dead biological material. Also, various plants and plant-derived materials are used for biofuel manufacturing.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two common strategies of producing liquid and gaseous agrofuels. One is to grow crops high in sugar (sugar cane, sugar beet, and sweet sorghum) or starch (corn/maize), and then use yeast fermentation to produce ethyl alcohol (ethanol). The second is to grow plants that contain high amounts of vegetable oil, such as oil palm, soybean, algae, jatropha, or pongamia pinnata. When these oils are heated, their viscosity is reduced, and they can be burned directly in a diesel engine, or they can be chemically processed to produce fuels such as biodiesel. Wood and its byproducts can also be converted into biofuels such as woodgas, methanol or ethanol fuel.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pioneers such as Henry Ford and Rudolph Diesel designed cars and engines to run on biofuels. Before World War II, the UK and Germany both sold biofuels mixed with petrol or diesel made from crude oil; the availability of cheap oil later ensured market dominance.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Biopaliwa to wszystkie paliwa, wyprodukowane z biomasy. Za biomasê uwaëa siê caôoäâ materii roälinnej i zwierzêcej, ulegajácej biodegradacji, oraz produkty ich przemiany materii, np. krowi nawóz. Z tego wzglêdu róënego rodzaju biopaliw jest mnóstwo i wystêpujá one w formie gazowej, ciekôej i staôej. Poniewaë biomasa jest odnawialnym éródôem energii, moëna z powodzeniem uwaëaâ biopaliwa jako noänik wôaänie energii odnawialnej. W odróënieniu od wêgla kamiennego, brunatnego, gazu ziemnego, paliw jádrowych czy paliw otrzymywanych z ropy naftowej. Definicje pojêcia biopaliwa sá róëne. Przykôadowo za biopaliwa uwaëa siê niekiedy te paliwa, które w ponad 80% (objêtoäciowo) skôadajá siê z przetworzonej (lub nie) biomasy, zebranej w ciágu 10 lat przed jej wyprodukowaniem. Mnie taka definicja siê niespecjalnie podoba, bo w takim przypadku moim zdaniem moëna mówiâ tylko o mieszance zawierajácej ponad 80% biokomponentów. Biomasa jest krótkoterminowym magazynem energii sôonecznej, która wyôapywana jest przez roäliny w procesie fotosyntezy. W dôuëszym horyzoncie czasowym ta energia sôoneczna zmagazynowana jest równieë w wêglu kamiennym i ropie naftowej.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"We should increase our development of alternative fuels, taking advantage of renewable resources, like using corn and sugar to produce ethanol or soybeans to produce biodiesel." -Bobby Jindal
TEXT.French: [SPACE"Nous devons accroître notre développement de carburants alternatifs, en tirant parti des ressources renouvelables, comme l'utilisation de maïs et de sucre pour produire de l'éthanol ou du soja pour produire du biodiesel." -Bobby Jindal]
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Global warming jest äwietnym biznesem. Moëna bardzo dobrze zarobiâ na produkcji nowych technologii. W pewnym momencie okazuje siê, ëe ekologia jest cacy – kiedy zaczyna siê opôacaâ." - Kazimiera Szczuka

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biomaterials[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Biofuel Refinery[COLOR_REVERT]. The first civilization to discover this technology receives a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Engineer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]biomatériaux[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]raffinerie de biocarburant[COLOR_REVERT]. La première civilization à découvrir cette technologie reçoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ingénieur illustre[COLOR_REVERT] gratuit.

TEXT.English: Biomimetics
TEXT.French: Biomimétisme
TEXT.Polish: Biomimetyka

TEXT.English: [TAB]Biomimicry (from bios, meaning life, and mimesis, meaning to imitate) is an ancient concept, recently returning to scientific thought that studies nature, its models, systems, processes and elements and then emulates or takes creative inspiration from to solve human problems sustainably. Biomimetics is the word most frequently used in scientific and engineering literature that is meant to indicate the process of understanding and applying (to human designs) biological principles that underlie the function of biological entities at all levels of organization. This includes biomaterials, biomechanics, biological systems composed of individuals of one species (e.g. schools, herds and swarms), or multispecies ensembles.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Biomimetyka to dziaô nauki zajmujácy siê naäladowaniem zachowania i funkcjonowania natury, a jej celem jest konstruowanie lepszych maszyn poprzez uëycie rozwiázañ opracowywanych przez naturê przez miliony lat.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Nature has been conducting evolutionary experiments for millions of years, so if we're lucky enough to find something close to what we require in nature, then it's very likely to have been highly optimized, and we're unlikely to do much better." - Greg Parker
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La nature a été la réalisation d'expériences de l'évolution des millions d'années, si nous avons la chance de trouver quelque chose proche de ce que nous avons besoin dans la nature, il est très susceptible d'avoir été hautement optimisé, et nous avons peu de chances de faire beaucoup mieux." - Greg Parker

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biomimetics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you train the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stealth Armor[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Submarine[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]biomimétisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Blindé furtif[COLOR_REVERT] et un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]sous-marin à fusion[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Bionics
TEXT.Polish: Bionika

TEXT.English: [TAB]Bionics is the science of applying systems and methods found in nature to technology. This has been done throughout human history of course - basing the shape of an aircraft's wing on that of a bird's wing is one classic example. As the twenty-first century has progressed, great strides have been made in using the model of a living brain to create highly intelligent, adaptable super-computers. [PARAGRAPH:2]While the potential for such machines to aid human growth and development is virtually unlimited, most of the existing "organic computers" have been requisitioned by national militaries, where they are implanted in clones and spend their existence trying to blow each other up. The so-called "automaton" soldiers are less intelligent than their human counterparts - the human brain remains far more sophisticated than any man-made artifact of the same weight and size - but on the other hand the automatons are totally without fear and they follow orders without question. Most human generals think they're totally cool.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La bionique est une science qui étudie les phénomènes naturels susceptibles d'avoir des applications technologiques. Il s'agit d'une science aussi vieille que l'homme. Les ailes des avions, reprenant l'exemple des oiseaux, en sont un exemple classique. Ainsi, dès le vingt-et-unième siècle, l'observation du cerveau humain a permis la mise au point d'ordinateurs organiques très intelligents. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le potentiel de ces machines est quasiment illimité lorsqu'il s'agit d'aider à la croissance et au développement des activités humaines, cependant, la plupart des ordinateurs organiques existants ont été réquisitionnés par les armées, qui les ont greffés sur des clones programmés pour se battre. Ces soldats "automates" sont moins intelligents que les humains (le cerveau humain reste bien plus complexe que les cerveaux artificiels les plus sophistiqués) mais ils ignorent la peur et obéissent aveuglément aux ordres. La plupart des généraux humains applaudissent cette révolution des deux mains.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Bionik ist die Wissenschaft der Umsetzung natürlicher Systeme und Verfahren in der Technik. Dies wurde im Grunde schon in der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte in den verschiedensten Bereichen versucht - ein klassisches Beispiel hierfür ist die Konstruktion von Flugzeugtragflächen, die sich an der Flügelform der Vögel orientierten. Im Laufe des 21. Jahrhunderts erzielte man mit der Entwicklung hochintelligenter, lernfähiger Supercomputer nach dem Vorbild des menschlichen Gehirns schließlich erhebliche Fortschritte auf diesem Gebiet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl das Potenzial dieser Maschinen für die Förderung des Wachstums und der Weiterentwicklung der Menschheit praktisch unbegrenzt ist, werden die "organischen Computer" in erster Linie von den nationalen Militärorganen mit Beschlag belegt, die sie in Klone implantieren und ihr Dasein lediglich darauf reduzieren, sich möglichst effizient gegenseitig in die Luft zu jagen. Die so genannten "Robotersoldaten" sind deutlich weniger intelligent als ihre menschlichen Kameraden - das menschliche Gehirn bleibt im Vergleich zu jeder von Menschenhand gefertigten Maschine gleichen Gewichts und gleicher Größe nach wie vor unübertroffen -, allerdings kennen die Roboter überhaupt keine Furcht und führen Befehle aus, ohne sie in Frage zu stellen. Und genau deshalb sind die meisten menschlichen Militärgeneräle auch so überaus begeistert von ihnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La bionica è la scienza di applicare alla tecnologia sistemi e metodi che si trovano in natura. È sempre stato fatto, nella storia umana: basare la forma dell'ala di un aereo su quella di un uccello è un esempio classico. Con l'avanzamento del ventunesimo secolo, sono stati fatti grandi passi avanti nell'utilizzo del modello di un cervello vivo per la creazione di super computer molto intelligenti e adattabili. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il potenziale di queste macchine per aiutare la crescita e lo sviluppo umani è virtualmente illimitato, ma la maggior parte degli esistenti "computer organici" è stata requisita dagli eserciti nazionali ed è stata innestata in cloni che passano la loro esistenza a cercare di farsi saltare per aria. I cosiddetti soldati "automi" sono meno intelligenti delle loro controparti umane: il cervello umano rimane molto più sofisticato di qualsiasi manufatto dello stesso peso e con le stesse dimensioni. Ma c'è da considerare che gli automi sono completamente senza paura e seguono gli ordini senza esitare. La maggior parte dei generali umani li ador
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La biónica es la ciencia que aplica sistemas y métodos propios de la naturaleza a la tecnología. Por supuesto, se ha ido desarrollando a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad. Un ejemplo clásico es basar el diseño de un ala de avión en la de un pájaro. A medida que ha avanzado el s. XXI, se han hecho grandes progresos en la creación de superordenadores muy inteligentes y adaptables que copian el cerebro humano. [PARAGRAPH:2]A medida que el potencial de dichas máquinas para ayudar al ser humano ha crecido y su desarrollo prácticamente no conoce límites, la mayoría de los "ordenadores orgánicos" han sido requisados por los ejércitos nacionales, que los utilizan para implantarlos en clones y para intentar volarse unos a otros. Los llamados soldados "autómatas" son menos inteligentes que sus homólogos humanos: el cerebro humano sigue siendo más sofisticado que cualquier artefacto fabricado del mismo tamaño y peso. Sin embargo, los autómatas no conocen el miedo y siguen las órdenes sin cuestionarlas. La mayoría de los generales humanos piensan que son lo más de lo má
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Bionika to nauka zajmujáca siê wdraëaniem systemów i metod spotykanych w naturze do technologii czôowieka.[PARAGRAPH:2]U progu dwudziestego pierwszego wieku nastápiôy wielkie postêpy w uëywaniu modelu mózgu przy tworzeniu bardzo inteligentnego superkomputera. Chociaë moëliwoäci takiej maszyny w niesieniu pomocy ludziom sá praktycznie nieograniczone, wiêkszoäâ istniejácych "organicznych superkomputerów" zostaôa uëyta przez siôy zbrojne. Tak zwane "Androidy" sá mniej inteligentne nië ich ludzcy odpowiednicy (ludzki umysô pozostaje duëo bardziej wyrafinowany nië jakikolwiek stworzony przez czôowieka artefakt tego samego ciêëaru i wagi), ale z drugiej strony Androidy sá caôkowicie pozbawione strachu i wykonujá rozkazy bez ëadnych pytañ. Wiêkszoäâ ludzkich generaôów uwaëa, ëe sá one super.

TEXT.English: Brain Machine Interface
TEXT.French: Interface neuronale
TEXT.Polish: Interfejs Czôowiek/Maszyna

TEXT.English: [TAB]A human-machine interface or a brain-computer interface (BCI), sometimes called a direct neural interface or a brain-machine interface, is a direct communication pathway between a human or animal brain (or brain cell culture) and an external device. In one-way BCIs, computers either accept commands from the brain or send signals to it (for example, to restore vision) but not both. Two-way BCIs would allow brains and external devices to exchange information in both directions. [PARAGRAPH:2]Research on BCIs began in the 1970s, but it wasn't until the mid-1990s that the first working experimental implants in humans appeared. Following years of animal experimentation, early working implants in humans now exist, designed to restore damaged hearing, sight and movement. The common thread throughout the research is the remarkable cortical plasticity of the brain, which often adapts to BCIs, treating prostheses controlled by implants as natural limbs. With recent advances in technology and knowledge, pioneering researchers could now conceivably attempt to produce BCIs that augment human functions rather than simply restoring them, previously only the realm of science fiction.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Interfejs mózg-komputer (ang. brain-computer interface, BCI) – interfejs pozwalajácy na bezpoäredniá komunikacjê pomiêdzy mózgiem a odpowiednim urzádzeniem zewnêtrznym. Celem badañ nad interfejsem mózg-komputer jest usprawnienie lub naprawa ludzkich zmysôów albo czynnoäci ruchowych.Badania nad BCI rozpoczêto w latach 1970-tych na University of California Los Angeles (UCLA).[1]W pracach opublikowanych po tych badaniach po raz pierwszy uëyto w historii publikacji naukowych wyraëenia "interfejs mózg-komputer".Od tego czasu dziedzina zastosowañ BCI stale siê rozwija w kierunku m.in. neuroprotetyki- której celem jest przywrócenie uszkodzonego sôuchu, wzroku i czynnoäci ruchowych. Dziêki znacznej plastycznoäci kory mózgowej sygnaôy z implantowanej neuroprotezy mogá, po odpowiednim zaadoptowaniu, byâ przyjmowane przez mózg jakby pochodziôy z wôasnego narzádu zmysôu, moëliwe jest takëe przekazywanie sygnaôów mózgowych odpowiedniej neuroprotezie zawiadujácej ruchem. Po latach doäwiadczeñ na zwierzêtach pierwsze neuroprotezy implantowane ludziom pojawiôy siê w poôowie lat dziewiêâdziesiátych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"My Brain Machine will enable me to advance mans mental evolution a million years. With man possessed of the brain power of the future, the worlds greatest problems can be solved today." - Dr. Cranum ("The All-New Super Friends Hour")
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Mon cerveau-machine me permettra de faire avancer évolution mentale des hommes d'un million d'années. Avec l'homme en possession de la puissance de ce cerveau d'avenir, les plus grands problèmes du monde peuvent être résolus aujourd'hui." - Dr. Cranum ("The All-New Super Friends Hour")
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Byâ czôowiekiem znaczy: kaëdego dnia staraâ siê byâ lepszym." - Friedrich Dessauer

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Brain-Machine Interface[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bioenhancement Centers[COLOR_REVERT].
