TEXT.English: Canals
TEXT.French: Canaux
TEXT.Polish: Kanaôy

TEXT.English: [TAB]Canals are artificial channels for water. There are two types of canals: irrigation canals, which are used for the delivery of water, and waterways, which are navigable transportation canals used for passage of goods and people, often connected to existing lakes, rivers, or oceans. For canals used for water supply, see Aqueduct.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Kanaô wodny – sztuczny ciek wodny, fragment drogi wodnej, którego celem jest poôáczenie istniejácych naturalnych dróg wodnych. Tak powstaôe drogi wodne znacznie uôatwiajá ëeglugê i wydatnie skracajá czas podróëy statków.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"JD: You're not aware of some sort of underground canal system under the hospital, are you? I think I saw a manatee.[NEWLINE]Janitor: Was his name Julian?[NEWLINE]JD: We didn't exchange pleasantries.[NEWLINE]Janitor: That's Julian." - "Scrubs"
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"JD: Vous ne savez pas s'il y a une sorte de système de canaux souterrains dans l'hôpital? Je crois avoir vu un lamantin.[NEWLINE]Gardien: Est-ce qu'il s'appelait Julien?[NEWLINE]JD: Nous n'avons pas échanger de plaisanteries.[NEWLINE]Gardien: C'est Julien." - "Scrubs"
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Woda, której dotykasz w rzece, jest ostatkiem tej, która przeszôa, i poczátkiem tej, która przyjdzie; tak samo teraéniejszoäâ." - Leonardo da Vinci

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Canals[COLOR_REVERT] allows construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath House[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Irrigation Canals[COLOR_REVERT] city improvements and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pont du Gard[COLOR_REVERT] Wonder.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]canaux[COLOR_REVERT] permettent la construction d'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aqueducs[COLOR_REVERT], de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]maison des bains[COLOR_REVERT], et de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]canaux d'irrigation[COLOR_REVERT] et de la merveille du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]pont du Gard[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cartography
TEXT.French: Cartographie
TEXT.Polish: Kartografia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Maps provide a diagrammatic representation of an area, showing terrain features, cities, and other landmarks. The earliest maps were etched clay tablets charting Babylonian lands for the purposes of taxation. Around the same time, the Chinese produced regional maps drawn on silk cloth. In between 600 and 200 BC, the Greeks produced several maps of the known world, including the first map showing a primitive system of latitude and longitude. Traders and merchants primarily used these early maps. Seamen, who often set their courses based only on the tales brought back by previous voyagers, benefited most from the science of map making.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Kartografia, nauka o metodach sporzádzania, powielania i o zastosowaniu map. Definicja Brytyjskiego Towarzystwa Kartograficznego z 1964 podaje, ëe jest to nie tylko nauka i technologia, ale teë sztuka sporzádzania map oraz ich badanie jako dokumentów naukowych, a takëe dzieô sztuki. Poczátki kartografii siêgajá II w. n.e., kiedy to Klaudiusz Ptolemeusz stwierdziô, ëe zadaniem nauk geograficznych jest kartograficzne przedstawienie Ziemi. W 2. poôowie XVIII i w XIX w. kartografiê traktowano jako dziaô geodezji i dopiero z poczátku XX w. wyksztaôciôa siê jako samodzielna nauka. W bieëácym stuleciu duëy wpôyw na rozwój kartografii wywarôa fotogrametria lotnicza.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"A good plan is like a road map: it shows the final destination and usually the best way to get there." - H. Stanley Judd
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Un bon plan est comme une carte routière: il montre la destination finale et le plus souvent la meilleure façon d'y arriver." - H. Stanley Judd
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Mapy majá w ëyôach niebieská krew." - Ramón Gómez de La Serna

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cartography[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to trade [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]maps[COLOR_REVERT] with other civilizations and centers the World Map.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]cartographie[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'échanger les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cartes[COLOR_REVERT] avec d'autres civilisations et de centrer la carte du monde.

TEXT.English: Caste System
TEXT.French: Système de castes
TEXT.Polish: System Kastowy

TEXT.English: [TAB]Castes are systems of occupation, endogamy, social culture, social class, and political power, the assignment of individuals to places in the social hierarchy is determined by social group and cultural heritage. Although India is often now associated with the word "caste", it was first used by the Portuguese to describe inherited class status in their own European society.[PARAGRAPH:2]In medieval Europe, the estates of the realm were a caste system. The population was divided into nobility, clergy, and the commoners. In some regions, the commoners were divided into burghers, peasants or serfs, and the estateless. Although originally based on occupation, one's estate was eventually inherited, because of low social mobility. Poland's nobility were more numerous than those of all other European countries, forming some 8% of the total population in 1791, and almost 16% among ethnic Poles. By contrast, the nobilities of other European countries, except for Spain and Hungary, amounted to a mere 1-3%. In France, serfdom lasted legally until 1789. It persisted in Austria-Hungary till 1848 and was abolished in Russia only in 1861.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Indian caste system describes the social stratification and social restrictions in the Indian subcontinent, in which social classes are defined by thousands of endogamous hereditary groups, often termed as jātis or castes. Within a jāti, there exist exogamous groups known as gotras, the lineage or clan of an individual, although in a handful of sub-castes like Shakadvipi, endogamy within a gotra is permitted and alternative mechanisms of restricting endogamy are used (e.g. banning endogamy within a surname). The fluidity of the caste system was affected by the arrival of the British. Prior to that, the relative ranking of castes differed from one place to another. The castes did not constitute a rigid description of the occupation or the social status of a group. Since the British society was divided by class, the British attempted to equate the Indian caste system to the class system. They saw caste as an indicator of occupation, social standing, and intellectual ability. During the initial days of the British East India Company's rule, caste privileges and customs were encouraged, but the British law courts disagreed with the discrimination against the lower castes. However, British policies of divide and rule as well as enumeration of the population into rigid categories during the 10 year census contributed towards the hardening of caste identities.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]System kastowy to rodzaj systemu stanowego, wiáëácy siê przede wszystkim z kulturami subkontynentu indyjskiego i zapisaná w hinduizmie wiará w reinkarnacjê. Jednostki, które nie przestrzegajá rytuaôów i obowiázków swojej warstwy, w nastêpnym wcieleniu (inkarnacji) odrodzá siê w niëszej warstwie spoôecznej. System kastowy okreäla dozwolone formy kontaktowania siê czôonków hierarchii spoôecznej.W odniesieniu do stratyfikacji spoôecznej w Indiach, poprawnym terminem dla sôowa kasta jest déati. Natomiast w odniesieniu do stanów spoôecznych uëywa siê terminu warna.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"God has no marks, no color, no caste, and no ancestors, no form, no complexion, no outline, no costume and is indescribable." -Guru Gobind Singh
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Dieu n'a pas de marques, ni de couleur, ni de caste, et pas d'ancêtres, ni de forme, ni de complexes, pas de vêtement et est indescriptible." -Guru Gobind Singh
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Czy istniaôa kiedy kasta, która sobie rzekôa: "Basta"?." - Stanisôaw Jerzy Lec

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Caste System[COLOR_REVERT] enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caste[COLOR_REVERT] civic option.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]système de castes[COLOR_REVERT] active la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]castes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cavalry Tactics
TEXT.French: Tactiques de cavalerie
TEXT.Polish: Taktyka Kawalerii

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cavalry tactics have evolved over time. Tactically, the main advantages of cavalry over infantry troops were greater mobility, bigger impact and a higher position. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of the cavalry tactics employed was the caracole, developed in the mid-16th century in an attempt to integrate gunpowder weapons into cavalry tactics. Equipped with one or two wheellock pistols, cavalrymen would advance on their target at less than a gallop. As each rank came into range, the soldiers would turn away, discharge their pistols at the target, retire to reload, and then repeat the manoeuvre. In early times they had an advantage in firepower, but infantry firepower increased. With the invention of the bayonet, the pike screen against charges could also be turned into firing soldiers. The tactic was accompanied by the increasing popularity of the German Reiter in Europan armies from about 1540 or similar equipped, but usually lighter armoured Hakkapeliitta. Their main weapons were two or more pistols and a sword; first most wore three-quarters armor, though as time passed this was reduced to a helmet and a cuirass over a buff leather coat; sometimes they also carried a long cavalry firearm known as an arquebus or a carbine (although this type of horsemen soon became regarded as a separate class of cavalry - the arquebusier or in Britain harquebusier). [PARAGRAPH:2]Modern historians regard the caracole as a tactical system that ultimately proved ineffective. It sacrificed the cavalry advantages of speed and mobility, while also leaving mounted soldiers at a disadvantage to massed infantry equipped with heavier and longer-ranged weapons. The caracole gave way to close artillery support deployed to break up the infantry formations and force the foot soldiers to scatter so that the cavalry would regain their advantage in close-quarters combat. [PARAGRAPH:2]With increasing firepower and no sufficient protection, the role of cavalry on the battlefield was slowly reduced. Light cavalry with fireams could return fire, but the aim was not as good as for infantry. So most important for cavalry was the ability to quickly attack enemy cavalry or scattered infantry with lances and sabres (cold steel). Speed reduced the time vulnerable to gunfire, but still closed formations became impossible to take. This tactic was a striking surprise of Mongolian light cavalry in the battle of the Kalka River. The alternative was to use them as dragoons, reaching their positions quickly, dismounting and firefighting like infantry. Such a way of fighting had started in Europe at least in the 13th century with mounted longbow and crossbow archers, but was also employed by the Mongols with their Buryatian longbows.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]W wiekach XVI i XVII taktyka kawalerii oscylowaôa miêdzy szarëá rozpêdzonych jeédéców uzbrojonych w broñ biaôá, a wykorzystaniem siôy ognia broni palnej. Na przykôad w XVI wieku, gdy broñ strzelecka staôa siê lëejsza, pistolet przejäciowo zastápiô miecz lub szablê jako podstawowe uzbrojenie kawalerzysty. Szczególnie niemiecka kawaleria zaciêëna, czyli tak zwani Schwartzreiterzy ("czarni jeédécy"), odpowiednik piechoty zwanej Landsknechtami, wyspecjalizowaôa siê w taktyce polegajácej na zbliëeniu siê do przeciwnika kôusem w szyku zwartym i wystrzeleniu w kierunku jego pozycji szybkich salw kolejno z trzech pistoletów, a nastêpnie oderwaniu siê od nieprzyjaciela w celu przeôadowania broni. W ten sposób kawaleria mogôa atakowaâ zwarte czworoboki piechoty, pozostajác poza zasiêgiem 9-metrowych pik, które stanowiôy gôówná broñ piechurów przeciwko atakowi jazdy. Gustaw Adolf porzuciô takëe tê praktykê i znów zaczáô uëywaâ jazdy do typowych szarë. Mógô sobie na to pozwoliâ, poniewaë muszkiety jego piechurów miaôy wiêkszá siôê ognia i wiêkszy zasiêg, a poza tym potrafiô skoordynowaâ dziaôania kawalerii i piechoty.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"It's hard to lead a cavalry charge if you think you look funny on a horse." - Adlai E. Stevenson
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Il est difficile de mener une charge de cavalerie si vous pensez être drôle sur un cheval." - Adlai E. Stevenson
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Trudno jest przeprowadzaâ szarëê kawalerii jeäli myälisz, ëe wygládasz ämiesznie na koniu" - Adlai E. Stevenson

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cavalry Tactics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassiers[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Dragoons[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]tactiques de cavalerie[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de recruter des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cuirassiers[COLOR_REVERT] et des des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]dragons[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ceremonial Burial
TEXT.Spanish: Entierro Ceremonial

TEXT.English: [TAB]Groping for an explanation of the world around them, the earliest humans developed the first concepts of religion. Gradually, rites of worship grew to include sacrifices, ceremonies, vigils, symbology, sacred items, and prayer. One significant step in the advance of worship was the ceremonial burial, often a ritual preparation of the deceased's body for the afterlife his or her culture anticipated. The remains of ceremonial burials offer some of the most detailed information about past civilizations.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Pogrzeb traktowany jest jako jeden z podstawowych moralnych i religijnych obowiázków wobec zmarôego czôowieka. Forma obrzêdowa pogrzebu zaleëy od wyznawanego äwiatopogládu osoby lub osób organizujácych pogrzeb, rzadziej od woli zmarôego.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"It is death that goes down to the center of the earth, the great burial church the earth is, and then to the curved ends of the universe, as light is said to do." - Harold Brodkey
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"C'est la mort qui descend vers le centre de la terre, la terre est le grand cimetière, et puis, aux extrémités incurvées de l'univers, en suivant la lumière." - Harold Brodkey
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Pogrzeb na ziemi oznacza byâ moëe przyjêcie weselne wäród anioôów." - Khalil Gibran

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ceremonial Burial[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Graveyards[COLOR_REVERT] and is one prerequisite for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pyramids[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Terracotta Army[COLOR_REVERT] Wonders.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]enterrement cérémoniel[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]cimetière[COLOR_REVERT]. C'est un pré-requis pour construire les merveilles des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]pyramides[COLOR_REVERT] et de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]armée en terre cuite[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Chariotry
TEXT.Polish: Rydwany

TEXT.English: [TAB]The chariot is the earliest and simplest type of carriage, used in both peace and war as the chief vehicle of many ancient peoples: Assyrians, Babylonians, Egyptians, Indians, Greeks, Romans, ancient Britons and others. Chariots were built in Mesopotamia as early as 3000 BC. and in China during the 2d millennium BC. The original chariot was a fast, light, open, two- or four-wheeled conveyance drawn by two or more horses hitched side by side. The car was little else than a floor with a waist-high semicircular guard in front. The chariot, driven by a charioteer, was used for ancient warfare during the Bronze and Iron Ages, armor being provided by bronze shields. The vehicle continued to be used for travel, processions and in games and races after it had been superseded militarily.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Rydwany sá to pojazdy konne, najczêäciej dwu-, ale czasami trzy- lub czterokoôowe, zwykle z tyôu otwarte, znane od okoôo XXVIII w. p.n.e. na caôym Bliskim Wschodzie, i w Egipcie od okoôo XX w. p.n.e. oraz w staroëytnej Grecji od XII wieku p.n.e. (o czym wspomina Homer), póéniej takëe w Rzymie. Mógô byâ zaprzêëony w dwa konie - wtedy zwaô siê bigá, lub w cztery i wtedy nazywaô siê kwadrygá. Jechaôy nim zazwyczaj stojác dwie osoby. Rydwany uëywano w róënych celach. Jako wóz bojowych, powadzony byô przez woénicê a drugi wojownik strzelaô z ôuku, walczyô mieczem, lub teë rzucaô wôóczniá. Niektórzy zeskakiwali z wozu i walczyli dalej pieszo. Z momentem wprowadzenia zwartych formacji bojowych piechoty (jak na przykôad w przypadku greckiej falangi) wycofano go z pola walki. Na poczátku swego istnienia rydwan sôuëyô takëe do polowañ. W Grecji i Rzymie sôuëyô gôównie do wyäcigów w czasie igrzysk olimpijskich, zaä w cyrkach takëe w celach kultowych i reprezentacyjnych..

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Know the self to be sitting in the chariot, the body to be the chariot, the intellect the charioteer, and the mind the reins." - Veda Upanishads
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"On peut comparer l'être humain à un attelage : La structure du char est notre corps, Le cocher est notre intelligence intuitive et Les rennes sont notre intelligence mentale." - Veda Upanishads
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Konia! konia! królestwo za konia!" - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chariotry[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chariot[COLOR_REVERT], which is the first Mounted unit, and build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stables[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]charrerie[COLOR_REVERT] débloque la première unité montée, les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars[COLOR_REVERT], précurseurs de futures unités montées et permet de construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]écurie[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'expérience des unités montées.

TEXT.English: Chivalry
TEXT.French: Chevalerie
TEXT.Polish: Rycerstwo

TEXT.English: [TAB]Chivalry was a code of rules governing the behavior of an aristocratic class of warriors known as knights. First appearing in the 12th century, the rules of chivalry governed not only the knights' behavior in battle, but in their personal lives as well. The chief chivalric virtues of piety, honor, valor, courtesy, chastity, and loyalty represented a fusion of Christian and military morality. A similar code of behavior known as "Bushido" or "the way of the warrior" governed the behavior of the samurai warriors of ancient Japan. Although the strict practice of chivalry had all but disappeared by the 15th century, the ideals of chivalric behavior became the basis for what is now considered to be gentlemanly conduct.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Rycerstwo – w äredniowieczu warstwa spoôeczna (stan) trudniáca siê sôuëbá wojskowá - rycerze. Rycerze czêsto posiadali ziemiê nadawaná im przez suzerena w zamian za hoôd lenny. W XIII i XIV w. przeksztaôciôo siê w szlachtê. W wiêkszoäci pañstw europejskich tytuô rycerski staô siê jednym z niëszych tytuôów szlacheckich , n.p. w Francji jako - chevalier , w Niemczech i monarchii austro - wêgierskiej - Ritter, w Wielkiej Brytanii - knight . W Polsce z uwagi na zasadê równoäci szlacheckiej rycerstwem tytuôowano ogóô szlachty, stosujác teë okreälenia kawaler (tytuô szlachecki) lub formê ôaciñská - equitus.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Some say that the age of chivalry is past, that the spirit of romance is dead. The age of chivalry is never past, so long as there is a wrong left unredressed on earth." - Charles Kingsley
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Certains disent que l'âge de la chevalerie est passé, que l'esprit du roman est mort. L'âge de la chevalerie n'est pas passé, tant qu'il reste de l'injustice sur la terre." - Charles Kingsley
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Niektórzy mówiá, ëe wiek rycerstwa juë przemináô, ëe duch romantycznoäci umarô. Wiek rycerstwa nigdy nie przeminie, tak dôugo dopóki pozostanie niesprawiedliwoäâ na ziemi." - Charles Kingsley

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chivalry[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mailed Knight[COLOR_REVERT] units and build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Blarney Castle[COLOR_REVERT]. This tech also allows the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Standing Army[COLOR_REVERT] civic.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]chevalerie[COLOR_REVERT] permet d'entrainer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chevaliers à cotte de maille[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]château de Blarney[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. permet également la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]armée de métier[COLOR_REVERT] .

TEXT.English: City Planning
TEXT.French: Planification urbaine
TEXT.Polish: Urbanistyka

TEXT.English: [TAB]The ancient Romans used a consolidated scheme for city planning, developed for military defense and civil convenience. The basic plan is a central forum with city services, surrounded by a compact rectilinear grid of streets and wrapped in a wall for defense. To reduce travel times, two diagonal streets cross the square grid corner-to-corner, passing through the central square. A river usually flows through the city, to provide water and transport, and carry away sewage, even in sieges. Effectively, many European towns still preserve the essence of these schemes, as in Turin.The Romans had a very logical way of designing their cities. They put all the streets at right angles, set up in a square grid. All the roads were equal in width and length except for two. These two roads formed the center of the grid and intersected in the middle. One went East/West, the other North/South. They were slightly wider than the others. All roads were made of carefully fitted stones and smaller hard packed stones. Bridges were also constructed where needed. Each square marked by four roads was called an insulae. An insulae was the Roman equivalent of a city block. Each insulae was 80 yards square. The land of each insulae was divided up. As the city developed, each insulae would eventually be filled with buildings of various shapes and sizes and would be crisscrossed with back roads and alleys. Most insulae were given to the first settlers of a budding new Roman city, but each person had to pay for the building of their own houses. The city was surrounded by a wall to protect the city from invaders and other enemies, and to mark the cities limits. Area outside of the walls and city limits was left for farmland. At the end of each main road, there was a large gateway with watchtowers. A portcullis covered the opening when the city was under siege. Other watchtowers were constructed around the rest of the city’s wall. An aqueduct was built outside of the city's walls. This brought in the water necessary for the city's functioning.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Urbanistyka - nauka o programowaniu i planowaniu miast i osiedli oraz ich powstawaniu i historii rozwoju. Urbanistyka zajmuje siê analizá struktur miejskich i na tej podstawie opracowuje koncepcje planistyczne. Zadania urbanistyki obejmujá minimalizacjê konfliktów interesów uëytkowników poszczególnych obiektów budowlanych i ochrona ärodowiska zarówno przyrodniczego jak i kulturowego.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Make no little plans; they have no magic to stir men's blood." - Daniel Burnham
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Ne faites pas de petits plans, ils n'ont pas cette magie qui active le sang des hommes." - Daniel Burnham
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Nie twórz maôych planów; nie ma w nich magii, by pobudziâ ludzká krew." - Daniel Burnham

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]City Planning[COLOR_REVERT] allows [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cottages[COLOR_REVERT] to upgrade to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hamlets[COLOR_REVERT]. It is required for several buildings including the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Summer Palace[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]planification urbaine[COLOR_REVERT] permet aux [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cottages[COLOR_REVERT] de s'améliorer en [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hameaux[COLOR_REVERT]. C'est un pré-requis pour de nombreux bâtiments, dont le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]palais d'été[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Civil Engineering
TEXT.French: Génie civil
TEXT.Polish: Inëynieria Cywilna

TEXT.English: [TAB]Civil engineering is a professional engineering discipline that deals with the design, construction and maintenance of the physical and natural built environment, including works such as bridges, roads, canals, dams and buildings.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Inëynieria Cywilna jest odmianá nauk inëynierskich oraz dyscypliná która ôáczy w sobie takie umiejêtnoäci jak projektowanie, wznoszenie oraz utrzymanie wszelkich obiektów budowlanych w jego ärodowisku naturalnym a w szczególnoäci takich jak mosty, drogi, kanaôy, zapory oraz przede wszystkim budynki. Inëynieria Ládowa jest jedná z najstarszych nauk inëynierskich zaraz po inëynierii wojskowej[1]. W wiêkszoäci przypadków, jest narzêdziem sôuëácym do realizacji wizji architektów, którzy sá pierwszym ogniwem procesu budowlanego.Wiedza która zawiera siê w pojêciu Inëynieria Ládowa tradycyjnie jest powiázana z wieloma specjalnoäciami inëynierskimi takimi jak inëynieria ärodowiska, geotechnika, mechanika konstrukcji, inëynieria transportowa, hydrologia, inëynieria materiaôowa, budownictwo wodne, geodezja, oraz inëynieria produkcji budowlanej i zarzádzania. Inëynieria Ládowa znajduje zastosowanie na wszystkich poziomach ëycia: w sektorze publicznym od najmniejszych gmin aë do zakresu ogólnokrajowego, a w sektorze prywatnym od pojedynczych wôaäcicieli mieszkañ do miêdzynarodowych firm budowlanych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"There can be little doubt that in many ways the story of bridge building is the story of civilization. By it we can readily measure an important part of a people's progress." - Franklin D Roosevelt
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Il ne fait aucun doute que, dans bien des égards l'histoire de la construction de ponts, c'est l'histoire de la civilisation. Par elle, nous pouvons facilement mesurer un élément important de progrès d'un peuple." - Franklin D Roosevelt
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Ludzie budujá za duëo murów, a za maôo mostów." - Isaac Newton

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Civil Engineering[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Skyscrapers[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Construction Firms[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Industrial Parks[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]ingénierie civile[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]gratte-ciels[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]entreprises de construction[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]parcs industriels[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Climate Modelling
TEXT.French: Modèles climatiques
TEXT.Italian: Climate Models
TEXT.Spanish: Climate Models
TEXT.Polish: Modele Klimatyczne

TEXT.English: “Climate is what we expect, weather is what we get.” - Mark Twain
TEXT.French: “Le climat est ce que nous attendons, le temps est ce que nous obtenons.” - Mark Twain

TEXT.English: Climate models use quantitative methods to simulate the interactions of the atmosphere, oceans, land surface, and ice. They are used for a variety of purposes from study of the dynamics of the climate system to projections of future climate.
Clockworks
TEXT.Polish: Mechanizm Zegarowy

TEXT.English: [TAB]In ancient Egypt, time was measured during daylight by a shadow clock and at night by a water clock. During the Middle Ages, time was measured by using sand clocks (hourglass) and sundials. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first watch was invented in Nuremberg, Germany in the early 1500s, although they became cheap enough to be widely available for another 300 years.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first public clock was set up in Milan, Italy in 1353.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Zegar – przyrzád do ciágôego pomiaru czasu.Zegary moëna podzieliâ na wykorzystujáce do wskazañ tarczê i wskazówki oraz np. symbole faz ksiêëyca oraz cyfrowe – wykorzystujáce do wskazañ wyäwietlacze ciekôokrystaliczne lub diodowe.W zegarach powszechnego uëytku wskazania obejmujá najczêäciej godziny, minuty i sekundy. W niektórych zegarach i zegarkach stosowany jest takëe system kalendarzowy do wskazywania dni tygodnia, dat, faz Ksiêëyca itp. W zegarach specjalistycznych stosuje siê bardzo precyzyjne mechanizmy wskazywania i rejestracji czasu z dokôadnoäciá do uôamków sekundy.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"I wasted time, and now doth Time waste me: For now hath Time made me his numb'ring clock; My thoughts are minutes" - William Shakespeare
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"J'ai perdu du temps, et maintenant Le Temps me perds: Maintenant, le Temps a fait de moi son horloge; Mes pensées sont des minutes" - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Czas i godziny biegná przez najtrudniejsze dni." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Clockworks[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Townclocks[COLOR_REVERT] to increase your cities' production.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]horlogerie[COLOR_REVERT] active la construction de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]horloge de ville[COLOR_REVERT], augmentant la production de la ville.

TEXT.English: Cloning
TEXT.Polish: Klonowanie

TEXT.English: [TAB]While the first animals were successfully cloned in the late twentieth century, human cloning was not perfected until decades later. And then only if one uses the term "perfected" in the loosest sense. After much research it became possible to create a physical clone of a human being, identical to the original model down to the smallest detail; however, the clones remain frustratingly incapable of rational thought. All attempts to educate these creatures have failed miserably, and the "smartest" clone remains little more than a drooling moron whose needs must be constantly attended to. So while clones remain excellent organ and limb donors, up until recently little else could be done with them. [PARAGRAPH:2]Recent scientific advances have allowed clones to be equipped with sophisticated computer systems capable of controlling the clones' movement. While the computers are not yet sophisticated enough to allow for the creation of "clone warriors," the zombie-like beings are capable of performing simple, repetitive actions like building roads, tilling farmland, and so forth, doing so more efficiently than purely human workers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les premiers clonages d'animaux datent de la fin du vingtième siècle, mais le clonage humain ne fut mis au point que plusieurs dizaines d'années plus tard. Et même alors, tout n'était pas encore parfait. Après des longues recherches, il fut enfin possible de créer le clone physique d'un être humain, identique en tous points à son modèle. Cependant, ces clones étaient dénués de toute forme d'intelligence. Toutes les tentatives pour éduquer ces créatures échouèrent lamentablement et même les clones les plus évolués s'avérèrent incapables de survivre de manière autonome. Ils furent donc exclusivement utilisés comme donneurs d'organes. [PARAGRAPH:2]Des progrès récents ont permis d'équiper les clones de programmes informatiques très complexes, capables d'en contrôler les mouvements. Si cette technologie ne permet pas à l'heure actuelle la création de "guerriers clones", elle permet de les transformer en automates et de leur assigner des tâches simples et répétitives, comme la construction des routes ou le labourage des terres. Force est de constater que leur efficacité dans ces domaines est nettement supérieure à celle des humains.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bereits im späten 20. Jahrhundert wurden erstmals Tiere erfolgreich geklont, doch das Klonen des Menschen wurde erst Jahrzehnte später perfektioniert - wobei der Begriff "perfektioniert" hier lediglich im einfachsten Sinne gemeint ist. Nach intensiver Forschungsarbeit war es möglich geworden, einen Klon von einem menschlichen Wesen zu erschaffen, der physisch bis ins kleinste Detail mit dem Original übereinstimmte, allerdings nicht in der Lage war, rational zu denken. Alle Versuche, diese Kreaturen zu erziehen bzw. auszubilden, scheiterten kläglich und so war selbst der "klügste" Klon kaum mehr als ein geifernder Volltrottel, der ständiger Betreuung bedurfte. Dementsprechend stellten Klone zwar hervorragende Organ- und Gliedmaßenspender dar, ansonsten konnte man aber nicht allzu viel mit ihnen anfangen - doch dies änderte sich vor kurzem. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dank jüngster wissenschaftlicher Erkenntnisse können Klone nun mit ausgefeilten Computersystemen ausgestattet werden, welche die Steuerung ihrer Bewegungen ermöglichen. Die Computer sind zurzeit zwar noch nicht so gut entwickelt, dass sie die Erschaffung von "Klonkriegern" ermöglichen würden, dennoch können Klone jetzt wie Golems einfache, sich wiederholende Tätigkeiten ausführen und dadurch zum Beispiel im Straßenbau, für die Feldarbeit usw. eingesetzt werden - das sogar effizienter als menschliche Arbeiter.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mentre i primi animali furono clonati con successo nel tardo ventesimo secolo, la clonazione umana non venne perfezionata se non decenni più tardi. E solo se usiamo il termine "perfezionata" nel senso meno stretto. Dopo molte ricerche divenne possibile creare un clone fisico di un essere umano, identico al modello originale fino al più piccolo dettaglio. I cloni rimangono però incapaci di pensare. Tutti i tentativi di educare queste creature sono miseramente falliti e anche il più "intelligente" clone rimane un idiota bavoso che deve essere costantemente accudito. E così, pur essendo i cloni eccellenti donatori di parti e organi, fino a poco tempo fa è stato possibile usarli per ben poco altro. [PARAGRAPH:2]Recenti scoperte scientifiche hanno permesso ai cloni di essere equipaggiati con sofisticati computer in grado di controllare i loro movimenti. Pur non essendo i computer abbastanza sofisticati da poter creare dei "guerrieri cloni", questi esseri tipo zombi sono in grado di compiere azioni semplici e ripetitive come costruire strade, lavorare la terra e via dicendo, facendolo in maniera più efficiente dei lavoratori uman
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Mientras que a finales del s. XX ya se clonaban animales con éxito, la clonación humana no se perfeccionó hasta décadas después. Y solo si se usa el término "perfeccionar" en el más laxo de los sentidos. Tras largas investigaciones fue posible crear un clon físico de un ser humano, idéntico al modelo original hasta en el más mínimo detalle. Sin embargo, los clones siguen siendo frustrantemente incapaces de tener cualquier pensamiento racional. Todos los intentos de educar a dichas criaturas han fracasado miserablemente y el clon "más listo" es algo más que un tonto babeante que requiere atención continua. Así que, aunque los clones son excelentes donantes de órganos y miembros, poco más se puede hacer con ellos. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los últimos avances científicos han permitido que los clones se equipen con sofisticados equipos informáticos capaces de controlar sus movimientos. Aunque los ordenadores no son todavía lo bastante sofisticados como para permitir la creación de "guerreros clonados", los cuasi zombis son capaces de realizar acciones simples y repetitivas, como construir carreteras, labrar la tierra y, además, hacerlo mejor que los trabajadores completamente humano
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Chociaë pierwsze zwierzêta byôy bez przeszkód klonowane pod koniec XX wieku, klonowanie ludzi nie byôo stosowane aë do kilku dziêsiocioleci od tego czasu. Po dôugim okresie badañ moëliwe staôo siê stworzenie fizycznego klonu istoty ludzkiej identycznej do oryginalnego modelu w najmnieszych szczegóôach. Klony byôy jednak caôkowicie niezdolne do racjonalnego myälenia. Wszystkie próby edukowania tych stworzeñ koñczyôy siê fiaskiem; najmádrzejsze z nich byôy niczym wiêcej nië tylko kompletnymi kretynami wymagajácymi nieustannej uwagi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ostatnie postêpy w nauce umoëliwiôy wyposaëanie klonów w wyrafinowane systemy komputerowe zdolne do kontroli nad ich ruchami. Chociaë komputery nie sá jeszcze wystarczajáco zaawansowane aby umoëliwiâ konstrukcjê "klono-ëoônierzy", pozwalajá na wykorzystanie ich do wykonywania czynnoäci takich jak budowa dróg, farm itp..

TEXT.English: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." - Pink Floyd, 'The Wall'
TEXT.French: "Et en fin de compte, tu n'es qu'une brique de plus dans le mur." - Pink Floyd, "The Wall"
TEXT.Polish: "Koniec koñców, jesteäcie tylko kolejná cegôá w murze." - Pink Floyd, "Mur"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cloning[COLOR_REVERT] allows creating the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]First Cloned Mammal[COLOR_REVERT], which then permits construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clone Factories[COLOR_REVERT] and then [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clones[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]clonage[COLOR_REVERT] permet la création du [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]premier mammifère cloné[COLOR_REVERT], qui ensuite permet la construction d'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]usines de clonage[COLOR_REVERT], puis de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]clones[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Communication Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux de communication
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Komunikacyjne

TEXT.English: [TAB]A communication network is a network of telecommunications links and nodes arranged so that messages may be passed from one part of the network to another over multiple links and through various nodes.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Sieâ telekomunikacyjna to termin prawniczy, którego definicja jest zawarta w ustawie z dnia 16 lipca 2004 r. Prawo telekomunikacyjne. Termin ten oznacza systemy transmisyjne oraz urzádzenia komutacyjne lub przekierowujáce, a takëe inne zasoby, które umoëliwiajá nadawanie, odbiór lub transmisjê sygnaôów za pomocá przewodów, fal radiowych, optycznych lub innych ärodków wykorzystujácych energiê elektromagnetyczná, niezaleënie od ich rodzaju.Sieâ telekomunikacyjna to takëe obiekt techniczny, bêdácy zbiorem wêzôów oraz linii telekomunikacyjnych i ôáczy pomiêdzy wêzôami. Sieâ telekomunikacyjna wykonuje przekazywanie danych, informacji lub wiadomoäci w celu komunikacji pomiêdzy dwoma lub wieloma okreälonymi punktami.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The newest computer can merely compound, at speed, the oldest problem in the relations between human beings, and in the end the communicator will be confronted with the old problem, of what to say and how to say it." - Edward R. Murrow
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Le dernier ordinateur peut simplement résoudre, à la vitesse, le plus ancien des problèmes dans les relations entre les êtres humains, et à la fin le communiqant sera confronté à ce vieux problème, de quoi dire et comment le dire." - Edward R. Murrow
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"W sieci moëna udawaâ wszystko, z wyjátkiem tego, co siê naprawdê liczy. Nie moëesz udawaâ inteligencji, poczucia humoru ani bôyskotliwoäci... zôoäliwoäci, przewrotnoäci, ani caôej reszty twojej paskudnej, fascynujácej osobowoäci." - Antonina Liedtke

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communication Networks[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Communication Tower[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Convention Center[COLOR_REVERT] buildings and the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SDI[COLOR_REVERT] project.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]réseaux de communication[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tour de communication[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]palais des congrès[COLOR_REVERT], ainsi que le projet [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]SDI[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Communism

[TAB]Communism is a conceptualized system of government in which resources and production facilities are the property of the entire society rather than individuals. In a communist society, labor is shared equally as well, and the benefits of labor are distributed according to need. Under such a system, all people would be equal, without class stratification.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the basic idea of communism has existed since the time of Plato, modern communism is identified with the system of government described by Karl Marx and Fredrich Engels in the "Communist Manifesto". They believed that capitalistic systems, in which the rich upper class prospered through the exploitation of the powerless lower class, were bound to destroy themselves. At this point, the poor would rebel against their former oppressors and form a classless society. This prophecy has never come true, and countries that have attempted to base their governments on communism have ultimately failed to achieve the utopia described by Marx and Engels.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le communisme est un mode de gouvernement conceptuel dans lequel les ressources et outils de production appartiennent à l'ensemble de la société et non à des individus. Dans une société communiste, le travail est aussi partagé de façon égale et les bénéfices de ce travail sont redistribués selon les besoins. Avec un tel système, tous les citoyens seraient égaux, sans distinction de classe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bien que les principes fondamentaux du communisme existent depuis l'époque de Platon, le communisme moderne se fonde sur le mode de gouvernement décrit par Karl Marx et Friedrich Engels dans le "Manifeste du Parti communiste". Ils y affirment que le système capitaliste, dans lequel la classe supérieure prospère grâce à l'exploitation des classes les plus pauvres, est condamné à se détruire de lui-même. En effet, les pauvres se révolteraient contre leurs oppresseurs pour former une société sans distinction de classe. Cette affirmation ne s'est jamais vérifiée et les pays qui ont essayé de fonder leurs gouvernements sur le système communiste ne sont pas parvenus à atteindre l'utopie décrite par Marx et Engels.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das konzeptionelle Regierungssystem des Kommunismus sieht vor, dass die Ressourcen und Produktionseinrichtungen des Landes Eigentum des Volkes, nicht aber einzelner Personen sind. Darüber hinaus wird in einer kommunistischen Gesellschaft auch die Arbeit zu gleichen Teilen auf die Gemeinschaft aufgeteilt, und die Früchte dieser Arbeit werden schließlich bedarfsbezogen verteilt. In einem solchen System würden alle Menschen gleich behandelt - ohne jegliche Einteilung in eine Klassengesellschaft. [PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl die Grundidee des Kommunismus schon zu Zeiten Platos aufgekommen war, wird der moderne Kommunismus mit dem von Karl Marx und Friedrich Engels im "Kommunistischen Manifest" beschriebenen Regierungssystem identifiziert. Sie glaubten, dass sich kapitalistische Systeme, in denen die reiche Oberklasse von der Ausbeutung der machtlosen Unterklasse profitiert, zwangsläufig selbst zerstören würden. Und sobald dieser Punkt erreicht wäre, würden sich die Armen dann gegen ihre früheren Unterdrücker erheben und eine eigene, klassenlose Gesellschaft gründen. Diese These hat sich nie bewahrheitet: Alle Länder, die ihre Regierungen auf der Grundlage des kommunistischen Systems zu bilden versuchten, konnten die von Marx und Engels beschriebenen utopischen Visionen niemals wirklich realisieren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il comunismo è un sistema di governo in cui le risorse e i mezzi di produzione appartengono alla collettività e non a singoli individui. In una società comunista, anche il lavoro viene distribuito equamente e i suoi prodotti vengono divisi a seconda delle necessità. In un sistema di questo genere, tutti i cittadini sono uguali, senza stratificazione di classi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anche se l'idea alla base del comunismo è esistita sin dai tempi di Platone, il comunismo moderno viene identificato col sistema di governo descritto nel "Manifesto Comunista" di Karl Marx e Friedrich Engels. Essi ritenevano che il sistema capitalistico, in cui le classi agiate prosperavano grazie allo sfruttamento delle classi più povere, fosse destinato ad autodistruggersi. A quel punto, i poveri si sarebbero ribellati contro i loro oppressori e avrebbero creato una società senza classi. Questa previsione non si è mai realizzata e le nazioni che hanno tentato di basare i loro governi sul comunismo non sono riuscite a realizzare il sogno di Marx ed Engels.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El comunismo es un sistema conceptualizado de gobierno en el que los recursos y los centros productivos son propiedad de toda la sociedad, y no de individuos concretos. En una sociedad comunista, el trabajo también se divide a partes iguales, y los beneficios del trabajo se distribuyen de acuerdo con las necesidades. Teóricamente, en un sistema así, toda la gente es igual, sin diferencias de clase.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque el comunismo como idea lleva existiendo desde los tiempos de Platón, el comunismo moderno se identifica con el sistema de gobierno descrito por Karl Marx y Friedrich Engels en el "Manifiesto comunista". Estos dos autores creían que los sistemas capitalistas, en los que la acaudalada clase alta prosperaba gracias a la explotación de un proletariado indefenso, estaban destinados a la autodestrucción. Cuando llegase ese momento, los proletarios se rebelarían contra sus antiguos opresores y formarían una sociedad sin clases. Esta profecía nunca se ha cumplido, y los países que han tratado de basar sus gobiernos en el comunismo no han logrado establecer el sistema utópico descrito por Marx y Engels.

TEXT.English: "When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist." - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.French: "Je nourris un pauvre et l'on me dit que je suis un saint. Je demande pourquoi le pauvre n'a pas de quoi se nourrir et l'on me traite de communiste !" - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.German: "Gebe ich den Armen zu essen, nennen sie mich einen Heiligen. Frage ich, warum sie nichts zu essen haben, nennen sie mich einen Kommunisten!" - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.Italian: "Quando offro il cibo ai poveri, mi chiamano santo. Quando chiedo perché i poveri non hanno cibo, mi chiamano comunista." - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.Spanish: "Cuando doy comida a un pobre me llaman santo. Cuando pregunto por qué un pobre no tiene comida me llaman comunista." - Dom Hélder Câmara

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communism[COLOR_REVERT] enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]State Property[COLOR_REVERT] civic and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Permanent Alliances[COLOR_REVERT]. It also allows construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Intelligence Agency[COLOR_REVERT] building and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT] world wonder. The first to research [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communism[COLOR_REVERT] receives a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Spy[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]communisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet d'instaurer la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nationalisation[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]alliances permanentes[COLOR_REVERT]. Il permet aussi la construction des merveilles suivantes : l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agence de renseignements[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT]. Le premier à découvrir le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communisme[COLOR_REVERT] reçoit gratuitement un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espion illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kommunismus[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht die Einführung der Staatsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Staatseigentum[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Allianzen[COLOR_REVERT]. Das Gebäude [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Geheimdienst[COLOR_REVERT] und das Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kreml[COLOR_REVERT] können gebaut werden. Wer den [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kommunismus[COLOR_REVERT] zuerst erforscht, erhält einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Spion[COLOR_REVERT] umsonst.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione della forma di governo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Proprietà statale[COLOR_REVERT] e delle [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]alleanze permanenti[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre permette la costruzione dei [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Servizi segreti[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cremlino[COLOR_REVERT]. La prima civiltà che ricerca il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] riceve anche una [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande spia[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] activa el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Propiedad estatal[COLOR_REVERT], así como las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alianzas permanentes[COLOR_REVERT]. Permite además construir el edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agencia de inteligencia[COLOR_REVERT] y la maravilla del mundo de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scotland Yard[COLOR_REVERT]. El primero en investigar el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] recibe un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran espía[COLOR_REVERT] gratis.

TEXT.English: Composites
TEXT.Polish: Kompozyty

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "composite" refers to any object that is made up of more than one material. Composites were used quite early in human history; composite bows have been discovered dating back to 1300 BC. The composite technology refers the late 20th Century invention of various metal and plastic composites with greater strength, lightness, and other special properties than the base materials. [PARAGRAPH:2]Kevlar, the modern battle armor, is a composite material. Modern tanks are constructed of steel-boron nitride composites. Stealth airplanes use composite materials that are much more difficult to spot on radar. The tungsten-carbide composite is used in drill bits and wedding rings. [PARAGRAPH:2]Composite materials often demand extremely complex and precise manufacturing processes. However expensive the process may be, the resulting material may have superior qualities that make them more than worth the expense.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme "composite" désigne les objets fabriqués à partir de plusieurs matériaux. De tels objets existent depuis longtemps. Les arcs composites sont, par exemple, apparus vers 1 300 av. J.-C. Vers la fin du XXe siècle, ce terme désigne des métaux et des matières plastiques créés pour leur solidité, leur légèreté ou autres propriétés que ne possèdent pas les produits de base. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le kevlar, utilisé comme armure moderne, est un matériau composite. Les chars d'assaut sont fabriqués avec un composite acier-nitrure de bore. Les avions furtifs utilisent des matériaux composites difficilement décelables par les radars. Le carbure de tungstène sert à fabriquer des alliances et des mèches de perceuses.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les procédés de fabrication des matériaux composites sont souvent extrêmement complexes et donc coûteux. Cependant, aussi chers que soient ces matériaux, leurs qualités exceptionnelles justifient amplement ce coût.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Verbundstoff" bezeichnet aus zwei oder mehr Materialien zusammengesetzte Objekte. Verbundstoffe wurden bereits in der Frühzeit der Menschheitsgeschichte eingesetzt. Bereits 1300 vor Christus entstanden die ersten Kompositbögen. Die Verbundtechnologie umfasst die Entwicklung verschiedener Metall- und Pastikverbundstoffe, die sich durch bessere Stabilität, geringeres Gewicht und andere Aspekte von den Ausgangsmaterialien unterscheiden. [PARAGRAPH:2]Kevlar, die moderne Kampfpanzerung, ist ebenfalls ein Verbundstoff. Moderne Panzer bestehen aus Stahl-Bornitrid-Verbundstoffen. Tarnkappen-Flugzeuge nutzen Verbundstoffe, die von Radarsystemen kaum zu orten sind. Wolframkarbid wird für die Herstellung von Bohrfuttern und Eheringen verwendet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Für die Herstellung von Verbundstoffen sind meist komplexe Prozesse erforderlich. Allerdings rechtfertigen die Eigenschaften des Endprodukts den technischen Aufwand für die Herstellung.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Con il termine "composto" si indica qualsiasi oggetto realizzato con più di un materiale. I composti vennero usati molto presto: sono stati scoperti degli archi composti risalenti al 1300 a. C. Questa tecnologia si affermò nel tardo XX secolo, con l'invenzione di composti più resistenti, leggeri e con altre proprietà rispetto ai materiali base. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il kevlar, utilizzato nelle moderne armature da combattimento, è realizzato da materiali composti; i carri armati sono costruiti con vari composti di nitruro di ferro e boro. Gli aerei stealth ricorrono a materiali composti che risultino impossibili da rilevare con i radar. Il carburo di tungsteno è un materiale composto utilizzato per le punte di trapani e fedi nuziali.[PARAGRAPH:2]I materiali composti spesso richiedono delle operazioni di manifattura precise e complesse. Malgrado gli elevati costi di lavorazione, il materiale è estremamente valido.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El término "compuesto" hace referencia a cualquier objeto formado por más de un material. Los compuestos son muy antiguos, hasta tal punto que se han descubierto arcos compuestos que datan del año 1300 a. C. La tecnología de los compuestos hace referencia a la invención, a finales del siglo XX, de diferentes compuestos plásticos y metálicos con mayor fuerza, ligereza y otras propiedades que los materiales básicos. [PARAGRAPH:2]El kevlar, que se utiliza para fabricar las armaduras modernas, es un ejemplo de este material. Los tanques modernos están hechos de compuestos de nitruro de boro y acero. Los aviones invisibles utilizan materiales compuestos, mucho más difíciles de localizar en el radar. El compuesto de carburo de tungsteno se emplea en la fabricación de brocas y anillos de compromiso. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los materiales compuestos suelen exigir procesos de manufactura extremadamente complejos y precisos. Sin embargo, por caro que resulte el proceso, las propiedades del material resultante suelen compensar con creces el gasto.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Termin "kompozyty" opisuje obiekt który jest stworzony z wiêcej nië z jednego materiaôu. Kompozyty byôu uëywane caôkiem wczeänie;ôuki kompozytowe wynaleziono ok. 1300 r.p.n.e. Jednakëe gôóne znaczenie tego terminu dotyczy XX wiecznych odkryâ zwiázanych z róënorodnymi metalami i materiaôami syntetyczymi. Materiaôy te majá wiêkszá siôê, mniejszá wagê i inne specjalne wôaäciwoäci, róëniáce ich od podstawowych materiaôów. [PARAGRAPH:2]Kewlar, nowoczesny materiaô bêdácy gôównym skôadnikiem pancerzy czy kamizelek kuloodopornych - jest materiaôem kompozytowym. Wspóôczesne czoôgi sá skonstruowane z kompozytowej stali. Pokrywa samolotów niewykrywalnych przez radary ("Stealth") jest stworzona z kompozytów, które sá mniej podatne na fale radarowe. Äwidry wolframowo-wêglowe sá o wiele lepsze ni wytrzymalsze nië zwyczajne. [PARAGRAPH:2] Materiaôy kompozytowe wymagajá niezwykle skomplikowanego i precyzyjnego procesu produkcji. Jednakëe jakkolwiek drogi byôby ten proces - wôaäciwoäci tych materiaôów sá tego warte...

TEXT.English: "The whole is greater than the sum of its parts." - Aristotle
TEXT.French: "La totalité est plus que la somme des parties." - Aristote
TEXT.German: "Das Ganze ist mehr als die Summe seiner Teile." - Aristoteles
TEXT.Italian: "Il risultato è migliore della somma delle sue parti." - Aristotele
TEXT.Spanish: "Un todo es mayor que la suma de sus partes." - Aristóteles
TEXT.Polish: "Caôoäâ jest czymä wiêcej niéli sumá skôadników." - Arystoteles

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Composites[COLOR_REVERT] enables construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Armour[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rocket Artillery[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Anti-Tank[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Marine[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Strike Fighter[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]matériaux composites[COLOR_REVERT] permettent la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]blindés modernes[COLOR_REVERT], d'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]artillerie lance-roquettes[COLOR_REVERT], d'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]anti-char[COLOR_REVERT], de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]marine moderne[COLOR_REVERT], et de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chasseurs d'assaut[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Computer Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux informatiques
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Komputerowe

TEXT.English: [TAB]A computer network is an interconnection of a group of computers. Networks may be classified by what is called the network layer at which they operate according to basic reference models considered as standards in the industry such as the four-layer Internet Protocol Suite model. While the seven-layer Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) reference model is better known in academia, the majority of networks use the Internet Protocol Suite (IP) as their network model. -- Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Sieâ komputerowa – grupa komputerów lub innych urzádzeñ poôáczonych ze sobá w celu wymiany danych lub wspóôdzielenia róënych zasobów, na przykôad: korzystania ze wspólnych urzádzeñ, np. drukarek, skanerów, korzystania ze wspólnego oprogramowania, korzystania z centralnej bazy danych, przesyôania informacji miêdzy komputerami (komunikaty, listy, pliki).

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"I think that the online world has actually brought books back. People are reading because they're reading the damn screen. That's more reading than people used to do." - Bill Murray
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Je pense que le monde en ligne a effectivement ramené les livres sur le devant de la scène. Les gens lisent, parce qu'ils lisent sur ces foutus écrans. Mais C'est plus de lecture que les gens n'ont eu l'habitude de faire." - Bill Murray
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Myälê, ëe äwiat online wôaäciwie przywróciô ksiáëki z powrotem. Ludzie sá czytelnikami, poniewaë czytajá ten cholerny ekran." - Bill Murray

TEXT.French: Conglomérats
TEXT.Polish: Konglomeracje

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Conglomerates are out of favour - the market favours corporate clarity and generally discounts conglomerates. The theme here is a focus on synergies." - Robert Kindler

TEXT.English: Consumerism
TEXT.French: Consumérisme
TEXT.Polish: Konsumpcjonizm

TEXT.English: "Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's need, but not every man's greed." - Mahatma Gandhi
TEXT.French: La terre fournit assez pour satisfaire le besoin de chaque homme, mais tous ne sont pas avares. - Mahatma Gandhi

TEXT.English: The Industrial Revolution made consumer goods available in much greater quantities and at much lower prices than ever before. Further advances in scientific management led to great strides in productivity. As a result, more and more people had incomes beyond that necessary for survival, allowing them to purchase luxuries. Advertising and public relations techniques also drove the shift towards consumer goodsand away from capital goods and industrial infrastructure, and the term "conspicuous consumption" was used more and more. Buying particular goods became a symbol of status.

[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Consumerism[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shopping District[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Madison Avenue[COLOR_REVERT]. It is also required for several different [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporations[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]consumérisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centre commercial[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Madison Avenue[COLOR_REVERT]. C'est un pré-requis pour plusieurs [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]corporations[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Controlled Plasma
TEXT.French: Plasma contrôlé
TEXT.Polish: Kontrola Plazmy

TEXT.English: [TAB]In physics and chemistry, plasma is a partially ionized gas, in which a certain proportion of electrons are free rather than being bound to an atom or molecule. The ability of the positive and negative charges to move somewhat independently makes the plasma electrically conductive so that it responds strongly to electromagnetic fields. Plasma therefore has properties quite unlike those of solids, liquids or gases and is considered to be a distinct state of matter. Plasma typically takes the form of neutral gas-like clouds, as seen, for example, in the case of stars. Like gas, plasma does not have a definite shape or a definite volume unless enclosed in a container, but unlike gas, in the influence of a magnetic field, it may form structures such as filaments, beams and double layers. [PARAGRAPH:2]For plasma to exist, ionization is necessary. The term "plasma density" by itself usually refers to the "electron density", that is, the number of free electrons per unit volume. The degree of ionization of a plasma is the proportion of atoms which have lost (or gained) electrons, and is controlled mostly by the temperature. Even a partially ionized gas in which as little as 1% of the particles are ionized can have the characteristics of a plasma (i.e. respond to magnetic fields and are highly electrically conductive).[PARAGRAPH:2]Temperature controls the degree of plasma ionization. In particular, plasma ionization is determined by the "electron temperature" relative to the ionization energy (and more weakly by the density) in a relationship called the Saha equation. A plasma is sometimes referred to as being "hot" if it is nearly fully ionized, or "cold" if only a small fraction (for example 1%) of the gas molecules are ionized (but other definitions of the terms "hot plasma" and "cold plasma" are common). Even in a "cold" plasma the electron temperature is still typically several thousand degrees Celsius. Plasmas utilized in "plasma technology" ("technological plasmas") are usually cold in this sense.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Plazmá nazywamy materiê o stanie skupienia przypominajácym gaz, zôoëona zarówno z czástek obojêtnych, jak i naôadowanych elektrycznie, jednak jako caôoäâ - elektrycznie obojêtna. Wg jednej z teorii w stanie plazmy znajduje siê ponad 99% materii tej czêäci Wszechäwiata, która znajduje siê w obszarze dostêpnym dla ludzkiej obserwacji.[1] Dokôadniejsza definicja plazmy zaleëy od kontekstu badañ.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water-—unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Le Plasma semble avoir les types de propriétés qu'on voudrait pour la vie. C'est un peu comme l'eau liquide - imprévisible et donc capable de se comporter d'une manière extrêmement complexe. Il pourrait probablement transporter autant d'informations que l'ADN. Il a au moins le potentiel de s'organiser de manière intéressante." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Dziä rozmawiamy o kosmosie niby o wielkim jarmarku." - Ramón Gómez de la Serna

TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]plasma contrôlé[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]blindés à plasma[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]réacteur international expérimental thermonucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] qui est requis pour pouvoir construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centrale à fusion[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Counter Culture
TEXT.French: Contre-culture
TEXT.Polish: Kontrkultura

TEXT.English: "Turn on, tune in, drop out." - Timothy Leary
TEXT.French: Allumez, restez à l'écoute, arrêtez. - Timothy Leary

TEXT.English: Counterculture can be defined as any subculture that stands in at least deviation from, and often outright opposition to, the cultural norms of the majority. Examples of counterculture in history included the Romantics and the Bohemians. The most famous counterculture developed in the Western world in the 1960's, in opposition to the materialism of the 1950's and the Vietnam War. The 1960's counterculture embraced rock music, pop art, spirituality, and psychoactive drugs.

[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Counterculture[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Woodstock[COLOR_REVERT] and (along with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communication Networks[COLOR_REVERT] tech) [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Burning Man[COLOR_REVERT] wonders.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]contre-culture[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les merveilles du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]le festival de Woodstock[COLOR_REVERT] et (avec la découverte des [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]réseaux de communication[COLOR_REVERT]) du "[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Burning Man[COLOR_REVERT]".

TEXT.English: Crop Rotation
TEXT.French: Rotation des cultures
TEXT.Polish: Pôodozmian

TEXT.English: [TAB]Crop rotation is the practice of growing a series of dissimilar types of crops in the same area in sequential seasons for various benefits such as to avoid the build up of pathogens and pests that often occurs when one species is continuously cropped. Crop rotation also seeks to balance the fertility demands of various crops to avoid excessive depletion of soil nutrients. A traditional component of crop rotation is the replenishment of nitrogen through the use of green manure in sequence with cereals and other crops. It is one component of polyculture. Crop rotation can also improve soil structure and fertility by alternating deep-rooted and shallow-rooted plants.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Pôodozmian - system zagospodarowania ziemi uprawnej, oparty na zaplanowanym z góry na wiele lat nastêpstwie roälin po sobie, na wyznaczonym do tego celu obszarze podzielonym na pola, jednoczeänie dostosowany do specyficznych warunków rolniczo-ekonomicznych gospodarstwa.Pôodozmian okreäla równieë strukturê zasiewów, bêdácá podstawá do ustalenia typu pôodozmianu. Rotacja moëe nastêpowaâ w cyklach kilkuletnich lub kilkunastoletnich, wiáëác siê z hodowlá zwierzát (pôodozmiany paszowe, pastewne), czy teë z przemysôem rolniczym (pôodozmiany przemysôowe). Gôównym celem stosowania pôodozmianu jest uzyskanie dziêki odpowiedniemu zmianowaniu roälin wzrostu ëyznoäci gleby, co wiáëe siê ze zwiêkszeniem iloäci i jakoäci produkcji roälinnej oraz poärednio zwierzêcej gospodarstwa. Odgrywa równieë duëá rolê jako jedna z metod zwalczania chwastów.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Farm when it's sunny, read when it rains. -Japanese Proverb
TEXT.French: [SPACE]Travaille la terre quand il fait soleil, lit quand il pleut. - Proverbe Japonais
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]Gdzie rolnik leniwy, tam leniwa i ziemia." - przysôowie duñskie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Crop Rotation[COLOR_REVERT] increases the food production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farms[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]rotation des cultures[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la production de nourriture des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fermes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cryogenics
TEXT.French: Cryogénisation
TEXT.Polish: Kriogenika

TEXT.English: [TAB]In physics or engineering, cryogenics is the study of the production of very low temperatures and the behavior of materials at those temperatures. (Rather than the familiar temperature scales of Fahrenheit and Celsius, cryogenicists use the Kelvin (and formerly Rankine) scales.) [PARAGRAPH:2]The word cryogenics means "the production of freezing cold"; however the term is used today as a synonym for the low-temperature state. It is not well-defined at what point on the temperature scale refrigeration ends and cryogenics begins. The workers at the National Institute of Standards and Technology at Boulder, Colorado have chosen to consider the field of cryogenics as that involving temperatures below –180 Celsius (93.15 Kelvin). This is a logical dividing line, since the normal boiling points of the so-called permanent gases (such as helium, hydrogen, neon, nitrogen, oxygen, and normal air) lie below -180 Celsius while the Freon refrigerants, hydrogen sulfide, and other common refrigerants have boiling points above -180 Celsius. [PARAGRAPH:2]Liquefied gases, such as liquid nitrogen and liquid helium, are used in many cryogenic applications. Liquid nitrogen is the most commonly used element in cryogenics and is legally purchasable around the world. Liquid helium is also commonly used and allows for the lowest attainable temperatures to be reached.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Kriogenika - dziedzina nauki (fizyki i techniki) zajmujáca siê badaniem i wykorzystaniem wôasnoäci ciaô w niskich temperaturach, uzyskiwaniem i mierzeniem niskich temperatur. Za niskie temperatury uznaje siê temperatury mniejsze od -150°C (123K). Kriogenika ma powaëny udziaô w takich dziedzinach jak: badania przestrzeni kosmicznej, biologii i chirurgii, w przemyäle spoëywczym, metalurgicznym, chemicznym i urzádzeniach nadprzewodzácych. Ogromná rolê odgrywa kriogenika w rozwoju nowych kierunków nauki i techniki, przy czym najbardziej perspektywiczne wydaje siê wykorzystanie jej w elektroenergetyce i elektronice. Zastosowanie elementów nadprzewodzácych w urzádzeniach energetycznych prowadzi do znacznego zmniejszenia kosztów i masy tych urzádzeñ oraz zwiêkszenia sprawnoäci i wydajnoäci przy zachowaniu ich mocy.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Believing cryonics could reanimate somebody who has been frozen is like believing you can turn hamburger back into a cow." - Dr. Arthur Rowe
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Croire que la cryogénisation pourrait réanimer quelqu'un qui a été congelé, c'est comme croire que vous pouvez à partir d'un hamburger obtenir à nouveau une vache." - Dr. Arthur Rowe
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Nauka jest jak niezmierne morze... Im wiêcej jej pijesz, tym bardziej jesteä spragniony. Kiedyä poznasz, jaka to jest rozkosz. Ucz siê tylko, co jest siô w tobie, ëeby jej zakosztowaâ." - Stefan Ëeromski

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cryogenics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]SS Stasis Chamber[COLOR_REVERT] spaceship part.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]cryogénie[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire le module spatial de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]chambre d'équilibrage SS[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cybernetics
TEXT.Polish: Cybernetyka

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cybernetics is the study of communication and control in complex systems - human, animal, insect, or machine. (The word "cybernetics" is taken from a Greek word that means "the art of steering.") The fields of study within this broad subject run from examinations of how social structures - beehives, cities - react to, store, and pass on information, to how humans can best interface with the ever-more-important machines that increasingly affect our world. [PARAGRAPH:2]In the early twenty-first century, cybernetics became increasingly interested in human prosthetics, creating ever-more functional and useful replacements for lost limbs and organs. The most exciting breakthrough came when a team in Switzerland successfully transplanted a human brain into a fully-functional humanoid robot, creating the first true "cyborg" in history. And while the experiment was not a total success - the cyborg unfortunately went insane and killed the entire research team within moments after being awakened - the speed, skill and dexterity with which the cyborg dispatched the engineers were indeed quite impressive. Further experiments with cyborgs have since been limited to human clones, which are far less prone to psychosis.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La cybernétique est l'étude des échanges d'information et des moyens de les contrôler plus efficacement, que ce soit au niveau de l'homme, de l'animal ou de la machine. (Le mot "cybernétique" a pour sens étymologique "gouvernail".) Les champs d'étude de cette science vont de l'analyse de la gestion des informations par les structures sociales (ruches, villes, etc.) à celle de l'interaction entre les humains et les machines, qui prennent une place de plus en plus importante dans notre monde. [PARAGRAPH:2]Au début du vingt-et-unième siècle, la cybernétique commença à s'intéresser à la science des prothèses, pour permettre de remplacer efficacement les membres ou les organes endommagés. Cette technologie prit une nouvelle dimension lorsqu'une équipe suisse parvint à transplanter un cerveau humain sur un robot humanoïde, créant ainsi le premier cyborg de l'histoire. Cette expérience ne fut pas un succès complet (le cyborg devint incontrôlable et tua tous les membres de l'équipe de recherche peu de temps après avoir été animé) mais la rapidité, l'adresse et la dextérité dont fit preuve le cyborg pour massacrer les ingénieurs laissait entrevoir tout son potentiel. D'autres expériences ont depuis été menées sur des clones humains, bien moins susceptibles de céder à la psychose.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kybernetik ist die Lehre der Kommunikation und Kontrolle in komplexen Systemen - Menschen, Tiere, Insekten und auch Maschinen betreffend. (Das Wort "Kybernetik" ist von dem griechischen Wort für "Steuermannskunst" abgeleitet.) Die Forschungen auf diesem weitläufigen Gebiet reichen von Untersuchungen hinsichtlich der Reaktion, Speicherung und Weitergabe von Informationen in sozialen Strukturen - zum Beispiel in Bienenstöcken oder Kommunen - bis hin zur Ergründung der bestmöglichen Interaktion zwischen den Menschen und den in der Welt immer mehr an Bedeutung gewinnenden Maschinen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Im frühen 21. Jahrhundert richtete sich das Interesse der Kybernetik-Wissenschaft verstärkt auf die menschliche Prothetik, welche die Herstellung funktionalerer Prothesen als Ersatz für verlorene Gliedmaßen und Organe ermöglicht. Der Aufsehen erregendste Durchbruch auf diesem Gebiet gelang einem Forschungsteam aus der Schweiz, das ein menschliches Gehirn in einen vollfunktionalen Roboter transplantierte und so den ersten echten "Cyborg" der Geschichte erschuf. Leider war dieses Experiment am Ende nicht wirklich von Erfolg gekrönt, denn der Cyborg geriet außer Kontrolle und tötete nur wenige Augenblicke nach seiner Aktivierung das gesamte Team - dennoch zeigte sich die Welt der Wissenschaft durchaus davon beeindruckt, wie schnell und geschickt der Cyborg bei der Tötung der Ingenieure vorgegangen war. Weitere Experimente mit Cyborgs beschränken sich seither allerdings sicherheitshalber auf menschliche Klone, die weitaus weniger anfällig für Psychosen sind.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Cybernetyka to nauka o komunikacji i kontroli zôoëonych systemów - ludzkiego, zwierzêcego lub maszynowego. Obszar badañ tej nauki obejmuje obserwacjê tego jak struktury spoôeczne (roje owadów, miasta itp.) reagujá, przyswajajá oraz przekazujá informacje.[PARAGRAPH:2]Na poczátku XXI wieku cybernetyka skoncentrowaôa siê wokóô tworzenia funkjonalnych i uëytecznych zamienników ludzkich koñczyn oraz organów wewnêtrznych. Najbardziej ekscytujácym przeôomem byôa jednak transplantacja ludzkiego umysôu do humanoidalnego robotu i stworzenie tym samym pierwszego w historii "cyborga". I chociaë eksperyment nie byô caôkowitym sukcesem - cyborg niestety dostaô szaôu i zabiô caôá ekipê badawczá po zaledwie kilku minutach od przyjäcia na äwiat - szybkoäâ i zrêcznoäâ z jaká to zrobiô byôa naprawdê imponujáca. Dalsze ekperymenty z cyborgami zostaôy wiêc ograniczone do ludzkich klonów, które to sá duëo bardziej odporne psychicznie.

TEXT.English: Cyber Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre cybernétique
TEXT.Polish: Cyber Wojna

TEXT.English: "The only truly secure system is one that is powered off, cast in a block of concrete and sealed in a lead-lined room with armed guards - and even then I have my doubts." - Gene Spafford
TEXT.French: Le seul système vraiment sûr est celui qui est éteint, enterré dans un bloc de béton et scéllé dans un chambre plombée avec des gardes armés - et encore, j'ai quelques doutes. - Gene Spafford

TEXT.English: Cyber warfare refers to any kind of organized attack on a computer or computer network for causing damage or disruption. Since the creation of the Internet, it has become possible to attack computers through various means and for various purposes. Cyberattacks can steal information, make resources unavailable, compromise key components, and even cause equipment to malfunction by giving it incorrect instructions. One of the most well-known cyberwarfare attacks is Stuxnet, a worm program designed to attack a particular kind of industrial software used by Iranian nuclear enrichment facilities. It is believed that both Israel and the United States were backing this program.
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cyber Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hacker [COLOR_REVERT] unit and build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Firewall[COLOR_REVERT] Wonder.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre cybernétique[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]pirate informatique[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire la merveille du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]grand pare-feu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Derivatives
TEXT.French: Produits dérivés de crédits
TEXT.Polish: Instrumenty pochodne

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Derivatives[COLOR_REVERT] grants all of your cities 1 free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant[COLOR_REVERT] and increases the gold production of your [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wall Street[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Global Stock Exchange[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]produits dérivés[COLOR_REVERT] procurent à toutes vos villes un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]marchand[COLOR_REVERT] et augmentent la production d'or de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wall Street[COLOR_REVERT] et de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bourse des valeurs mondialisée[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: A derivative is an agreement or contract that is not based on a real, or true, exchange, i.e.: There is nothing tangible like money, or a product, that is being exchanged. For example, a person goes to the grocery store, exchanges a currency (money) for a commodity (say, an apple). The exchange is complete, both parties have something tangible. If the purchaser had called the store and asked for the apple to be held for one hour while the purchaser drives to the store, and the seller agrees, then a derivative has been created. The agreement (derivative) is derived from a proposed exchange (trade money for apple in one hour, not now).
TEXT.French: Un produit dérivé est un accord ou un contrat qui n'est pas fondée sur un véritable échange de biens réels : Il n'y a rien de tangible comme de l'argent, ou un produit, qui est échangé. Par exemple, une personne va à l'épicerie, échange de la monnaie (de l'argent) pour un produit (par exemple, une pomme). L'échange est terminé, les deux parties ont quelque chose de tangible. Si l'acheteur a appelé le magasin et a demandé que la pomme lui soit réservé pendant une heure le temps que l'acheteur arrive au magasin, et le vendeur accepte, alors un produit dérivé a été créé. L'accord (dérivé) est dérivé d'un échange proposé (commerce de l'argent pour la pomme dans une heure, pas maintenant).

TEXT.English: "Derivatives are financial weapons of mass destruction."[NEWLINE] - Warren Buffett
TEXT.French: "Les produits dérivés de crédits sont des armes financières de destruction massive."[NEWLINE] - Warren Buffett
TEXT.Polish: "Instrumenty pochodne sá finansowá broniá masowego raëenia."[NEWLINE] - Warren Buffett

TEXT.English: DNA Computing
TEXT.French: Informatique génétique
TEXT.Polish: Biokomputer

TEXT.English: [TAB]DNA computing is a form of computing which uses DNA, biochemistry and molecular biology, instead of the traditional silicon-based computer technologies. DNA computing, or, more generally, molecular computing, is a fast developing interdisciplinary area. Research and development in this area concerns theory, experiments and applications of DNA computing. [PARAGRAPH:2]DNA computing is fundamentally similar to parallel computing in that it takes advantage of the many different molecules of DNA to try many different possibilities at once. For certain specialized problems, DNA computers are faster and smaller than any other computer built so far. But DNA computing does not provide any new capabilities from the standpoint of computability theory, the study of which problems are computationally solvable using different models of computation. For example, if the space required for the solution of a problem grows exponentially with the size of the problem (EXPSPACE problems) on von Neumann machines it still grows exponentially with the size of the problem on DNA machines. For very large EXPSPACE problems, the amount of DNA required is too large to be practical. (Quantum computing, on the other hand, does provide some interesting new capabilities).
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Bio Komputery sá to komputery wykorzystujáce ludzkie DNA oraz wykorzystywane bêdá w biochemii oraz takëe swoje miejsce znajdzie w Molekularnych dziedzinach. Dane bêdá przesyôane poprzez neurony do biokomputerów, które w znacznym stopniu przyczyniá siê do rozwoju medycyny jak równieë technologicznym.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"If you can write DNA, you're no longer limited to 'what is' but to what you could make." - Drew Endy
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Si vous pouvez écrire de l'ADN, vous n'êtes plus limité par 'ce qui est' mais par ce que l'on peut faire." - Drew Endy
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Natura jest zawsze mádrzejsza od ludzkich pomysôów." - Antoni Kêpiñski
