TEXT.English: Modern Physics
TEXT.French: Physique moderne
TEXT.Polish: Nowoczesna Fizyka

TEXT.English: [TAB]The turn of the 20th century brought the start of a revolution in physics. This revolution centered around the advent on quantum mechanics and special and general relativity, the two concepts that mark the advent of modern physics. Both of these theories would offer fundamental insights into the universe and the laws the govern it. Quantum mechanics would describe the microscopic nature of matter, while relativity would describe space and time. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1900, Max Planck published his explanation of blackbody radiation. This equation assumed that radiators are quantized, which proved to be the opening argument in the edifice that would become quantum mechanics. By introducing discrete energy levels, Planck, Einstein, Niels Bohr, and others developed quantum theories to explain other anomalous experimental results like the photoelectric effect. The discovery of quantum mechanics in the early 20th century revolutionized physics, and quantum mechanics is fundamental to most areas of current research. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1904, J. J. Thomson proposed the first model of the atom, known as the plum pudding model. In 1911, Ernest Rutherford deduced from scattering experiments the existence of a compact atomic nucleus, with positively charged constituents dubbed protons. The first quantum mechanical model of the atom, the Bohr model, was published in 1913 by Niels Bohr. Sir W. H. Bragg and his son Sir William Lawrence Bragg, also in 1913, began to unravel the arrangement of atoms in crystalline matter by the use of x-ray diffraction. Neutrons, the neutral nuclear constituents, were discovered in 1932 by James Chadwick. [PARAGRAPH:2]One of the most important concepts in modern physics and one which would help usher in quantum mechanics was proposed by Louis de Broglie. Broglie's 1922 doctoral thesis introduced his theory of electron waves. This included the wave-particle duality theory of matter, based on the work of Albert Einstein and Planck. This research culminated in the de Broglie hypothesis stating that any moving particle or object had an associated wave. De Broglie thus created a new field in physics, wave mechanics, uniting the physics of light and matter. Among the applications of this work has been the development of electron microscopes to get much better image resolution than optical ones, because of shorter wavelengths of electrons compared with photon. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1915, Einstein extended special relativity to describe gravity with the general theory of relativity. One principal result of general relativity is the gravitational collapse into black holes, which was anticipated two centuries earlier, but elucidated by Robert Oppenheimer. Important exact solutions of Einstein's field equation were found by Karl Schwarzschild in 1915 and Roy Kerr only in 1963. One part of the theory of general relativity is Einstein's field equation. This describes how the stress-energy tensor creates curvature of spacetime and forms the basis of general relativity. Further work on Einstein's field equation produced results which predicted the Big Bang, black holes, and the expanding universe. Einstein believed in a static universe. He tried, and failed, to fix his equation to allow for this. In 1929, however, Edwin Hubble published his discovery that that the universe is expanding at a possibly exponential rate. This is the basis for understanding that the universe is expanding. Thus, the universe must have been smaller and therefore hotter in the past. In 1933 Karl Jansky at Bell Labs discovered the radio emission from the Milky Way, and thereby initiated the science of radio astronomy. By the 1940s, researchers like George Gamow proposed the Big Bang theory, evidence for which was discovered in 1964; Enrico Fermi and Fred Hoyle were among the doubters in the 1940s and 1950s. Hoyle had dubbed Gamow's theory the Big Bang in order to debunk it. Today, it is one of the principal results of cosmology.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Obecny zakres zainteresowania fizyki uksztaôtowaô siê w XIX i na poczátku XX wieku, równieë wówczas zarysowaô siê podstawowy podziaô fizyki na klasyczne dziaôy: mechanikê, optykê, naukê o cieple, elektrycznoäâ i magnetyzm. Fizyka odkrywajác nowe zjawiska, opisujác je, tworzác teorie pozwalajáce przewidywaâ nowe efekty, staôa siê motorem napêdowym gwaôtownego rozwoju techniki i doprowadziôa do rewolucyjnych zmian cywilizacyjnych. Proces ten trwa do dzisiaj ulegajác, co wiêcej ulega ciágôej akceleracji.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"It is impossible to trap modern physics into predicting anything with perfect determinism because it deals with probabilities from the outset." - Sir Arthur Eddington
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Il est impossible de piéger la physique moderne en prédisant quoi que ce soit avec un déterminisme parfait, car elle traite avec des probabilités d'emblée." - Sir Arthur Eddington
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"W nauce istnieje tylko fizyka, reszta to zbieranie znaczków." - Ernest Rutherford

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modern Physics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratory[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]physique moderne[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]laboratoire[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Modern Seismology
TEXT.French: Seïsmologie moderne
TEXT.Polish: Nowoczesna Sejsmologia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Seismology (from the Greek seismos = earthquake and logos = knowledge ) is the scientific study of earthquakes and the propagation of elastic waves through the Earth. The field also includes studies of earthquake effects, such as tsunamis as well as diverse seismic sources such as volcanic, tectonic, oceanic, atmospheric, and artificial processes (such as explosions). A related field that uses geology to infer information regarding past earthquakes is paleoseismology. A recording of earth motion as a function of time is called a seismogram. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Sejsmologia to dziaô geofizyki zajmujácy siê badaniem trzêsieñ ziemi oraz rozchodzenia siê fal sejsmicznych wewnátrz Ziemi. Polega ona na tworzeniu sieci informacyjnych opartych na obserwacji generacji fal powstaôych wskutek wstrzásów naturalnych górotworu. Obserwujác te fale moëna wyciágnáâ wnioski dotyczáce budowy wnêtrza Ziemi.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Jesuits so dominated the study of earthquakes that seismology became known as the Jesuit Science.'" - Thomas E. Woods Jr.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Les Jésuites ont tellement dominé l'étude des tremblements de terre que la sismologie est devenu connu sous le nom de la science des Jésuites.'" - Thomas E. Woods Jr.
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Chociaë czasem straszliwe trzêsienie ziemi albo niszczycielska burza rodzá we mnie przekonanie, ëe natura jest okrutna, zrozumiaôem, ëe takie wôaänie sá zmienne koleje drogi zwanej losem. Natura równieë wêdrowaôa w poszukiwaniu iluminacji." - Paulo Coelho

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modern Seismology[COLOR_REVERT] allows your Workers to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Modern Mines[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Groundwater Wells[COLOR_REVERT]. It also enhances the production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wells[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offshore Platforms[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]séismologie moderne[COLOR_REVERT] permet à vos ouvriers de construire des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mines modernes[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]puits souterrains[COLOR_REVERT]. Cela améliore le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mines[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]plate-formes pétrolières[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Modern Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre Moderne
TEXT.Italian: Guerra moderna
TEXT.Polish: Nowoczesne Sily Zbrojne

TEXT.English: Modern warfare involves the widespread use of highly advanced technology. This includes digital ballistics computers in tanks, optical sights and laser designators in rockets and assault rifles, and smart bombs as opposed to iron, or "dumb" bombs.
TEXT.Polish: Nowoczesne sily zbrojne uzywaja wysoko rozwinieta technologie.

TEXT.English: "We know now that in modern warfare, fought on any considerable scale, there can be no possible economic gain for any side. Win or lose, there is nothing but waste and destruction." - Lester B. Pearson
TEXT.French: "Nous savons maintenant que dans la guerre moderne, se sont battus sur une grande échelle considérable, il peut y avoir aucun gain économique possible pour n'importe quel côté. Gagner ou perdre, il n'y a rien, mais les déchets et la destruction." - Lester B. Pearson
TEXT.Polish: "Dopóki na swiecie bedzie istnial czlowiek, beda tez wojny." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modern Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Marines[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Paratroopers[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]AH64 Gunships[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hybrid Tanks[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Supercarriers[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]A-10 Thunderbolts[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]guerre moderne[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de recruter des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]marines modernes[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]parachutistes modernes[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]hélicoptères AH64[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chars hybrides[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]super-porte-avions[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]A-10 Thunderbolts[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Motion Pictures
TEXT.French: Mouvement des images
TEXT.Polish: Kinematografia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Motion Pictures is movie-making as an art and an industry, including its production techniques, its creative artists, and the distribution and exhibition of its products. The earliest experiments in photographing movement were made in the late 19th century. Notably, serial photographs of racehorses, intended to prove that all four hooves do leave the ground simultaneously, were obtained (c.1867) in California by Eadweard Muybridge and J. D. Isaacs by setting up a row of cameras with shutters tripped by wires. The first motion pictures made with a single camera were by E. J. Marey, a French physician, in the 1880s, in the course of his study of motion. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1889 Thomas Edison and his staff developed the kinetograph, a camera using rolls of coated celluloid film, and the Kinetoscope, a device for peep-show viewing using photographs that flipped in sequence. Marketed in 1893, the Kinetoscope gained popularity in penny arcades, and experimentation turned to ways in which moving images might be shown to more than one person at a time. In France the Lumière brothers created the first projection device, the Cinématographe (1895). In the United States, similar machines, notably the Pantopticon and the Vitascope, were developed and first used in New York City in 1896. [PARAGRAPH:2]At first the screenings formed part of vaudeville shows and arcades, but in 1902 a Los Angeles shop that showed only moving pictures had great success; soon "movie houses" (converted shoprooms) sprang up all over the country. The first movie theater, complete with luxurious accessories and a piano, was built in Pittsburgh in 1905. A nickel was charged for admission, and the theater was called the nickelodeon. An industry developed to produce new material and the medium's potential for expressive ends began to assert itself. As business increased, the demand for product was met by many new companies incorporated to create the supply. The competition led to many innovations as each company tried to secure continued success and distinguish its product from the rest. Out of these efforts developed the star system, the establishment of dedicated "studios" where the films would be made, and the organization of the filmmaking process into interlocking crafts; the latter became current disciplines such as acting, writing, and directing.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Kinematografia – dziedzina dziaôalnoäci czôowieka zwiázana z produkcjá filmów oraz ich rozpowszechnianiem i wyäwietlaniem w kinach. Przemysô filmowy w poszczególnych krajach okreäla siê mianem "kinematografii narodowej". Wedôug definicji Bataille'a kinematografia jest sztuká poprawnego przekazywania idei drogá nastêpstwa oëywionych obrazó.Do niedawna najwiêkszá kinematografiá narodowá byôa amerykañska zwiázana z wytwórniami w Hollywood. Obecnie najwiêcej filmów na äwiecie powstaje w Indiach. Oärodek kinematograficzny w Bombaju okreälany jest czêsto jako Bollywood. Produkuje siê tam nie tylko najwiêcej filmów, lecz takëe najdôuësze. Ärednio indyjski film trwa okoôo 3 godzin. Filmy indyjskie jednak, ze wzglêdu na ich kulturowá specyfikê znane sá prawie wyôácznie w Indiach. Trzeciá wielká potêgá filmowá staje siê obecnie kinematografia chiñska z oärodkami produkcyjnymi w Hongkongu, Pekinie i Szanghaju. Tylko te trzy kinematografie - amerykañska, indyjska i chiñska, posiadajáce ogromne obszary dystrybucji, sá samowystarczalne tzn, nie potrzebujá dotacji mecenasów pañstwowych i prywatnych. Inne kinematografie narodowe, ze wzglêdu na maôe obszary dystrybucji kinowej i telewizyjnej, sá najczêäciej dofinansowywane przez rzády, fundacje i organizacje spoôeczne lub telewizje publiczne. Tak siê dzieje w Polsce, gdzie istnienie kinematografii narodowej jest uzaleënione od dotacji Polskiego Instytutu Sztuki Filmowej a czasem publicznej telewizji. Zdecydowanie rzadziej produkcja jest finansowana przez telewizje prywatne lub sponsorów.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"A movie is never finished, only abandoned." - George Lucas
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Un film n'est jamais terminé, seulement abandonné." - George Lucas
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Film nigdy nie jest skoñczony, tylko porzucony." - George Lucas

TEXT.English: Mountaineering
TEXT.French: Montagnard
TEXT.Polish: Alpinistyka

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Mountains are not fair or unfair - they are just dangerous." - Reinhold Messner
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La montagne n'est pas juste ou injuste - Elle est juste dangereuse." - Reinhold Messner
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"Berge sind nicht fair oder unfair - sie sind nur gefährlich." - Reinhold Messner
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Góry nie sá uczciwe lub nieuczciwe - one sá tylko niebezpieczne." - Reinhold Messner

TEXT.English: Mountaineering is the sport, hobby or profession of walking, hiking, backpacking and climbing mountains. In Europe it is also referred to as alpinism, while in the Americas the term refers to a particular style of mountain climbing, which involves a mixture of ice climbing, rock climbing, mixed climbing, and where the climbers carry all their loads with them at all times. In the Himalayan regions the style of mountaineering is Expedition. While mountaineering began as attempts to reach the highest point of unclimbed mountains, it has branched into specializations that address different aspects of the mountain and consists of three areas : rock-craft, snow-craft and skiing, depending on whether the route chosen is over rock, snow or ice. All require experience, athletic ability, and technical knowledge to maintain safety.
TEXT.Polish: Alpinistyka posiada dwa albo trzy znaczenia, szersze i wêësze. W pierwszym znaczeniu alpinistyka to kaëda wspinaczka górska uprawiana w Alpach. W sensie potocznym alpinizm to kaëda wspinaczka górska (inaczej wspinaczka wysokogórska) uprawiana w górach wysokich (o rzeébie alpejskiej), ale nie tylko w samych Alpach. Ze wzglêdu na to, ëe Alpy obfitujá w niemal kaëdy rodzaj formacji skalnych i lodowych, oraz na to, ëe wiêkszoäâ technik wspinaczkowych zostaôa zapoczátkowana w Alpach, termin alpinizm w jêz. polskim rozszerzyô swe znaczenie na wszystkie rodzaje wspinaczki górskiej, niezaleënie od tego jak i gdzie siê já uprawia – i choâ po II wojnie äwiatowej rywalizowal w tym ogólniejszym znaczeniu z terminem taternictwo, to tê rywalizacjê wygraô. (Natomiast inne terminy urobione od konkretnych ôañcuchów górskich, takie jak andynizm, himalaizm, a nawet pireneizm, dotyczá wspinaczki ograniczonej geograficznie do konkretnych rejonów.)

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mountaineering[COLOR_REVERT] allows units to cross Peaks and enables the construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Machu Picchu[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Montagnard[COLOR_REVERT] permet aux unités de traverser à travers les montagnes et permet la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Machu Picchu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Mounted Archery
TEXT.French: Tir à l'arc monté

TEXT.English: [TAB]Mounted archery was a defining characteristic of Steppe warfare throughout Central Asia, and throughout the prairies of America after the adoption of the horse, used by peoples including the Scythians, Sarmatians, Parthians, Huns, Bulgars, Magyars, Mongols, Turks, Comanches, and others. It was also adopted by other peoples and armies, notably Chinese and Romans who both suffered serious conflict with peoples practicing horse archery. It developed separately among the peoples of the South American pampas and the North American prairies; the Comanches were especially skilled. Horse archery was also particularly honoured in the samurai tradition of Japan, where mounted archery is called Yabusame. In some places, such as in Germany and Portugal, the crossbow was favoured over composite bow. Horse archery was never widely used south of the Sahara in Africa, where the ecosystem was less suitable for domestic horses. This was presumably due to factors such as the tsetse fly and lack of suitable fodder. Though some African kingdoms south of the Sahara used horses, they were less useful and had a high mortality rate in these regions. [PARAGRAPH:2]The natives of large grassland areas developed mounted archery for hunting, and for war. The buffalo hunts of the North American prairies may have been the most spectacular and best-recorded examples of bowhunting by mounted archers. Since using a bow requires a horseman to let go of the reins with both hands, horse archers need superb equestrian skills if they are to shoot on the move. It is thought that the Ancient Greeks invented the mythical Centaurs as the perfect union of an archer and a fast moving horseman. [PARAGRAPH:2]In battle, horsed archers were typically skirmishers; lightly-armed missile troops capable of moving swiftly to avoid close combat or to deliver a rapid blow to the flanks or rear of the foe. In the tactic of the Parthian shot the horseman would retreat from the enemy while turning his upper body and shooting backwards. Due to the superior speed of mounted archers, troops under attack from horse archers were unable to respond to the threat if they did not have ranged weapons of their own. Constant harassment would result in casualties, morale drop and disruption of the formation. Any attempts to charge the archers would also slow the entire army down.
[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mounted Archery[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archers[COLOR_REVERT].
Nanobotics
TEXT.French: Nano-robotique
TEXT.Polish: Nanoboty

TEXT.English: [TAB]Nanobotics is the technology of creating machines or robots at or close to the microscopic scale of a nanometres. More specifically, nanorobotics refers to the still largely hypothetical nanotechnology engineering discipline of designing and building nanorobots. Nanorobots (nanobots, nanoids or nanites) would be typically devices ranging in size from 0.1-10 micrometers and constructed of nanoscale or molecular components.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Nanoboty (zwany równieë nanorobotami, czy nanitami) to mikro roboty wielkoäci wirusa. Nanity przypominajá mikrostworzonka, które mogá odbudowywaâ, budowaâ itp. W przyszôoäci majá byâ wykorzystywane np. w medycynie do leczenia wad wzrokowych i innych maôych rzeczy. Nanoboty bêdzie moëna ogládaâ tylko pod mikroskopem elektronowym.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The First Law of Nanobotics: The fusion of nanotechnology and biotechnology, now called nanobiotechnology, will result in the complete elimination of the barrier between living and nonliving materials."
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La première loi de Nanobotics: La fusion de la nanotechnologie et la biotechnologie, maintenant appelée la nanobiotechnologie, se traduira par l'élimination complète de la barrière entre les matériaux vivants et non vivants ."
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Kaëda wystarczajáco zaawansowana technologia jest nieodróënialna od magii." - Arthur C. Clarke

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanobotics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nanofactory[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Utility Fog[COLOR_REVERT]. You can also construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nanite Swarm[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Cruiser[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Warmachines[COLOR_REVERT]) and the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SS Docking Bay[COLOR_REVERT] spaceship part.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]nano-robotique[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]nano-usine[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]brouillard utilitaire[COLOR_REVERT]. Vous pouvez aussi construire des[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]essaims de nanites[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]croiseurs à fusion[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fusion[COLOR_REVERT]) et des [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]machines de guerre[COLOR_REVERT]) et le projet de[COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]plate-forme d'arrimage SS[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Nanoelectronics
TEXT.French: Nano-électronique
TEXT.Polish: Nanoelektronika

TEXT.English: [TAB]Nanoelectronics refer to the use of nanotechnology on electronic components, especially transistors. Although the term nanotechnology is generally defined as utilizing technology less than 100nm in size, nanoelectronics often refer to transistor devices that are so small that inter-atomic interactions and quantum mechanical properties need to be studied extensively. As a result, present transistors (such as CMOS90 from TSMC or Pentium 4 Processors from Intel) do not fall under this category, even though these devices are manufactured under 90nm or 65nm technology. [PARAGRAPH:2]Nanoelectronics are sometimes considered as disruptive technology because present candidates are significantly different from traditional transistors. Some of these candidates include; hybrid molecular and semiconductor electronics, one dimensional nanotubes and nanowires, or advanced molecular electronics. The sub-voltage and deep-sub-voltage nanoelectronics are specific and important fields of Research and Development, and the appearance of new ICs operating near theoretical limit (fundamental, technological, design methodological, architectural, algorithmic) on energy consumption per 1 bit processing is inevitable. The important case of fundamental ultimate limit for logic operation is reversible computing.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Historia nanoelektroniki siêga lat 50. XX w. gdy Richard P. Feynman wygôosiô wykôad There's Plenty Room at the Bottom (w wolnym tôumaczeniu Duëo zmieäci siê u podstaw). Rozpoczynajác od wyobraëenia sobie, co trzeba zrobiâ by zmieäciâ 24-tomowá Encyklopediê Britannikê na ôebku od szpilki, Feynman przedstawiô koncepcjê miniaturyzacji oraz moëliwoäci tkwiáce w wykorzystaniu technologii mogácej operowaâ na poziomie nanometrowym. Na koniec ustanowiô dwie nagrody (zwane Nagrodami Feynmana) po tysiác dolarów kaëda. Za wykonanie silnika mieszczácego siê w szeäcianie o boku nie wiêkszym nië 1/64 cala. Wypôacenie pierwszej nagrody byôo dla Feynmana rozczarowaniem, poniewaë wyobraëaô sobie, ëe osiágniêcie postawionych przez niego celów bêdzie wymagaôo dokonania siê przeôomu technologicznego. Nie doceniô jednak moëliwoäci wspóôczesnej mikroelektroniki, bo nagroda zostaôa zdobyta przez 35-letniego inëyniera Williama H. McLellana juë w roku 1960. Jego silnik waëyô 250 mikrogramów i miaô moc 1 mW. Za zmniejszenie strony z ksiáëki do rozmiaru w skali 1/25 000. Strona taka mogôaby byâ przeczytana tylko mikroskopem elektronowym. W 1985 na Uniwersytecie Stanford Thomas Newman odtworzyô pierwszy akapit Opowieäci o dwóch miastach Karola Dickensa w zadanej przez Feynmana skali, wykorzystujác w tym celu wiázki elektronowe. Lata 80. i 90. XX w. to okres gwaôtownego rozwoju technik litograficznych oraz produkcji ultracienkich warstw krysztaôów (technologie MOCVD, MBE). Do waënych osiágniêâ technologicznych zaliczyâ moëna: wykonanie napisu IBM przez dwóch fizyków Donalda M. Eiglera i Erharda Schweizera za pomocá skaningowego mikroskopu tunelowego, uëywajác do tego celu 35 atomów; odkrycie fulerenów; metody wiázek molekularnych i wykorzystanie do tworzenia studni kwantowych, drutów kwantowych i kropek kwantowych; odkrycie i badanie wôaäciwoäci nanorurek.g.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Nanoelectronics technology is improving the way that batteries and motors in electric vehicles are controlled, giving them a longer range on each charge."

TEXT.English: Nanotechnology
TEXT.French: Nano-technologies
TEXT.Polish: Nanotechnologia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Nanotechnology refers broadly to a field of applied science and technology whose unifying theme is the control of matter on the atomic and molecular scale, generally 100 nanometers or smaller, and the fabrication of devices with critical dimensions that lie within that size range.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Nanotechnologia to ogólna nazwa caôego zestawu technik i sposobów tworzenia rozmaitych struktur o rozmiarach nanometrycznych (od 0,1 do 100 nanometrów ), czyli na poziomie pojedynczych atomów i czásteczek.

TEXT.English: Naturopathy
TEXT.French: Naturopathie
TEXT.Polish: Naturopatia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Naturopathic medicine (also known as naturopathy) is a school of medical philosophy and practice that seeks to improve health and treat disease chiefly by assisting the body's innate capacity to recover from illness and injury. Naturopathic practice may include a broad array of different modalities, including manual therapy, hydrotherapy, herbalism, acupuncture, counseling, environmental medicine, aromatherapy, nutritional counseling, homeopathy, and so on. Practitioners tend to emphasize a holistic approach to patient care. Naturopathy has its origins in a variety of world medicine practices, including the Ayurveda of India and Nature Cure of Europe. --Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Naturopatia – leczenie polegajáce na stosowaniu naturalnych metod leczenia t.j. zioôolecznictwa, leczenia dietá, akupunktury, hydroterapii, fizykoterapii i in. oraz wykorzystujáce równieë niektóre praktyki klasycznej medycyny np. diatermiê (rodzaj elektroterapii) stosowaná przy bólach pleców. Terapia naturalna (naturopatia, leczenie domowe) zakôada, ëe organizm ludzki moëe przeciwdziaôaâ chorobie i sam siebie uzdrawiaâ. Naleëy tylko nabraâ odpowiednie nawyki ëywieniowe oraz prowadziâ zdrowy tryb ëycia.

Elle revèle les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bananes[COLOR_REVERT], les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]citrons[COLOR_REVERT], les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]épices[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]pommes[COLOR_REVERT]. TEXT.English: Naval Aviation
TEXT.Polish: Awiacje Morskie

TEXT.English: [TAB]Naval aviation is the application of manned military air power by navies. Naval aviation is typically projected to a position nearer the target by way of aircraft carrier. Carrier aircraft must be relatively sturdy to withstand demanding carrier operations. Carrier aircraft must be able to launch in a short distance and have enough sturdiness and flexibility to come to a sudden stop on a pitching deck; they typically have robust folding mechanisms that allow higher numbers of them to be stored in below-decks hangars. Carrier aircraft are designed with many purposes including air-to-air combat, surface attack, submarine attack, search and rescue, materiel transport, weather observation, reconnaissance and wide area command and control duties. -- wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Awiacje morskie sá stosowaniem powietrznej siôy przez floty. Samoloty Morskie sá typowo projektowane by mogôy startowaâ z lotniskowców . Carrier aircraft must be relatively sturdy to withstand demanding carrier operations. Lotniskowiec musi byâ w stanie wypuäciâ w krótkim czasie samoloty i ma wystarczajáco silná budowê i elastycznoäciá do nagôego zatrzymania huätania pokôadu; they typically have robust folding mechanisms that allow higher numbers of them to be stored in below-decks hangars. Wedôug obecnych kryteriów dzieli siê lotniskowce na uderzeniowe, najczêäciej z napêdem atomowym, lotniskowce äredniej wielkoäci i ämigôowcowce przeznaczone gôównie do przenoszenia ämigôowców i grup szturmowych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Fight on and fly on to the last drop of blood and the last drop of fuel, to the last beat of the heart." - Baron Manfred von Richthofen
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Combattre et voler jusqu'à la dernière goutte de sang et la dernière goutte de carburant, jusqu'au dernier battement de son coeur." - Baron Manfred von Richthofen
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Po co zmuszaâ czyjeä ciaôo do wyskoczenia z samolotu ze spadochronem? Dlaczego czôowiek w ogóle chce lataâ? Ludzie czêsto zadajá te pytania. Niektórzy mówiá bogactwo, siôa, jest wystarczajácym powodem. Ja myälê, ëe ryzyko, które podejmujê jest uzasadnione mojá zwykôá miôoäciá do ëycia." - Charles Lindbergh

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Naval Aviation[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Early Carrier[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Seaplane[COLOR_REVERT] units.
