Wearable computers are especially useful for applications that require computational support while the user's hands, voice, eyes or attention are actively engaged with the physical environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Wearable computing" is an active topic of research, with areas of study including user interface design, augmented reality, pattern recognition, use of wearables for specific applications or disabilities, electronic textiles and fashion design. Many issues are common to the wearables, mobile computing, Pervasive computing, Ambient intelligence and ubiquitous computing research communities, including power management and heat dissipation, software architectures, wireless and personal area networks.[PARAGRAPH:2]One of the main features of a wearable computer is consistency. There is a constant interaction between the computer and user, ie. there is no need to turn the device on or off. Another feature is the ability to multi-task. It is not necessary to stop what you are doing to use the device; it is augmented into all other actions. These devices can be incorporated by the user to act like a prosthetic. It can therefore be an extension of the user's mind and-or body.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Elektroniczne ubrania to komputery, które sá noszone na ciele. Chcá já zastosowaâ do behawioralnego modelowania, systemów monitoringu zdrowia, technologii informacyjnych i rozwoju ärodków przekazu. Wearable computers are especially useful for applications that require computational support while the user's hands, voice, eyes or attention are actively engaged with the physical environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Wearable computing" is an active topic of research, with areas of study including user interface design, augmented reality, pattern recognition, use of wearables for specific applications or disabilities, electronic textiles and fashion design. Many issues are common to the wearables, mobile computing, Pervasive computing, Ambient intelligence and ubiquitous computing research communities, including power management and heat dissipation, software architectures, wireless and personal area networks.[PARAGRAPH:2]One of the main features of a wearable computer is consistency. There is a constant interaction between the computer and user, ie. there is no need to turn the device on or off. Another feature is the ability to multi-task. It is not necessary to stop what you are doing to use the device; it is augmented into all other actions. These devices can be incorporated by the user to act like a prosthetic. It can therefore be an extension of the user's mind and-or body.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog." - Doug Larson
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Les Ordinateurs domestiques sont appelés à exercer de nombreuses fonctions nouvelles, y compris la consommation des devoirs jadis mangés par le chien." - Doug Larson
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Nie znoszê ani nowych ubrañ, ani nowych potraw." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Wearable Computers[COLOR_REVERT] allows building the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Virtual Reality Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] and training [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Fighters[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Stealth[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]ordinateurs portables[COLOR_REVERT] permettent de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]théâtre de réalité virtuelle[COLOR_REVERT] et de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chasseurs modernes[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]furtivité[COLOR_REVERT]).

TEXT.English: Weather Control
TEXT.French: Contrôle météorologique
TEXT.Polish: Kontrolowanie Pogody

TEXT.English: [TAB]Weather control is the act of manipulating or altering certain aspects of the environment to produce desirable changes in weather.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Kontrola pogody jest aktem manipulacji lub zmianá pewnych aspektów ärodowiska by doprowadziâ do porzádanych zmian w pogodzie.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Others are engaging even in an eco-type of terrorism whereby they can alter the climate, set off earthquakes, volcanoes remotely through the use of electromagnetic waves." - United States Secretary of Defense William S. Cohen
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"D'autres se livrent même à une type d'éco-terrorisme par lequel ils peuvent altérer le climat, déclencher des tremblements de terre, des éruptions volcaniques à distance par l'utilisation des ondes électromagnétiques." - Secrétaire de la Défense des USA, William S. Cohen
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Najczêstszy ludzki bôád – nie przewidzieâ burzy w piêkny czas." - Niccolo Machiavelli

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weather Control[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Paradise Garden[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nanite Cloud[COLOR_REVERT]. Your Workers can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Terraform[COLOR_REVERT] terrain and you can create the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Eden Project[COLOR_REVERT]. This technology is also one of the technologies needed to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ascension Gate[COLOR_REVERT] that allows you to win a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scientific Victory[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]contrôle météorologique[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]jardin du paradis[COLOR_REVERT] et la merveille nationale du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]nuage nanite[COLOR_REVERT]. Vos ouvriers peuvent [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]terraformer[COLOR_REVERT] le terrain et vous pouvez créer le [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]projet Eden[COLOR_REVERT]. C'est une des technologies requises pour la construction de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]porte ascensionnelle[COLOR_REVERT] qui permet de remporter une [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]victoire scientifique[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Weather Forecasting
TEXT.French: Prévisions météorologiques
TEXT.Polish: Prognoza Pogody

TEXT.English: [TAB]The trouble with weather forecasting is that it's right too often for us to ignore it and wrong too often for us to rely on it.” - Patrick Young
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le problème avec les prévisions météorologiques, c'est qu'elles sont suffisamment justes pour que nous les ignorions et trop souvent fausses pour que nous puissions compter dessus.” - Patrick Young

TEXT.English: Weather forecasting is the application of science and technology to predict the state of the atmosphere for a future time and a given location.
TEXT.French: La météorologie est l'application de la science et la technologie pour prédire l'état de l'atmosphère pendant un certain temps à venir et un endroit donné.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weather Forecasting[COLOR_REVERT] increases the production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing Boats[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whaling Boats[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]prévision météorologique[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la production des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bateaux de pêche[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]baleiniers[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Weather Lore
TEXT.French: Traditions météorologiques
TEXT.Polish: Wiedza Pogodowa

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weather Lore[COLOR_REVERT] gives your naval units +1 speed and allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ice Storehouse[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]traditions météorologiques[COLOR_REVERT] procurent + de mouvement aux unités navales et permettent de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]entrepot de glace[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Dirty days hath September, [NEWLINE] April, June and November. [NEWLINE] From January up to May [NEWLINE] The rain it raineth every day. [NEWLINE] February hath twenty eight alone, [NEWLINE] And all the rest have thirty-one. [NEWLINE] If any of them had two and thirty [NEWLINE] They'd be just as wet and dirty." - Thomas Hood
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Mauvais temps en septembre, [NEWLINE] Avril, juin et novembre. [NEWLINE] De janvier à mai [NEWLINE] La pluie tombe tous les jours. [NEWLINE] Février a 28 jours, [NEWLINE] et tous les autres 31. [NEWLINE] Si certains en avaient 32 [NEWLINE] Ils seraient soit sec ou humide." - Thomas Hood
TEXT.Polish: "Gdy dwóch Anglików siê spotyka, mówiá przede wszystkim o pogodzie." - Samuel Johnson

TEXT.English: Weather lore is the body of informal folklore related to the prediction of the weather. It has been a human desire for millennia to make accurate weather predictions. Oral and written history is full of rhymes, anecdotes, and adages meant to guide the uncertain in determining whether the next day will bring fair or foul weather. For the farmer wanting to plant crops, for the merchant about to send ships on trade, foreknowledge of tomorrow's circumstances might mean the difference between success and failure. Prior to the invention of the mercury barometer, it was very difficult to gather numerical data of any predictive value. Even though there were devices such as the weather stick which gave some indication of moisture changes, the only instrument of any reliability was human experience.
Weaving
TEXT.Polish: Tkactwo

TEXT.English: Weaving, the art of forming a fabric by interlacing at right angles two or more sets of yarn or other material. It is one of the most ancient fundamental arts, as indicated by archaeological evidence. Discoveries in the early 1990s in the Czech Republic point to an origin in the Paleolithic period some 27,000 years ago. Moreover, the earliest literatures often mention the products of the loom. In primitive cultures weaving was practiced mainly by women.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although weaving sprang up independently in different parts of the world and was early known in Europe, its high development there in the Middle Ages was brought about by Eastern influences operating through Muslim and Byzantine channels of culture. Byzantium became a center of silk weaving in the 6th cent. In the 9th cent. Greece, Italy, and Spain became proficient. In Flanders a high degree of skill was attained by the 10th cent., especially in the weaving of wool. Flemish weavers brought to England by William the Conqueror and later by Queen Elizabeth I gave a great impetus to the craft there, and Lancashire became an important center. Tapestry weaving was brought to a high art in France. In colonial America weaving was a household industry allied with agriculture.[PARAGRAPH:2]The 18th-century weaving and spinning inventions marked the transition from the old era of domestic craftsmanship to the tremendous, organized industry of today. The factory system of machine weaving produces quantities of standardized material for mass consumption; the result is a loss of the distinctive elements of quality and design. Some of the finest silks, velvets, table linens, and carpets are still woven on handlooms.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Tkanie[\BOLD] dzial przemyslu wlókienniczego i rzemiosla zajmujacy sie wytwarzaniem tkanin oraz ich wykonczeniem. Jedno z najstarszych rzemiosl uprawianych przez czlowieka. Jego poczatki siegaja neolitu. Powstaly wtedy najstarsze, pionowe warsztaty tkackie.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]W epoce brazu powstalo i rozwinelo sie tkactwo tabliczkowe i naalbinding. Naalbinding, czyli tkanie igla, ze wzgledu na technike wytwarzania wyrobu zblizona do dziania lub koronkarstwa, nalezy zaliczyc raczej do dziewiarstwa. Poziome warsztaty tkackie jak i pionowe, praktycznie w niezmienionej formie dotrwaly do wspólczesnosci i nadal sa wykorzystywane w mniej rozwinietych regionach swiata lub do tkactwa artystycznego i ludowego. Podobnie prymitywne techniki tkania bardko i tabliczka sa chetnie stosowane w tkactwie ludowym i artystycznym. Surowcami, z których pierwotnie wytwarzano tkaniny byly wylacznie wlókna naturalne, pochodzenia roslinnego - len, konopie, bawelna, pokrzywa i zwierzecego - welna owcza, kozia, wielbladzia, lam. Pózniej opanowano obróbke jedwabiu.

TEXT.English: "Man does not weave this web of life. He is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself." - Chief Seattle
TEXT.French: "L'homme ne tisse pas la toile de la vie. Il n'en est seulement qu'un fil. Tout ce qu'il fait à cette toile, il le fait à lui-même." - Chef Seattle
TEXT.Polish: "Zacznij tkac, a Bóg da ci watek." - przyslowie niemieckie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weaving[COLOR_REVERT] reveals [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT] resources and allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Weaver's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] and train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slinger[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]tissage[COLOR_REVERT] révèle les ressources [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]soie[COLOR_REVERT] et permet de construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]hutte du tisserand[COLOR_REVERT] et de recruter des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]frondeurs[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Wireless Electricity
TEXT.French: Electricité sans fil
TEXT.Polish: Elektrycznoäâ Bezprzewodowa

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wireless energy transfer or wireless power transmission is the process that takes place in any system where electrical energy is transmitted from a power source to an electrical load, without interconnecting wires in an electrical grid. Wireless transmission is ideal in cases where instantaneous or continuous energy transfer is needed, but interconnecting wires are inconvenient, hazardous, or impossible.[PARAGRAPH:2]Though the physics of both are identical, this is distinct from wireless transmission for the purpose of transferring information (such as radio) where the percentage of the power that is received is only important if it becomes too low to successfully recover the signal. With wireless energy transfer, the efficiency is a more critical parameter and this creates differences in these technologies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wireless electric energy transfer for experimentally powering electric automobiles and buses is a higher power application (>10kW) of resonant inductive energy transfer. High power levels are required for rapid recharging and high energy transfer efficiency is required both for operational economy and to avoid negative environmental impact of the system. An experimental electrified roadway test track built circa 1990 achieved 80% energy efficiency while recharging the battery of a prototype bus at a specially equipped bus stop. The bus could be outfitted with a retractable receiving coil for greater coil clearance when moving. The gap between the transmit and receive coils was designed to be less than 10 cm when powered. In addition to buses the use of wireless transfer has been investigated for recharging electric automobiles in parking spots and garages as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some of these wireless resonant inductive devices operate at low milliwatt power levels and are battery powered. Others operate at higher kilowatt power levels. Current implantable medical and road electrification device designs achieve more than 75% transfer efficiency at an operating distance between the transmit and receive coils of less than 10 cm.[PARAGRAPH:2]In November 2006, Marin Soljacic and other researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology applied the near field behavior well known in electromagnetic theory to a wireless power transmission concept based on strongly-coupled resonators. In a theoretical analysis, they demonstrate that, by designing electromagnetic resonators that suffer minimal loss due to radiation and absorption and have a near field with mid-range extent (namely a few times the resonator size), mid-range efficient wireless energy-transfer is possible. The reason is that, if two such resonant circuits tuned to the same frequency are within a fraction of a wavelength, their near fields (consisting of 'evanescent waves') couple by means of evanescent wave coupling (which is related to quantum tunneling). Standing waves develop between the inductors, which can allow the energy to transfer from one object to the other within times much shorter than all loss times, which were designed to be long, and thus with the maximum possible energy-transfer efficiency. Since the resonant wavelength is much larger than the resonators, the field can circumvent extraneous objects in the vicinity and thus this mid-range energy-transfer scheme does not require line-of-sight. By utilizing in particular the magnetic field to achieve the coupling, this method can be safe, since magnetic fields interact weakly with living organisms.
TEXT.Polish: [TAB]Bezprzewodowy prád - nowy sposób dostarczania energii opiera siê na rezonansie magnetycznym, dziêki czemu prád przekazywany jest wyôácznie do urzádzeñ majácych taká samá frekwencjê rezonatora odbiorczego, co éródôo zasilania. Jak zapewnia Sony, "bezprzewodowy prád" ma obecnie 60-procentowá efektywnoäâ i dziaôa nawet, kiedy na drodze znajdzie siê np. metalowy obiekt.Wraz z rozwojem bezprzewodowej metod komunikacji, wielkie firmy coraz czêäciej siêgajá po prototypowe rozwiázania majáce zagwarantowaâ bezprzewodowe przesyôanie energii. Na poczátku tego tygodnia Dell pokazaô äwiatu notebooka Latitude Z, którego moëna ôadowaâ przy pomocy bezprzewodowego panelu.Podobne do Sony rozwiázania pokazaô takëe Intel, powoôujác do ëycia koncepcjê ëarówki dziaôajácej bezprzewodowo. Byô to jednak prototyp i czyste fantazjowanie - natomiast rozwiázanie zaprezentowane przez Sony wydaje siê moëliwe do wprowadzenia w najbliëszych latach, szczególnie biorác pod uwagê, ëe ekologiczne telewizory potrzebujá coraz mniej prádu.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"If it weren't for electricity we'd all be watching television by candlelight." - George Gobel
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"S'il n'y avait pas d'électricité, nous serions tous à regarder la télévision à la chandelle." - George Gobel
TEXT.Polish: [SPACE]"Ze äwiatôem elektrycznym idzie nam doskonale, lepiej nië poczátkowo przewidywaôa moja ëywa wyobraénia. Na czym siê to skoñczy, Bóg tylko wie!" - Thomas Edison

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Wireless Electricity[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Walker Mech[COLOR_REVERT] and build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Holographic Combat Simulator[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Holographic Flight Simulator[COLOR_REVERT]. It also improves the yields of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Watermills[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windtraps[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Desert Windmills[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]électricité sans fil[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]mech marcheurs[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]simulateur de combat holographique[COLOR_REVERT] et un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]simulateur de vol holographique[COLOR_REVERT]. Cela augmente le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]pièges à vent[COLOR_REVERT], et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à vent désertiques[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Woodworking
TEXT.French: Travail du bois
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Drewna

TEXT.English: "A carpenter's known by his chips." - Jonathan Swift
TEXT.French: À l'oeuvre, on reconnaît l'ouvrier

TEXT.English: Wood was one of the first materials humans learned how to work. Early humans used wood for tools, weapons, and art.
TEXT.French: Le bois fut l'un des premiers matériaux que l'humain a appris à travailler. Les premiers hommes l'utilisaient pour les outils, les armes et l'art.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Woodworking[COLOR_REVERT] increases your production through the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carpenter[COLOR_REVERT] building and the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Woodcutter[COLOR_REVERT] improvement. It also allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rams[COLOR_REVERT] for early attacking and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palisades[COLOR_REVERT] for early defense.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]travail du bois[COLOR_REVERT] améliore votre production grâce au [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]charpentier[COLOR_REVERT] et à l'aménagement de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cabane de bûcheron[COLOR_REVERT]. Cela permet également de construire un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bélier [COLOR_REVERT] ou une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]palissade[COLOR_REVERT] pour l'attaque et la défense primitives.
